loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 44-year-old married woman and mother of five children. Hanan is a hard working woman, she started her own business in 2009 when she opened a household appliances retail shop. 

Hanan lives in a Palestinian camp, and she works hard to improve her family's living through improving her business and income. To do so, Hanan applied for a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy new collections and designs attractive to new customers. Hanan loves her business a lot, and she works hard on improving it from time to time. She plans to expand it in the future through adding a new plastics department. 

Hanan is a woman with a very good reputation, she is active and loved by most of her customers. Hanan is experiencing Al Majmoua loans for the first time, and she hopes this experience will sprout impressive results.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise with new household items to sell

loans.name: Cherry Gay

texts.en: Cherry Gay is 31years old, a mother of two children. She is a college graduate but cannot find a better job so she engaged herself in a sari-sari (general) store business. She sells candies, canned goods, sugar, coffee and bread to finance the needs of her family such as electric bills, allowances and foods. She is requesting a loan of P5,000 to buy cooking oil, patis, soy sauce, vinegar and detergent. She will put these goods in her store as additional commodities as the people in the community are always looking for these goods. She hopes that her business will succeed so that she can answer all the needs of her children, especially their education.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, patis, soy sauce, vinegar and detergent

loans.name: Gaudy Group

texts.es:
El grupo Gaudy está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Gaudy de 35 años  quien desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comida rápida. Ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 14  y 5 años los cuales estudian la mayor en sus tiempos libres le ayuda en el negocio.
Las otras integrantes  son Norma de 29 años quien vende fresco y fritanga desde hace 3 años y Karen de 23 años tiene una barbería unisex desde hace dos años aproximadamente.
texts.en:
The "Gaudy" group is made up of 3 hardworking and enterprising people.  One of these is Gaudy, who is 35, and has had a business selling fast food for 4 years.  She is single and has 2 children aged 14 and 5.  Her oldest child is in school and helps her with the business in her free time.  

The other members of the group are Norma, 29, who has been selling fresh and fried foods for 3 years, and Karen, 23, who has had a unisex salon for about 2 years.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, cooking oil, bread, etc.

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Mamusu.  She is married to a farmer and has four children aged 20, 18, 15 and 13 years. In 1991, Mamusu established her household utensils business. She began her business because she realised she needed to help her husband support their family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

Mamusu would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to purchase the following: plastic drums - 6 pieces @ Le720,000, fish pan sets - 6 sets @ Le1, 200,000, big size dish pans - 12 sets @ Le960,000; medium-sized dish pans - 20 sets @ Le600, 000, small-sized dish pan - 30 sets @ Le600,000 and bowl pans - 12 dozen @ Le900,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. 

In the future, Mamusu plans to help her children acquire university education and to build her own shop. She is different from her competitors because of different items with good quality. She serves about 12 customers each day, her business is popular because she has good interpersonal relationships with her customers. She is an honest and hard-working business woman.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase household utensils for resale.

loans.name: Juana Neidi

texts.es:
La señora Juana Neidi y su esposo el señor Filemón se dedica a la fabricación y  la venta de muebles de madera, desde hace doce años. Solicitan el préstamo para comprar materia prima que es madera, clavos, pegamento y pintura especial para la madera, ya que tiene varios pedidos pendientes para entregar, por falta de material no los han podido terminar. 
Doña Juana Neidi aparte de ayudarle a su esposo en el negocio, trabaja en las oficinas del gobierno en las oficinas de administración desde hace tres años con lo que solventan los gastos familiares. 
Con las ganancias que se obtiene el negocio pagaran el crédito. Desean darles lo mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Señora Juana Neidi and her husband, Señor Filemón, have made their living crafting and selling wooden furniture for the last twelve years.  They are requesting the loan to purchase raw materials such as wood, nails, glue and special paint for wood.  They have several orders pending, and because of their lack of materials, they haven't been able to finish the furniture.
Doña Juana Neidi, besides helping her husband with the business, has worked in the government offices in Administration for the last three years.  This work pays for the family's expenses.
They will pay off their loan with the profits from their business.  They hope to give all the best to their daughters.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen is 38 years old and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City. She is married and has 3 children. Karen has a clothing sales business, earning about PHP 5,000 each month. Karen has a requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase fabric for her clothing business. Karen has been a member of PMPC for a year.  In the future, Karen would like to have merchandise to earn money.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for her clothing business

loans.name: Delia Maria

texts.es:
la joven Delia tiene 26 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de san marcos de colon, ahi vive con sus hijos y su esposo, Delia es una mujer luchadora y dedicada a su negocio propio que es la venta de botas, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años, cerca de este lugar hay muchas fincas de ganado y caballos, esto hace que este tipo de calzado tenga buena demanda, tiene clientes que le encargan todas las semanas. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de botas.
Delia trabaja fuerte dia a dia para hacer crecer su negocio y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y para su familia.
texts.en:
Delia is 26 and lives in San Marcos de Colon with her husband and children,  Delia is hardworking and dedicated to her business; she sells boots and has done so for 3 years.  In her region there are many cattle and horse farms, so stylish boots are in high demand.  Every week she receives client orders and this credit will allow her to increase her stock of boots.  
Delia works hard every day to grow her business and to provide a better living standard for her family.

loans.use: to buy cowboy boots

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is a married man and has 5 children. Carlos is 58 years old, residing at San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Carlos owns and operates farm land, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. He has been 4 years in this business. Each month, he earns 40,000 PHP doing this type of work. 

Carlos requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Carlos wants to make improvements to his house and to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel  tiene 54 años es casado vive con la esposa y con los 3 hijos. Vive en el Recinto  Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol hace 22 años.
Miguel Ángel  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz en terrenos propios. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres haciendo deporte.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 54 years old, married and lives with his wife and 3 children. He lives in the Aguas Frías area of Mocache, in the Mocache Canton.

The Communal Bank El Progreso (Progress) is located in the area of Aguas Frías of Mocache, belonging to the canton of Mocache, and in this area are farmers of short-cycle crops such as corn, rice, and beans.

Miguel Ángel has been working for 22 years in agriculture planting corn and rice in his own lot. He buys his products in Mocache and sells them in the Mocache market place. 

He is asking for a loan to buy seed, fertilizer and compost for his crops. The loan money has helped him to expand his income for the use of his family and to invest in seed. His dream is to buy land. He likes to play sports in his free time.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and compost for the crops

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is 34 years old, separated, and has three children.  She lives in Tawi-Tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.  Gena has a fish selling business and earns approximately 2,000PHP a month.

Gena is requesting a loan for 14,900 PHP, which she will use to purchase more fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Gena hopes to buy a fishing boat to earn more income to support her three children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.en:
Maria Jose, 37, came from northern Brazil to try to and improve her life in the big city. She had the idea to start reselling clothes, and with the profit will buy more merchandise. After a time, she wants to assemble her shop in the garage of her residence.

She lives with her husband and two children. Her mother is also coming from the north to live in the house next door, which will help her to settle in the new city.

The money will be used to buy more merchandise in order to increase sales.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like slipper, clothes, and toys

loans.name: Khachik

texts.en:
Khachik repairs and makes electronic devices in his workshop in Gandzak village of Gegharquniq region,. 
He lives with his wife, who is teaching at the local school and two children 17 years old daughter and 6 years old son. 
Khachik used to work with his father, but when he passed away, Khachik decided to continue his father's work with big proud. He receives orders of repairing and making different type of ovens, electrical devices,etc. The requested loan will help Khachik a lot to purchase tools and materials needed for providing his works. He'd be happy to receive lenders support and refresh his tools, so the work would be more effective.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for providing electronic repair works and covering current orders

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en: Felipe Guterrez is a 45 year-old businessman from Manabi, Ecuador with one son. Mr. G. is a homeowner who runs a seafood restaurant in the busy market called Municipal de Bastión Popular. His clientele is mainly locals from the neighborhood. With 11 years of experience at this particular business, he and his wife who also helps run the operation work from 6:00 am until 1:00 pm. Mr. G. needs this loan to be able to buy more seafood and a display case to show off the meals of the day. Don Felipe is a persevering self-starter who loves managing his small seafood restaurant.

loans.use: Purchase display case to show food to street traffic

loans.name: Afruz

texts.en:
Afruz was born in 1968. She is single, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region , settled  on front line in Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village. 
She has sold  clothes for 7 years.
Having borrowed a loan of $400 she bought clothes for children.
The second loan  of $600 she spent to buy clothes for children and women.
Now she applies for a loan of $1000 to repair her shop.

loans.use: To repair her shop

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large market centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Madame B. is a resident of this town and sells cooked rice and stew. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation, and is seeking a Kiva loan of $800.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru:
A. Mahfirat is married and has 6 children. She has had her business for 4 years, 2 of them she is working with Microinvest. She started her business selling groceries. Groceries are delivered by her suppliers. A. Mahfirat is asking for 900$ for increasing her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Asya Lisak, Kiva Volunteer.

Алимова Махфират, замужем и имеет 6 детей. Предпринимательской деятельностью занимается 4 года, из них 2 года работает с Микроинвест. Начинала свой бизнес с продажи продовольственных продуктов. Продукты поставляют ее же поставщики. Алимова Махфират запрашивает 900$ для увеличения своего товарооборота.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Ms. Edith is 25 years old, married and the mother of three children of 7, 5 and 2 years of age. The oldest is going to school already. She lives with her husband and children in a house they acquired two years ago. Edith tells us that some years ago, she and her husband were dedicated to agriculture in a far away town, and decided to move to the city of Villa Elisa, in search of better opportunities for the family, since they were only able to obtain produce for their own consumption. Through great sacrifice and hard work, they managed to buy the house they currently own, where Edith set up her business, in order to contribute to the family income and take care of their little children at the same time. Edith runs a grocery store, where she sells basic needs products, such as sugar, milk, bread, flour, etc.; her business is doing well and she wants to continue growing. Edith wants to incorporate to her stock some canned products, such as tomato sauce, tuna and sardines, and beverages in general, which are in great demand among her clients. She is asking for a $400 loan, to be invested in the purchase of such merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Edith tiene 25 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 7,5 y 2 años. El mayor de sus hijos ya va a la escuela. Edith vive con su esposo e hijos en una casa que adquirieron hace dos años. Edith nos cuenta que hace unos años atrás, ella y su marido, se dedicaban a la agricultura en un pueblo muy lejano, y decidieron venir hasta la ciudad de Villa Elisa en busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia, ya que con la agricultura solo cultivaban para su propio consumo. Tras mucho sacrificio y trabajo, pudieron adquirir la casa que poseen ahora y en donde Edith montó su propio negocio, para poder ayudar con los ingresos y a la vez cuidar de sus hijos que aún son pequeños. Edith tiene una despensa, donde vende productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, leche, pan, harina, etc.; su negocio marcha muy bien y ella desea seguir creciendo. Edith desea incorporar a su stock de mercaderías algunos productos enlatados como salsa de tomates, atún, sardinas y bebidas en general, ya que son muy solicitados por sus clientes; para ello solicita un crédito de $400, que invertirá en la compra de los mismos.

loans.use: purchase of merchandise (canned products and beverages)

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala is a 45-year-old mother who worked as a government teacher for almost ten years. When her mother passed away two years ago, she decided to stay home to care for her sick father. With an unemployed husband, Kalala has had a hard time raising her four children. Her husband worked on their plantation while she stayed home. They sold their crops twice a week, but unfortunately, it was not sufficient to support the entire family as well as cover the cost of medication for her father.

Kalala decided to do something about her situation so decided to earn money to provide her children with an education. She started making ice cake, which quickly rose in demand in the village as well as the village school.

She is a happy mother now - able to put the extra money for her children and have enough left over to make home improvements. She is planning to start another business selling pancakes or popcorn, which will depend on her ability to secure future loans.

loans.use: To buy equipments for her ice cake business

loans.name: Metodi

texts.en: Metodi A. is single. He lives with his parents in the village of Rogozen near Vratza. He is unemployed. Metodi breeds cows as his only source of income. Now he wishes to buy a second cow and that’s why he requests a loan of $750.

loans.use: To buy a second cow

loans.name: Allen's Group

texts.en:
Allen B. is requesting a loan because she wants to buy a baby lock machine in order to improve the services that she proves to customers.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To buy a baby lock machine

loans.name: Raynaldo

texts.es:
Don Reynaldo A. and his wife have 3 children, 7, 13, and 15 years old. 4 years ago don Reynaldo and his wife opened a small neighborhood store and throughout the four years they have gained experience in proper management and therefore the business has grown as well as the variety of stock.

The store generates little income for the family and therefore they wish to invest in merchandise in order to increase sales. With the loan don Reynaldo plans to buy basic grains, soft drinks and candy to offer more variety to the customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Don Reynaldo A. y su esposa tienen 3 hijos de 7, 13 15 años. Don Reynaldo desde hace 4 años tiene una pequeña pulpería que él mismo administra con la ayuda de su esposa. En estos cuatro años ha adquirido experiencia en el manejo de este negocio y es por eso que lo ha ido sacando adelante y ha ido creciendo en artículos que ofrecer.

La pulpería genera pocos ingresos a la familia es por eso que desean invertir más en ella para poderla extender su negocio. Con el préstamo Reynaldo quiere comprar Granos Básicos, gaseosas y golosinas para poder seguir diversificando el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, soft drinks, and candy in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Mrs. Lay N., 44, is married with two school-age children. She and her husband sell coffee and a variety of grocery products, earning about $10 a day in profit. As their business and clientele have expanded, they are requesting a $500 loan from Kiva to purchase more grocery products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo S., 38, is married with four children and works as a rice dealer and a teacher in her village. On average, she makes around $12 per day. Her husband supports the family’s income working as a blacksmith, making approximately three dollars a day. All four children attend school.

She would like to borrow $700 to increase her rice inventory.

loans.use: To purchase rice

loans.name: Rosa Eugenia

texts.en:
Rosa Eugenia B. P. is a busy businesswoman in La Esperanza, a suburb of Trujillo, of La Libertad Region.  From a space she built on to her house, Rosa runs a beauty salon and a call center and sells cosmetics.  Rosa has 8 years of experience managing these businesses.

Rosa is 36 years old and a single mother of 3 children.  Her children mean everything to her so she is happy that she can work from her home where she can also spend time with her family.  She works and saves so one day her children can all attend university.

A member of the community bank Mujeres en Accion II, Rosa is requesting a loan of $225 to repay over 4 months.  She will use the loan to buy new clippers and restock more of her cosmetic products.

loans.use: To buy new clippers and restock more of her cosmetic products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his herd of livestock.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Akram M. is 31 years old. He is married with four children. Two of his children attend a local school and the other two are still too young to attend school. However, Murod says the two older brothers are already teaching the younger ones the basics and they are already looking forward to going to school.

For the last 9 years, Akram has been in the business of baking the national bread called “lepeshka”. Akram is the main bread-winner in the family, but his wife helps him when it is possible. He has someone who supplies him with necessary materials at wholesale prices. Over the years, Akram has found customers who buy in bulk, usually buying the “lepeshka” for their cafes and restaurants. At the same time Akram runs a booth located in the central market of the city.

Today Akram is applying for a loan for the first time. He is planning to purchase ingredients such as flour and coal for baking extra national breads as he has big orders for them.

With this purpose in mind, Akram is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 for the term of 12 months. Akram would like to thank everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing coal and flour required for baking the national bread, “lepeshka”

loans.name: Maria Flora

texts.en:
Maria sells beauty products in the local market in the city of Chimaltenango. She is from a rural and remote village and travels 45 minutes each way by bus to get to the market everyday. She is requesting this loan to invest in more beauty products such as cosmetics, nail polish, and hair care products. This is her first loan from FAPE and she is happy to have the opportunity to invest more in her business, which she has had for six years.

Maria is 30 years old and has three children that are four months, five, and ten years old. Her oldest child is in school, but the others are still too young. She is married and her husband is a baker. Maria dreams of expanding her business so that her children can have better things and more opportunities in life.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Maria tiene una venta de belleza en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Chimaltenango. Ella es de un cantón rural y retirada y viaja en camioneta unos 45 minutos de ida cada día al mercado. Está pidiendo este préstamo para invertir en más productos de belleza como cosméticos, y pintauñas, y productos para el cabello. Este es su primer préstamo de FAPE y está contenta de tener la oportunidad de invertir más en su negocio, que ha tenido por seis años. Maria tiene 30 años y tiene 3 hijos de 10 años, 5 años, y 4 meses. Su hijo más grande está en la escuela, pero los otros todavía están demasiado jóvenes. Es casada y su esposo es panadero. Maria sueña con aumentar su negocio para que sus hijos puedan tener cosas mejores y más oportunidades en la vida.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and other beauty products

loans.name: Anasnda

texts.fr:
Née à Lomé en 1975, Madame K. Anasnda vit actuellement à Kpémé avec trois personnes à  sa charge. Elle exerce le commerce de charbon de bois. C’est d’ailleurs cette activité qui lui procure de revenus. Mariée, madame K. Anasnda veut aujourd’hui aller acheter son charbon au grand nord du TOGO. 

Pour ce faire, elle nécessite un renforcement de moyen financier. Elle espère ce crédit pour satisfaire son rêve. Les bénéfices lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux nombreux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Anasnda K. was born in 1975 in Lomé. She is married. Now she and her three dependents live in Kpémé. She is in business of selling wood charcoal. This business is her main and only source of income. Anasnda wants to buy charcoal in the north, in TOGO. For this purpose she would like to obtain a loan. She hopes that this loan will help her achieve her goal of improving her family's financial situation.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reselling charcoal.

loans.name: Leli

texts.es:
La señora Leli pertenece al Banco Comunal “La  Lupuna”, ubicado en el AA.HH La Telefónica  Mz.A Lt.47, distrito de Yarinacocha del departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja en la extracción de madera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de  Manuela Ramos de S/ 300.00, decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 4 años en el banco comunal de Manuela Ramos.  

En la actualidad se dedica a la cosmetología (corte de cabello, ondulaciones, peinados), también vende gaseosas, hielo y otros. 
  
Con este préstamo de S/.2,000 el cual será cancelado en 5 meses, comprará 3 espejos, 5 frascos de liquido, 4 tijeras, 1 máquina peluquera y 1 docena de peines para ampliar mejor el negocio 

Leli se volvió una mujer trabajadora con ganas de seguir adelante por el bienestar de sus hijos y está muy contenta de pertenecer al banquito de Manuela Ramos y por el apoyo que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Leli belongs to the Communal Bank “La Lupuna,” located at AA.HH La Telefónica Mz.A Lt.47, Yarincocha district, Ucaylai state. She is 35 years old, married, her husband works as a lumber cutter. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/ 300.00 she decided to invest in selling food. She has been a member of the Manuela Ramos communal bank for 4 years. Today she is a cosmetologist (she cuts hair, perms, hair styling), she also sells beverages, ice and more. With this loan for S/.2,000 which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 3 mirrors, 5 bottles of liquid, 4 scissors, 1 hair dryer and 1 dozen combs to expand and improve her business. Leli turned into a hard working woman with the desire to be successful for the benefit of his children and she is very content to belong to the small bank through Manuela Ramos and for the support it has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy mirrors, scissors, hair dryer, combs, etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Sao Yin Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sao Y. is the group leader of four who all live in Sre Uk village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who now faces a small problem because her field now is infertile. To solve this problem, Mrs. Sao Y. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizers to support her field to make a better crop. Her husband, Mr. Soem Ren, helps her in the plantation. Mrs. Sao Y. is 36 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending the local school. (Mrs. Sao Y. did not come to accept the loan but her husband did so he present in the picture).

All the members in this group have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to support her field to make a better crop.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 58 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, tiene tres hijos dentro su matrimonio que alegran su existencia. Desde muy niño la actividad que predominaba en su casa era la agricultura, ahora, desde hace un año está en el negocio de procesar plátanos verdes. Todas las mañanas, muy temprano, se va a diferentes chacras a comprar plátanos verdes, en sus propias tierras siembra café, que nunca le ha fallado. Lo que más le agrada es realizar el proceso de maduración de los plátanos, dice una vez que los baña en el líquido de maduración, los tiene que envolver para que maduren y después de una semana ya estarán listos para que se puedan promocionar en el mercado. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará una salchipapera para preparar salchipapas, platillo que consta en freír papas y salchichas, captando así, ingresos adicionales para su economía.
texts.en:
Manuel is 58 years old and is married with 3 children - who are the joy of his life. From the time he was very young, the main business of his family was agriculture. Now, since one year ago, he has been in the business of processing green bananas to ripen them faster. Every morning, very early, he goes to buy green bananas. On his own land he grows coffee, which never lets him down. But he appreciates the process of ripening the bananas in the special liquids, then one week later they are ready for sale in the market. This is his first loan with MFP. With the money, he will purchase a cart for preparing fried potatoes and sausages, which will provide additional income for him.

.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cart for frying sausages and potatoes

loans.name: Queta

texts.es: Queta tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos, de los cuales vive solo con 2 de ellos, la mayor está estudiando en una universidad en la ciudad de Lima. Cuando Queta se casó su esposo trabajaba para una empresa, pero hace 12 años atrás lo liquidaron, entonces decidieron comprar una casa en la provincia de Tarma y luego poner un restaurante, y ella es la encargada de poner la sazón, va muy bien, le es muy rentable, hace 6 años decidió implementar en la otra parte de su casa una fuente de soda, en esto demoró en coger clientela, pero igual, esta viendo que ya le es rentable. En ciertas oportunidades, sobre todo cuando se trata de fiestas patrias o en la semana santa le va súper bien. Las dificultades que tiene es cuando le falta dinero para enviarle a su hija que está estudiando. Es su 5to préstamo de Microfinanzas Prisma. Este dinero lo invertirá en su fuente de soda y considera que será suficiente para acrecentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Queta is 51 years old, married and has three children of which two still live with her. Her oldest daughter is studying at a university in Lima. When Queta got married her husband worked for a company, 12 years ago he lost his job at which point they decided to buy a house in the province of Tama and open a restaurant there. She is in charge of establishing the particular flavor of the place, the business is doing well and is very profitable. Six years ago, they decided to open a soda shop in another section of the house. This took a while to catch on with the customers but it is becoming profitable. On certain occasions, especially on federal holidays or during holy week they do especially well. Her problems arise when she does not have enough money to send to her daughter who is in school. This is the fifth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. This money will be invested in the soda fountain business and she thinks it will be enough to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the soda fountain business

loans.name: Kattia

texts.es: Kattia tiene 23 años, es casada y tiene una pequeña hija. Desde muy joven se caracterizó como una muchacha muy trabajadora y dedicada a sus obligaciones como agricultora, hace 2 años que se casó, y no deja de identificársele como una de las mejores agricultoras de su zona, ya que sus horas de dedicación a sus tierras comienzan desde muy temprano, sale a regar y abonar su terreno si es que es necesario, por lo general el regadío es indispensable y muy  beneficiosos para su producción de papa, sin embargo, la dificultad es el cambio de clima, las heladas pueden perjudicar mucho sus sembríos. Kattia está en su primer ciclo de préstamo con MFP, y como nueva trata de ser muy amistosa y colaboradora para con las personas de su banco comunal. Ahora requiere mejorar la producción de sus cultivos y por ello invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes, para que el clima no dañe sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Kattia is 23 years old, married, and has a young daughter. Ever since she was very young she has been a very hard worker and has worked as a farmer. She has been married for 2 years and is still known as one of the best farmers in her area. She begins her work at a very early hour to irrigate and fertilize her land as needed. This hard work is very beneficial for the yield of her potato crop. Nevertheless, the changes in weather can be very trying and the frosts can damage the crops. Kattia is in her first loan cycle with MFP and has been very friendly and cooperative with the people at her community bank. She would like to increase the production of her crops and will invest the loan proceeds in fertilizers so that the weather changes do not harm her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Mrs. Sreng S. is a villager in Chress village in Kampong Speu province. She and her husband, Mr. Im Tom, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Even though they try to work hard, they still do not have much money to support their family. In order to improve the living, Mrs. Sreng S. decided to ask for a loan to buy palm sugar to start a new business. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family. She is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy palm sugar to start a new business.

loans.name: Eufemio Nicolas

texts.es: Eufemio tiene 46 años de edad, reside en laureles sur, en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa es ama de casa, con tres hijos  que estudian,   don Eufemio es albañil desde hace veinte años, inicio como ayudante ahora con la experiencia trabaja por cuenta propio y sus ingresos son mejores, esta es su décima solicitud en la que va invertir en la compra de una computadora para el estudio de sus hijos, lo cual espera sea de muchos beneficios para la superación y aprendizaje de sus hijos, da las gracia a Afodenic ya que con estos prestamos ha salido adelante y espera seguir trabajando y cumplir sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Eufemio is 46 years old. He lives in South Laureles in the city of Managua. He lives with his wife, who is a stay-at-home-mom and his three children who are still in school. Eufemio has been a mason for the last 20 years. Beginning as an assistant, he now has the experience to work for himself and his income is better. This is the tenth time that Eufemio has requested a loan and this time he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of a computer for his children to use for their school work. He knows that his children would be able improve their educations and learn more by having access to a computer at home. Eufemio is thankful for Afodenic since he has been able to improve his lifestyle. He hopes to continue working and meeting his goals.

(Translated by Tom of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer for his children to use for schoolwork.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 47 años, vive en la casa que heredó de su madre junto a su esposo y a su hijo con quienes se muestran como una familia muy trabajadora e involucrada con el bienestar de todos. Desde muy joven le encantaba la cocina, ya que era el lugar donde mayor tiempo pasaba con su madre, quien le enseñó las recetas que poco a poco fue aprendiendo y con el paso de los años fue creando sus propios ingredientes, hasta que un día se dio cuenta que sus dones estaban perfilados a hacer de ella una experta cocinera; y empezó con la venta de comida. Esta actividad tiene sus ventajas como trabajar dentro de su hogar, pero en contraste está el enorme sacrificio que tiene que realizar cuando hay que trasladar los alimentos y pedidos a otros lugares alejados, pues las largas horas llegan agotarla demasiado. Es por ello que desea dedicarse paralelamente a la compra y venta de automóviles, pues ella y su pareja descubrieron que es un negocio muy rentable y no requiere de esfuerzo físico, sino de capacidad de negociación. Yolanda es fiel a MFP, viene trabajado hace 3 años con la institución y tiene la intención de seguir haciéndolo, junto a su grupo, pues su integración es muy favorable. Invertirá 1000 soles en la compra de utensilios de cocina, los que requiere para mejorar la atención a sus clientes e incrementar la cantidad de porciones que vende.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 47 years old and lives with her husband and son in the house that she inherited from her mother. They are a hardworking family who cares about the wellbeing of everyone. Yolanda has always loved cooking, since she spent a lot of time with her mother in the kitchen while growing up. Her mother slowly taught her all of the recipes and over the years she began adding her own ingredients. One day she realized that she had a gift for cooking and she began to sell her food. The advantage of her job is that she gets to work from home, but it is also an enormous sacrifice to transport her food orders to faraway places. The long hours are very tiring for her. Because of this she decided to also begin working in buying and selling automobiles. She and her husband discovered that this is a very profitable business that does not require a lot of physical strength but rather a capacity for negotiation. Yolanda is loyal to MFP—she has been working with them for 3 years and intends to continue doing so, along with the other members in her group. She will invest 1,000 soles in kitchen supplies that she needs in order to improve her service for her customers and increase the amount of food that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kitchen supplies

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy A. is 33 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school, while the youngest is still breastfeeding. She is supportive of her loving husband, an electrician, who wires people's houses with hydroelectric power. She lives at Elmina, a coastal area in the central region of Ghana. Dorothy is hardworking, trading in fresh fish and hawking ladies' underwear. She buys the fresh fish from fishermen and sells them by the seashore to her loyal customers. Dorothy has been selling fish for seven years now. She manages to combine her two businesses by ascertaining when the market is good for her varied products. She says the catch of fish has dropped drastically, which has increased the cost of fish in the market place. She requests a loan to buy more fish. With the loan, she believes that she can be more of a resource to support her husband in taking care of their family. Dorothy belongs to a village bank called Holy Cross.

loans.use: To buy fish and ladies' clothing for sale

loans.name: Bidhya

texts.en:
Bidhya T. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati. Sainbu-Bhaishipati is located in the Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural work. 
Mrs. Bidhya T. lives in a single family home. She has four members including herself in her family. Her husband, Mr. Tulshi T., works in a private office. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 9 and her daughter is in grade 5. 
Mrs. Bidhya T. is engaged in poultry farming. She buys small chickens and sells them after 50 to 60 days to the dealers. She already has taken her first loan from Kiva for the same business and has already cleared her first loan. Now she is requesting a loan of Rs 30000.00 to buy small chickens for her business.
She decided to engage in this business to change the living standard of her family. She wants to provide a better education for both of her children.

loans.use: To buy small chickens

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil is a 47 year old married man with two children living in Zouk Mosbeh, Mount Lebanon. He is in the drawing business; he plans and then executes the requested drawings. Today, Kamil would like to borrow $1,200 to further improve his business by purchasing a machine to draw and then execute the shapes requested on different fabrics.

loans.use: To purchasing a drawing machine.

loans.name: Uriel Antonio

texts.es: El joven Uriel Antonio A. M., tiene la edad de 23 años, habita en el barrio Planes del Arenal, ubicado en el municipio de Nindirí, junto a su esposo , el cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo un hijo de tres año de edad , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , el desde hace cinco años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y la sequilla que le ha afectado en gran parte , su objetivo a un futuro es poder establecer diversas hortalizas . Con el financiamiento va a comprar semillas e insumos para comenzar a sembrar la cosecha,  lo cual espera tener una buena producción y poder vender a mejor precio en el M..
texts.en:
Uriel Antonio A. M. is a 23-year old young man who lives with his wife in the neighbourhood of Planes del Arenal located in the municipality of Nindirí. His wife also works to help him with household expenses. They have a 3-year old son to look after, and they would like to improve their standard of living. For five years Uriel has worked in agriculture. The biggest problem he faces is the lack of credit and the drought which has seriously affected his crops. In the future he would like to diversify and grow a variety of vegetables. With the loan he will buy seeds and agricultural products so he can begin planting his fields. He hopes to have a good harvest and sell his crops for a better price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and agricultural products to improve his fields

loans.name: Las Conquistadoras Group

texts.es: El Grupo “Las Conquistadoras” esta conformado por doce socias que en su mayoría radican en la zona D. kiswaras y se encuentra representado por la señora Virginia. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la costura D. prendas D. vestir, elaboración D. prendas tejidas a mano y a la venta D. comida, abarrotes y repuestos para vehículos. La competencia en el rubro al cual se dedican es alta pero las socias saben como salir adelante con esfuerzo y ganas D. salir adelante. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. materia prima y herramientas que ayuden a realizar un producto terminado más atractivo para el mercado en la cual se desenvuelven. Las socias se encuentran cursando su quinto ciclo por lo que cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios y demostrando solidez, responsabilidad y ganas D. trabajar para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida.
texts.en:
The "Las Conquistadoras" (the conquerors) group is maD. up of 12 partners that mainly live in the kiswaras region and is represented by Miss Virginia. Most of the partners are dedicated to sewing clothes, knitting hand maD. articles, and selling food, groceries and car parts. The competition in the sectors that they work in is hard but the partners know how to succeed with their will and effort. The use of the financing will be for the purchase of raw materials and tools that help them make a more attractive finished product for the markets where they compete. The partners are currently in their fifth cycle so they have experience in solidarity groups and they have shown they are solid, responsible and willing to work to proviD. their family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Tiara

texts.en:
Tiara T., 23, is married with no children.Tiara's husband is a mechanic and he has been doing this business for years.

Tiara has one year of experience in the engineering business. She sells to the village people, to friends, relatives and to the public six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (~300 USD). She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Tiara’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase mechanical machines and a compressor

loans.name: Nadir Mariela

texts.es: Nadir habita junto a sus padres en la comarca La Peña, Tecolostote, desde muy pequeña sus padres la han orientado al trabajo productivo donde ha venido obteniendo experiencia con el culivo, lo que le brinda ingresos que le permiten apoyar a sus padres en el hogar, su principal motivacion de futor es ser socia del trillo arrocero, lo que seguro le traera beneficios a su familia y en su caracter personal le permitira aprovechar mejor los rendimientos de sus cosechas de arroz.
texts.en:
Nadir lives with her parents in the La Pena district of Tecolostote. Since she was very small her parents have guided her towards productive work through which she has obtained experience in cultivation. This offers her income which permits her to support her parents in the household. Her principal goal for the future is to be a partner in a rice thresher, which is sure to bring benefits to her family and will permit her to make better use of their harvests of rice.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contribution of 30% of the cost of a rice thresher

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 42-year-old married man with three children. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1999 servicing the neighboring villages.

Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,000 to perform maintenance on his car.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Jasmin Janeth

texts.es: La señora Jasmín Janeth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Laureles II”, Distrito de Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 25 años, 02 hijos que aun depende de ella.Jasmín Janeth, lleva un buen tiempo dedicándose al trabajo de tejidos, siempre le aficiono los tejidos y le encanta hacer estas manualidades. Para iniciarse mas a fondo en este negocio, decidió sacar un prestamo la cual Manuela Ramos la apoyo y poco a poco fue haciéndose conocida.En la Actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y ahora ya tiene una clientela fija que mes a mes realizan sus pedidos, ya que ella trabaja así y como también va ofreciendo a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos, le va muy bien y mensualmente genera sus propios ingresos y con el carisma que tiene sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca.Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará materiales para realizar sus manualidades como: hilos tren, lanas, en docenas y diferentes colores y algunas telas para adornar sus acabados.Jasmin, se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, feliz por que en su negocio le va muy bien. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Jasmín Janeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Laureles II”, which is located in the District of Banda de Shilcayo, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 25 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 dependent children. Sra. Jasmín Janeth has a good time embroidering because she has always enjoyed making things by hand. She used a loan from Manuela Ramos to start her business and over time developed a good reputation for the quality of her work. Her business continues to operate and she has a regular clientele who place their orders every month. She also sells to her friends, relatives, and neighbors. Her sales have been good and have resulted in profits every month. Because of her charismatic personality, many of her sales have resulted from word of mouth.

With her loan of 1000 soles, Sra. Jasmín Janeth will purchase handicraft materials such as thread, different colors of wool, and fabric for adorning edges. She is happy with what she has accomplished and that her business continues to do well. Sra. Jasmín Janeth thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and also for the support they give other women who want to develop as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handicraft materials

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a member of the Active borrower group in Sakina, Arusha. She is 48 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 27 years old.

Ester has owned a food business selling potatoes, tomatoes for 5 years, she works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 250,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Ester`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more fruits, potatoes, tomatoes.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Ester hopes to save money and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more frits, potatoes, tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Hog raising is the chosen business wants to manage by Flordeliza N.. She is asking to avail the amount of PHP5, 000 from the KIVA lenders for the maintenance of her business. She hopes also to improve her hog raising activity with the financial assistance of the lenders and be able to give her children a good future by sending them to school. 

Flordeliza is from the village of San Juan Quezon, Isabela. She has four children and she is married to Domingo N. who is a farmer. Managing her hog raising business is already of big help to her husband providing their family necessities. They help each other in providing the financial needs of their children as they are pursuing their studies. She hopes that someday, with their hard works and perseverance, they will not just provide their children education but also sustain their livelihood for their future use.

loans.use: additional business capital

loans.name: Lube Maria

texts.es:
Lube es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo, tiene su chacra de frutas que vende, los camiones llegan  bien temprano para cargar las frutas y ella tiene que supervisar, también lleva cajas de fruta a su casa y lo vende entre sus vecinas  
Lube ha pedido  un préstamo de 1200 soles, siempre tiene que comprar  insecticidas, abono, para una buena cosecha  de frutas.
Lube tiene dos hijos que estudian y quiere que sean profesionales, por eso trabaja desde muy temprano, su esposo la apoya, ahora él se encarga de manejar la moto-car (motocicleta adaptada para el transporte de 2 o 3 personas) que ellos tienen, antes lo manejaba otra persona.
El sueño de Lube es crecer más en el negocio y tener un negocio mas tranquilo, como una bodega.

loans.use: insecticidas y abono

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth C., 50, who lives and does business in Parola, Binondo, Manila. She lives with her husband, Dionisio, an electrician helper, and their only child amongst the poor families in this shanty town.

Elizabeth has a food stall in a nearby market selling vegetables, spices and seasonings. Her child helps her wait on buying customers. She earns 20,000 PHP a month, which she saves to be able to buy a cargo vehicle she can use to purchase her items from the vegetable depot.  

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005.  Elizabeth is now on her 16th loan cycle. She is requesting a new loan from the cooperative in the amount of 29,000 PHP as additional capital. With this new additional capital, she can purchase more assorted vegetables for her business.

She hopes to acquire another food stall in a neighboring market. 



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables and seasoning

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is currently in the business of selling cassava and potatoes and is requesting a loan to purchase bags of beans and pulses to sell. Mary is 30 years-old and is married with a husband that is a farmer . She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of beans and pulses to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Thach Pen Village Bank Group

texts.en: A village bank loan consists of nineteen people who all live in Pou Thum village in Kandal province. Mrs. Thach P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who grows bananas. She now faces a small problem in this business because she does not have enough money to support the banana tree, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Tes S., helps her with the farming. Mrs. Thach P. is 52 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are laborers.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza A. is 37 years old, married and has three children. The difficult circumstances and hardships of her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. 

For about 10 years, Firuza has been purchasing young sheep in the local market, fattening them, and then selling them at local markets. Firuza is a very hardworking woman and her diligence is incredible. She works with strength worthy of immense admiration. She has always looked for a way to be an important protagonist by providing extra income for her family. Thanks to her business, she is able to support her three children's education. Firuza wants to continue educating them because she hopes that they will reach the goals she laid out for herself. 
For this purpose, she is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN to buy small sheep in order to expand her business. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live. Your generosity can change lives.

loans.use: To purchase small sheep

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” desde hace 4 años atrás, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió secundaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de repuestos de carro.

Rosa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  liquido, grasa, frenos, pernos, crucetas.

Su sueño para el futuro es formar una microempresa automotriz y que sus hijos sean profesionales. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro que gana y la puntualidad que existe en el grupo
texts.en:
For the past 4 years, Mrs. Rosa has been a member of the “La Juleñita” communal bank is the Juli district of the Chucuito province in the department of Puno. She is 34 years old, married with 3 children. She finished secondary school and now buys and sells spare automobile parts. Rosa tells us that with her first loan from the “Movimiento Manuela Ramos”, a loan of 300 Nuevos soles, she was able to increase her capital. She is soliciting a loan of 2000 Nuevos soles which she will use to buy brake fluid, oil, brakes, and bolts. Her dreams for the future is to start a small automotive business and that her children become professionals. The things she most likes about her communal banks is the savings she earns and the punctuality that exists in the group.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy brake fluid, oil, brakes, and bolts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Mireya Lourdes

texts.es:
Mireya L. de 38 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento pero solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico, su esposo es maestro de contabilidad con el tiene 4 hijos de 18,16, 12 y 6 años de edad.

Mireya comenzó haciendo un estudio de mercado en el sector de donde vivía, al momento de darse cuenta que una papelería era rentable empezó con cuadernos, plumas, hojas.

Ahora Mireya trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00 todos los días, vende un aproximado mensual de 3 pacas de cuadernos, 100 láminas, 20 cajas de lápices, plumas, marcadores etc. Una las dificultades que tiene son los racionamientos de energía del gobierno.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, laminas, lápices y otros suministros para agrandar el negocio. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y poner sucursales de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mireya L., 38, lives on the outskirts of the Ecuadorean city of Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement but she only has a rudimentary electric service. Her husband teaches accounting and they have 4 children, 18-, 16-, 12- and 6-years old.

Before Mireya started her business, she studied the market in her neighborhood and realized that a business supplying products such as notebooks, pens and paper was profitable.

Mireya now works every day from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m., selling around 3 packs of notebooks; 20 boxes of pencils, pens, paper, markers, etc per month. One of the difficulties she facies is government energy rationing.

Mireya will use the loan to buy notebooks, paper, pencils and other supplies that will help her to grow her business. In the future, she hopes to expand the business and open additional stores.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Marcia Argentina

texts.es:
Desde hace 18 años, en el departamento de León, la señora Marcia M. se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa ofrecida a sus clientes que con mucha satisfacción le visitan en su tramo donde diariamente apertura desde muy tempranas horas en la mañana.
La señora Marcia está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de la ropa de todo tipo para proseguir ofreciéndola ya que actualmente le urge adquirir la mercadería para satisfacer a sus clientes que le visitan y por esta razón espera ser beneficiada con el crédito para el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcia M. has sold clothing for the past 18 years in León department. Her customers very satisfactorily visit her space daily from very early in the morning when she opens up for business. Marcia is asking for funding to buy all kinds of clothing to offer because it's urgent to buy stock items so that she can meet her customers's needs. She hopes to be favored with the loan for the improvement of her family's and her own living condition.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es: Este cliente esta ubicado en la comunidad de telica y realiza esta actividad como mayor apollo a los ingresos al hogar para mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
This customer lives in Telica and is engaged in this activity to produce household income in order to attain a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Duch

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a local rice farmer. She is 29 years old and is married with three children, all of whom are going to school. A source of family income comes from her husband who works as internal staff for a hotel.

The current income S. and her husband earn is not adequate to cover all their family's daily living expenses. S. desires to pursue another business by investing in pig-raising. Because she doesn't have capital yet to start this process, she requested a loan of $500 to buy piglets to begin raising.

loans.use: To buy piglets to begin raising

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mrs. Asha M. lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur, Nepal. Sanepa is one of the busiest bazaars of Lalitpur and most of the residents in this region are engaged in small business.

Mrs. M. has four children, two daughters and two sons. All of her children are now studying. Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop four years ago. She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, pulses (legumes), biscuits and noodles in her shop. Her children also help her in her work. The demand for grocery goods is increasing in her area, so she is requesting a loan of NPR 20,000 to buy grocery items to meet the demand.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua B. is married and has four children. She has received a junior high education.  Efua goes to Techiman to buy bags of maize to sell at Akotokyire. Her husband is a cleaner.  Efua uses her income to help her husband to sustain the family. Efua will add the loan to her initial capital to buy more bags of maize to resell to her demanding customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Mrs. Som P. is a 55 year-old widow mother. She currently takes care of two kids who are teenagers and employed. To make a living, Som P. sells different types of vegetables from her rented store at the local market. She sells to people who come to buy ingredients for their cooking and usually generates about $5 each day. She is very busy at her business activity because she has many clients needing to buy her vegetables. In addition, she also grows some vegetables on the land she owns.

Som P. is taking out her loan to buy a pump to irrigate her crops. With any remaining cash from the loan, she will buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy a pump to irrigate her crops.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence L. is from the village of Brgy.Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Florence owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. Florence has been involved in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Florence joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florence is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Florence from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Shamen Gul Group

texts.en:
Shaperay is the group leader of Shamen Gul Group. She lives in 15th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and lives in a household of five members, her four children being students at secondary and high schools.

Shaperay wants to take a loan for her husband’s stationery shop business where he sells different kinds of pens and notebooks. He needs the loan to purchase more stationery, especially items which are not currently available in his shop. He hopes to expand his business as soon as possible.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her husband's stationery store

loans.name: Puerta Del Cielo Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO SE LLAMA  “PUERTA DEL CIELO” ESTA INTEGRADO DE TRES SEÑORAS, LA RAZON POR EL CUAL LE DIERON ESE NOMBRE ES POR UN CAMINO LEJANO LLAMADO ASI. 
DOÑA  ANTONIA H.  L. ES ORIGINARIA DE LA COLONIA JUAN SABINES MUNICIPIO DE COPAINALA CHIAPAS, ELLA SE ENTERO DEL PROGRAMA POR PERSONAS DE SU COLONIA EL CUAL LE INTERESO MUCHO.

ANTONIA H., FORMO ESTE GRUPO CON SU COMADRE MARGARITA G. R. Y DOÑA MARIA MARLENE G. H. QUIENES TIENEN ACTIVIDADES DIFERENTES. 

ELLA SOLICITO EL PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR COCOS Y VENDERLO EN AGUA DE HORCHATA, DONDE NECESITA INGREDIENTES COMO: AZUCAR, LECHE Y CANELA, PARA PREPARARLO.TAMBIEN CUENTA CON EL APOYO DE SU ESPOSO DON REY DAVID VAZQUEZ FARELO QUIEN SE EN CARGA DE  SALIR A VENDERLO.

 LA SEGUNDA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO, MARGARITA G. R.  QUIEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA, COMO SON: PANTALONES, PLAYERAS, BLUSAS Y CAMISAS, ENTRE OTROS. Y SU COMPAÑERA LA SEÑORA MARIA MARLENE G. H. EN EL COMERCIO DE PRODUCTOS AGRICOLAS.

 DOÑA ANTONIA SE SIENTE FELIZ Y CONTENTA YA QUE LE A BENEFICIADO MUCHO EN LA COMPRA DE MAS PRODUCTO.
 COMENTA LA SEÑORA ANTONIA QUE HASTA EL MOMENTO NO HA TENIDO NINGUNA DIFICULTAD YA QUE SU ESPOSO SE VA A VENDERLO EN EL PARQUE DE COPAINALA CHIAPAS QUE  QUEDA A CINCO MINUTOS DE LA COLONIA DONDE ELLA VIVE.

SU SUEÑO MAS HERMOSO ES SEGUIR TRABAJANDO CON EL CREDITO, AHORRAR Y TENER LO NECESARIO PARA APOYAR A SUS NIETOS EN SUS ESTUDIOS.
texts.en:
The Puerta del Cielo ("Heaven's Gate") group is made up of three women, who have called their group after a road of the same name. Antonia H. L. comes from the Juan Sabines district in the town of Copinala Chiapas. She was very interested when she heard about the programme from people in her neighbourhood. Antonia H. formed the group with her god-daughter, Margarita G. R., and Maria Marlene G. H.. Each of the three are in diifferent lines of work. Antonia is seeking the loan to buy coconuts, to sell along with horchata (a local soft drink), for which she needs ingredients such as sugar, milk and cinnamon. She will also have the support of her husband, David Vazquez Farelo, who will go out and sell them. The second member of the group, Margarita G. R., sells clothes, including trousers, T-shirts, shirts and blouses among other things. The third member of the group, Maria Marlene G. H., sells agricultural supplies. Antonia is happy and content that she has already benefited by investing in products such as these. She says there has been no difficulty with her husband going out and selling them in the park in Copinala Chiapas, which is just five minutes from their home. Her most treasured dream is to keep working with this loan, and save up so she can help her grandchildren through school.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coconuts and ingredients such as sugar, milk and cinnamon

loans.name: Hong Leng's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Hong Leng H. is 36 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its nineteen members who are located in Kraom village, Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use the loan to support their different purpose.

Mr. Hong Leng H. and his wife, Mrs. Chan Thoeun Saem, are farmers who own 1.5-hectares (3.75-acres) of land that they use to cultivate rice. In order to support this farm, Mr. Hong Leng H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer.

Aside from farming, Mr. Hong Leng H. is a rock breaker. This couple has four children: two are attending the local school and two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Oscar Tomas

texts.es: Oscar Tomas se dedica a brindar servicios múltiples, hace más de 50 años que tiene esta actividad, el inicio con servicios de mantenimientos de equipos telefónicos, por lo que anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa de telecomunicaciones fue ahí donde aprendió todo lo necesario para ofrecer estos servicios, siempre llegan a buscarlo a su vivienda para realizar algunos trabajos, el es un hombre muy trabajador y las ganas de proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario es muy importante. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de taladros, pinzas, destornilladores, alicates y otras herramientas.
texts.en:
Oscar Tomas has been a handyman for more than 50 years. He started with phone maintenance since he had worked in a telecommunications company and learned there all he needed to perform the services. People always come to his house to request his services. He is a hardworking men who values providing for his family. He requests a loan for the purchase of drills, tweezers, screw drivers, pliers and other tools.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Сайдуллоева Мухайё проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 29 лет. Замужем. Мать троих детей. Муж, работает автомехаником. Сама Мухайё имеет среднее образование. Более 7 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Она в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа дойной коровы и комбикорма.
texts.en:
Muhayo S. lives in Tursanzade. She is 29, married, and has three children. Muhayo's husband is an auto mechanic. For more than 7 years, Muhayo has been farming cattle at home. She will use this loan to purchase a cow and animal food.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cow and animal food

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch R., 40, is married and lives with her six children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than US $2 each day. Her husband works collecting palm juice and refines it to palm sugar. She makes US $2 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Touch R. included. She is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a motorbike for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La Sra. Elizabeth cliente que  se dedica al comercio de fruta en la zona del Chapare quien además debe despertar en la madrugada para poder comprar y comercializar su producto  solo realiza la comercialización los fines de semana y juntamente con la madre quien es también comerciante de este rubro, la cliente es huérfana de padre por tanto desea obtener su dinero de manera independiente y así poder  salir adelante sola, es muy trabajadora , desea superarse y mejorar su calidad de vida, con el dinero del crédito comprara variedad de frutas como ser Chirimoya, naranja, plátano, etc.  Esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Elizabeth sells fruit in the Chapare zone. She rises early in the morning to buy and sell her products, but she only sells on the weekends, along with her mother who also works in this field. She is fatherless and prefers to earn her own money so that she can succeed on her own. She is very hard working and wants to be successful and improve her quality of life. She will use the money from this loan to buy a variety of fruits, such as apples, oranges, bananas, etc. She is very grateful to the institution for its support.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit for resale

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  membres du groupe DANAYA  (1 femme mariée  et 4 veuves) avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans  ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à MEDINE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de pagnes avec BINTOU D. , d’oranges , de savons et de charbon de bois.
BINTOU D. compte utiliser  ce nouveau prêt, pour acheter  30  pièces de pagnes. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Sikasso et à Bamako.
Les pagnes sont vendus au  grand marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five members of the Danaya group (one married woman and four widows) average 45 years of age and have on average three children each. The majority of them live in monogamous families in Medine, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (Mali's third administrative region).

They are on their seventh loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the goal of satisfying customer demand. This group of women sell "pagnes", which are highly decorative pieces of fabric (this is the case for Bintou D.), oranges, soaps and charcoal. 

With her loan Bintou D. is planning to buy 30 pieces of "pagne" fabric. She gets her supplies at Sikasso's large market and in Bamako. She sells her "pagnes" for cash at Sikasso's large market and within the family, to a customer base made up of men and women. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 75,000FCFA, of which part will be used for the family's daily expenses and the rest invested in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes"

loans.name: Hanifaan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifaan is a housewife. She lives in a small area of the city of Pakpattan, named 14SP, with her family, in a small home. Pakpattan is located in Punjab and known for its sugar production. Hanifaan is a 56 year old lady who spends most of her time at home doing her household responsibilities. Her husband has a business of selling fruits. He puts the fruits on his four-wheeled cart every day and sells them by going through different streets of the city. He has been doing this business for the past 15 years. 

Hanifaan is the mother of a son who is also involved in the fruit selling business. Her son sells fruits at his shop, which he has on rent. It is located in the market. He also contributes to the family income from his fruit business.  

Hanifaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan her husband will buy seasonal fruits and increase his sales. She is hopeful that her husband will successfully be able to improve his business by making this investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year she has paid her installments on time and never missed any meetings.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hand is Hanifan”.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits for fruit-selling business.

loans.name: Salyn James

texts.en:
Salyn James L. is from the town of Banga. He is 30 years old and married to a researcher. He has a two-year-old child. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice for sale. He does his best to be able to provide all his family's needs.

Salyn James joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other supplies

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos tiene 38 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio pues inicio como aprendiz, pues no tenía mucha experiencia en este tipo de negocio. Con el paso de tiempo es que ha fue aprendiendo este negocio que para él lo vio como una fuente de ingreso para un futuro y fue así como decide ofrecer este servicio a quienes lo necesitan, el se siente muy afortunado por la oportunidad. Este crédito lo utilizara para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y detergentes. Sueña con terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 38, has a grocery store.  He has had the business for over six years.  He started out as an apprentice because he didn’t have a lot of experience in this kind of work.  With the passage of time he gradually learned the business which he saw as a future source of income.  This is how he decided to provide this service to whoever needed it.  He feels very fortunate to have this opportunity.

He will use the funds to buy snacks, beverages, bread, cooking and detergent.  He dreams with finishing building his house.

loans.use: To buy stock items for the store.

loans.name: Ismayil
