texts.en: Ismayil A. is a 32 year old cattle breeder who has been selling milk and milk products along with meat to the local farmers since 2005. He also works as a policeman, but his salary is too small to raise 2 sons. Ismayil has 3 cattle now and wishes to increase their numbers to many. While Ismayil is out at work, his wife looks after the animals. He already has a successful loan history with KIVA and AqroInvest and promises to repay accurately.

loans.use: To purchase one cow.

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr:
Maman de 50ans, diplômée sans emploi est en activité depuis 20 ans, elle vend du bois de chauffe de 15000f a 30.000frs par jour .par jour. Avant le premier prêt, elle a améliorée ses ventes, a pu rembourser sans difficultés et a fait d'énormes comme jamais elle l'a fait. 

Elle s’approvisionne auprès des camions qui livrent du bois ruelle par ruelle, elle achète à 150f le fagot qu’elle revend à 250f, le prêt lui a permit d'avoir la capacité de 1000 fagots par mois.

Le prochain prêt lui permettra  d’augmenter de plus belle son stock de bois, faire la vente en gros et détails.
Elle compte augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en épargnant de plus en plus pour changer d’activité plu tard.
Elle  veut emmener ses enfants à faire des longues études universitaires.
texts.en:
A 50 year old mother and an unemployed graduate has been working for 20 years selling firewood from 15000f to 30 000frs a day. Since the first loan, she has improved her sales and was able to reimbourse it without difficulties. She has been more successful than ever.

She is supplied by trucks which deliver the wood alley by alley. She buys bundles at 150f which she re-sells at 250f. The loan allowed her to have the capacity of 150 bundles per month. 

The next loan will allow her to increase her stock of wood even more and sell both wholesale and retail. She plans to increase her turnover by saving more and more in order to change her activities later. She wants to enable her children to do long university studies.

loans.use: Sale of firewood and carbon

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita L. is from the village of Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 53 years old. Anita is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and beverages in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Anita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Anita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luzbeida Florixa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 1 De Agosto que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar encontramos a  la señora Luzbeida, ella tiene 38 años de edad, está soltera pero de una relación que tuvo hace tiempo tiene dos hijos de 15 y 8 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Estudio en la universidad y obtuvo el título de  Licda. En Párvulo, trabaja de maestra por contrato en una escuela de la localidad.
 
Se dedica a la venta productos por catálogos de Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas).  También vende útiles y materiales de oficina, todos sus productos los vende  a través de pedidos que le realizan sus clientes con anticipación. Trabaja 4 días a la semana por las tardes ya que en las mañanas trabaja de maestra. Su mercadería la recibe en Portoviejo.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y útiles de oficina. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la tesorera del Banco. Sus sueños son tener un nombramiento como maestra y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en: The 1 De Agosto ["August 1st"] Community Bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts, known on national and international levels. It is the home of the famous straw hats. In this area, we meet Mrs Luzbeida. She is 38 and single, but she has two children from an old relationship. They are 15 and 8, and are in high school and elementary school. She went to university and obtained a bachelor's degree in teaching kindergarten. She works as a teacher on contract at an elementary school in her area. She sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories) through catalogues. She also sells tools and office supplies. She sells all of her products through orders that her customers make in advance. She works four days a week in the afternoons, and works in the mornings as a teacher. She receives her merchandise in Portoviejo. This loan is for purchasing perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and office supplies. She has been part of this Community Bank from the beginning; she is the treasurer. Her dreams are to have an appointment as a teacher and for her children to have a good education.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and office supplies.

loans.name: Arshan's Group

texts.en:
Arshan is the wife of S. and she lives in a city called Arifwala in Pakistan. Arifwala is known for its agriculture industry. Arshan is a very caring lady. Despite her old age, she is still very active and operates a sewing business in her home. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients and earns income for her family. She has been doing this work for many years and is well known in her region. She used to do this work on a part-time basis, but she has since started working full-time and has become the earning hand for her family. 

Besides her sewing business, she also manages her household chores very well. She keeps her family happy through her good behavior and helps them to solve their problems. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to improve her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine has become old and takes much time to sew a single dress. Arshan is hopeful that through this investment she will take her business to a more profitable position. 

Note: In the photo, Arshan is the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem P., a 28-year-old resident of a rural commune in Phnom Penh City, has worked as a sewing laborer in a garment factory since 2007. Hem P. is married to Vong Chantha, 30 years old, and a temporary laborer. The couple is blessed with a young child who is already in school. Hem P. wishes to open a small shop in order to provide sewing services for additional income. Since she lacks money to buy a sewing machine and other materials for running her business, she is seeking a loan from Kiva through HKL.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and other materials

loans.name: Tegshjargal

texts.en: Tegshjargal, 30, is married and lives with her husband, a two-year-old son and her parents-in-law in the SuhB. district of UlaanB., the capital of Mongolia. Her husband works for a company as a supervisor where he is paid 500,000 MNT per month. She graduated as a teacher and translator and worked for a company as a marketing manager. In 2010, she began selling plumbing supplies. Now her business has become more stable. Tegshjargal is a hardworking person who says, "I am trying to expand my business and hope to get a mortgage for  an apartment". She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more inventory for her business before the peak season.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida L. is from the village of San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 46 years old. Nida is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Nida owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Nida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Nida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Liloy-San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia F. is a married woman living with her family in the town of Santo Niño, South Cotabato province in the Mindanao islands. She has two children aged 26 and 27. Cynthia is a farmer who grows rice that she sells to her community. Cynthia works hard to improve her harvest and earn more for her family. She wants to improve her family's living conditions.

Cynthia has requested a loan which she will use to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farming needs. She is hopeful that this loan will improve her farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farming needs

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita tiene 63 años. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo José, de 65 años y su hija de los 7 que tiene en total. Por más de 17 años, se dedica a su negocio que es una librería, situado en el primer ambiente de su casa. En este negocio atiende con el apoyo de su hijo y su nuera, durante la mañana y la noche. Por ser un negocio muy surtido y atractivo, le ha dado mucha ventaja ya que sus clientes son en su mayoría sus vecinos y amistades de su barrio, siendo muy concurrido  así es como ha logrado captar buenas utilidades. Por ello, constantemente trata de proveerse de más novedades de la ciudad de Lima que queda a una hora de camino en carro. Mientras tanto su hijo atiende su negocio, y de ese modo su librería ni un solo día se cierra, además vende a precios muy  asequibles. Está muy contenta con su negocio, por ello su idea es aumentar de mercadería y, de ese modo crecer más y más. Es su octavo crédito que tiene con MFP y se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas como siempre lo hizo. De obtener el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar todo tipo de artículos y útiles escolares, para implementar más su negocio.
texts.en: Felicita is 63 years old and she lives in a house that is her own, together with her husband Jose, 65 years old, and their daughter, one of seven children they have in total. She has had a bookstore for more than 17 years. It is located on the main level of her house. She manages her business with the help of her son and her daughter-in-law, in the mornings and evenings. The business has a good variety and it is attractive so it has been a great advantage that her clients are primarily her neighbors and friends in the community. It is well visited and so she is able to acquire good earnings. She is always trying to acquire new articles in the city of Lima, located at an hour's drive by car. Meanwhile her son manages the business and this is who her library does not close, not for a single day.  She sells at very affordable prices. She is very happy with her business so her plan is to increase her merchandise and to make her business grow more and more. This is her eighth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to making her payments, as she always has. She plans on using her loan to purchase all types of articles and school supplies to supplement her business.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and articles for the home

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is currently in the business of selling biscuits and sugar. She is 37 years old, married, with 7 children, and all of them go to school. Mary borrowed a loan to stock more biscuits and sugar to sell. She hopes to open up a big shop in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more biscuits and sugar to sell

loans.name: Yonie Group

texts.en:
This photo shows members of the “Yonie Group.” They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner, to request a loan of 800,000 SLL for each member. The loan will be used to further expand their individual businesses. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu K.. She is 42 and was born in one of the villages that make up Sanda. Currently, she lives in Makeni together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a salaried worker and two of her children are in primary school, one is in secondary school and the other is in college. For the past ten years, Kadiatu has been selling shoes. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy dozens of shoes to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy dozens of shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tica Tica, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 28 años de edad; La socia es casada;  La socia  tiene 1 hijo de 4 años de edad; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la docencia ella es docente en un jardín de niños, el mismo en el cual inscribió a su menor hijo, la socia es una mujer muy querendona y le agrada mucho los niños, ella requiere el crédito para poder invertir el crédito en su menor hijo ella pagara las mensualidades en un solo pago así con su sueldo ella podrá distribuir de mejor manera para los gastos de la casa y la comida diaria. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la educación de su menor hijo.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
She is a member of the community bank Madres Trabajadoras [Working Mothers], located in the Tica Tica district in the Cusco province in the department of Cusco.

She is 28 years old, married, and has one son who is four years old.  She balances her household chores with teaching.  She is a teacher in the same preschool that her son attends.  She is a very caring woman who likes children.  

She is asking for this loan to invest in her son.  She will pay his monthly school fees in one payment, so she can use her salary to pay for household costs and food.  She is asking for this loan to invest in the education of her young son.

She is very satisfied with the loan provided and promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to invest in the education of her young son.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Emiliano; el tiene 45 años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de construcción, el realiza diferentes trabajos de construcción como casas y edificios, por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar el trabajo de construcción y también quiere terminar de construir su casa. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como fierros, bloquetas y cementos.
                                                       
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Emiliano is a member of the "Munay Tika" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Emiliano is 45 years old, married, and has four children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his building work.  He works on different construction jobs such as houses and buildings.  Through this work, he gets his children ahead in life.  Emiliano would like to improve the construction work that he does and would also like to finish building his own house.

Emiliano is requesting this loan to buy construction supplies such as iron, blocks and cement.  He is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies such as iron, blocks and cement

loans.name: Yaovi Sourou

texts.fr: Mr Yaovi est âgé de 34ans. Il a 02 enfants et sa femme est couturière. Tailleur de profession, il a constaté que dans son quartier  ils ont du mal à moudre les céréales (mais, haricot, riz, mil) c’est pour cela il sollicite ce premier prêt pour résoudre ce problème.
texts.en: Mr. Yaovi is 34 years old. He has two children, and his wife is a seamstress. A tailor by trade, he has noticed that people in his neighborhood have a hard time grinding cereals (corn, beans, rice, millet). This is why he is requesting this first loan in order to solve this problem.

loans.use: to buy a grinder.

loans.name: Rosa Lili

texts.es:
La señora Rosi es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 65 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 12 años y se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir D. segunda mano, mercadería que lo lleva a vender por los caseríos D. la zona.  También hace intercambios con animales D. corral cuando las personas no tienen dinero para poder pagar (a esto le llaman trueque).
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 20 camisas manga largas, 20 pantalones, 30 polos, 10 faldas, 25 blusas, 12 pantalones para niños, 18 polos para niños,  12 shores para niños, 10 vestidos para damas, 6 vestidos para niñas, 12 blusitas para niñas, 6 polos manga larga, 4 casacas.
En este tipo D. negocio debe tener variedades D. prendas para poder vender más, su esposo es maestro albañil pero es poco el trabajo que tiene, D. esa manera la señora Rosa ayuda a su esposo, aunque tenga que ausentarce D. su casa por varios días para poder colocar toda su mercadería.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos sigue trabajando y quiere hacerlo por mucho tiempo más.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Solidarias” (Supportive Women) which is in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 65 years old, married, and has four children.

Rosa has worked with Manuela Ramos for 12 years and earns her living by selling secondhand clothes. She carries her merchandise with her so that she can sell in the villages throughout the area. She is also willing to exchange her goods for domesticated animals whenever her customers do not have the money to pay (otherwise known as bartering).

With this new loan of 2500 PEN, Rosa will buy 20 long-sleeve shirts, 20 pairs of trousers, 30 polo shirts, 10 skirts, 25 blouses, 12 pairs of children’s trousers, 18 children’s polo shirts, 12 children’s shorts, 10 women’s dresses, 6 girls’ dresses, 12 women’s blouses, 6 long-sleeve polo shirts, and 4 coats. In this type of business, she needs to offer a variety of clothes so that she can sell more. Her husband is a master bricklayer, but he has little work. In this manner, Sra. Rosa is able to help her husband even if it requires that she be away from home for several days so that she can sell all of her merchandise.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos, she is able to continue with her job because she wants to keep working for a long time.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en:
Rubie is 21 years-old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a single mother to a school-age child and a baby.

To earn a living, Rubie has a retail shop at home.  For the last three years, she has sold biscuits, noodles, candies, food in pouches and canned goods.  This is the only income for the family.  Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 from this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 from Kiva partner GDMPC in order to purchase additional products to sell.

Rubie has been member of GDMPC for three months. In the future, Rubie hopes to gain more income from her business to use for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Yousra

texts.en:
Yousra is a 52 year-old married woman and a mother of two children.  She has worked since 2000 as a photographer. Yousra is hardworking and is a good businesswoman who advertises attractive offers to keep her business updated.  Yousra opened her shop in 2004.  She has a good customer base to rely on and she works hard on improving her business and updating her machines and materials. Yousra is preparing herself for the Holy Ramadan celebrations, when most of the families come during Eid A. Fitr.  It is a three-day Muslim holiday that marks the end of Ramadan, the Islamic holy month of fasting.  People come to take pictures and enjoy the Eid.  Yousra needs to buy necessary materials and chemicals for her business.  She will make speciA. offers and that will increase her income.

For this reason, Yousra is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua-Kiva.   It is her tenth cycle as A. Majmoua borrower.  She has a magnificent history of good standing.  Yousra will also paint her house, and buy a bedroom for her children.  Yousra is a woman with a good reputation and remarkable customer service.  She hopes to improve more and keep her customers loyA. to her.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for her business

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 27 years old and recently married to Susan.

He has operated a barber shop for the last six years. He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. This will be his second loan. He plans to use this new loan to buy a motorbike to start a transportation business.

In the future, Simon hopes to grow both his barber shop and  transportation business and own minibuses.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Irma Petronila

texts.es:
Irma, vive con su esposo y cuatro hijos de 16, 12, 11 y 8 años de edad, ella es ama de casa y su esposo es agricultor, actualmente se encuentra sembrando maíz en una manzana de terreno, se apoyan mucho en las actividades, ella en este caso solicita un préstamo para cubrir el gasto en abono, para que su esposo lo aplique en la milpa.
Este préstamo le ayudara para fortalecer la planta y que tenga un buen desarrollo, con la intención de obtener una buena producción, su propósito es que a través del trabajo que realiza en conjunto con su esposo, puedan mejorar las instalaciones de la vivienda, ofreciendo una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Irma lives with her husband and four children (ages 16, 12, 11, and 8).  She is a homemaker and her husband is a farmer.  Her husband is currently growing corn on approximately 1.7 acres of land, which he relies upon for his business activities.  Irma is taking this opportunity to request a loan to cover the cost of compost that her husband will apply to his cornfield.  

This loan will help strengthen and develop his crop with the intended purpose of obtaining good production.  Irma seeks to work together with her husband so that they can improve their living quarters and offer a better life to their children.

loans.use: to buy compost for growing corn.

loans.name: Archil

texts.en:
Archil is from the village of Koda, East Georgia. He is 27 years old. Archil married recently and lives with his wife Zoya, his parents, and his younger brother. Archil works in local railway station “Marabda” as an operator. At the same time he helps his parents in the family-owned dairy farm. They have two milk cows and sell cheese and yogurt in Tbilisi (capital city of the country) grocery stores. Archil has concluded an agreement with these stores and he supplies them with the agreed amount of dairy products constantly. 

Archil requested credit for financing some renovation work in their house. It was last renovated a long time ago and is already in bad condition and uncomfortable. After the renovation, the newly married couple and the rest of the family will live in a better and more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en: Thuan is a 55-year-old woman who lives with her daughters and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a driver for hire. For ten years, Thuan has operated a business selling underclothes from a small stall at an outdoor market. She would like to take a loan to expand her business by purchasing women’s clothes and men’s t-shirts to sell. She hopes that this will help her to increase her income and enable her to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Afi Elikplimi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgé(e) de 47ans. Elle est veuve avec 03 enfants en charge.
Afi travaille comme restauratrice depuis 2006. Elle sert ses clients dans un quartier de la place.
Afi a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter du riz, de l’huile et du haricot.
texts.en:
Afi, aged 47 is a widow raising three children. 

Afi has been working selling cooked food since 2006. She serves her clients in a local neighborhood. 

Afi has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy rice, oil, and dried beans.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and beans.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.   Analou has a retail shop that sells green & yellow bananas. She has had this business for 2 years. 

Analou  requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more green & yellow bananas to sell.  Analou is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,  she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy bananas

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marco nacido en la localidad de San José Santa Cruz, casado con la señora Verónica hace dos años tienen una hija de cuatro años, viven en la localidad de Santa Rita sobre la carretera, el domicilio es familiar viven ahí   hace 4 años. El sr. Marco  tiene como actividad principal la explotación de áridos en el rio pirai, saca arena y ripio y vende para las construcciones, le va muy bien ya que conoce la zona y  tiene una experiencia dos años. Es socio activo del sindicato mixto de su rubro, además cuenta con vehículo propio que le da a un chofer para que pueda trabajarlo donde recibe renta diaria. El destino del crédito es para el mantenimiento de vehículo, se siente muy agradecido con la institución por la confianza brindada.
texts.en:
Mr. Marco was born in the town of San José Santa Cruz.  He has been married to his wife, Verónica, for two years and they have a four-year-old daughter.  They live in the town of Santa Rita on the main road and have been there for four years.  Marcos has a sand business along the Pirai River and sells sand and gravel  for construction.  Business is going well because he knows the area well and has two years' experience.  He is an active member of the workers' union in his sector and also owns a vehicle he rents to a driver who pays him a daily fee.

The loan will be used to pay for vehicle maintenance.  He is very grateful to the institution for the confidence shown in him.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is aged 27 and has been in farming for seven years in her home area of Nkubu, Central Kenya.She is married with one child aged five and produces maize, potatoes, beans and wheat for her local market.

Caroline has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank for irrigation purposes as well as to supply water for her dairy farm. She says their production for produce like beans is frequently hampered by inconsistent rainfalls and the irrigation system would help in alleviating the problem. She says the income will help her educate her child in future and improve the living standards of her entire family.

Caroline sees high costs of inputs like pesticides as the main challenges.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Lenie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Lenie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lenie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Duo Dulces Sueños Group

texts.es: Duo Dulces Sueños,este duo esta integrado por dos personas que se dedican al comercio y luchan dia a dia para salir adelante,Maria Clemencia,ella se dedica a la venta de tamales desde hace 14 años.en la localidad donde ella vive,ella nos cuenta que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para elavora tamales,esta muy contenta porque cree que con este credito podra aumentar mas la venta de tamales y asi poder ayudar a su familia.al igual que la siquiente socia esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para la venta.
texts.en:
Duo Dulces Sueños is composed of two people engaged in business and who struggle every day to get ahead. 

Maria Clemencia has been selling tamales for a living for the past 14 years in the town where she lives. She tells us that she's applying for this loan so she can buy the ingredients to make tamales. She is very happy because she believes that, with this loan, she will be able to increase her tamale sales and thus help her family.  

Like Maria, the other member is applying for this loan to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 35-year-old single woman with one child in school. For the past five years, she has had a business selling beer in Yambio, South Sudan. Alice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beer. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her child's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beer for resale

loans.name: Blanca Teresa

texts.es:
Blanca Teresa  tiene 42 años es casada, vive con el esposo   y los hijos. Vive en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, cacao hace 10 años.

Blanca Teresa  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y cacao en terrenos propios. Compra sus productos en Mocache y las vende en el mercado de Mocache.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir en la siembra. Su sueño es comprar una casa y un carro.

Disfruta mucho en sus tiempos libres haciendo deporte, leer.
texts.en:
Blanca Teresa is 42 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache. 

The 'El Progreso' community bank is located in Aguas Frías de Mocache, in Mocache canton. The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, and have been growing corn, rice and cacao for the past 10 years.

Blanca Teresa grows corn, rice and cocoa on her own land. She buys products from Mocache and sells them at Mocache market.

Blanca has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and manure for her crops. The loan will help increase revenue for her family and allow her to invest in planting crops. Her dream is to buy a house and a car.

In her free time she enjoys playing sports and reading.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and manure for her crops.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Ms Sen is 64 years old with three children who are grown. She is running the business focusing on selling and buying scrap. This activity started five years ago and she achieves good income from this. Now, she is requiring a loan of 8,736,000 Vietnam dong to buy more scrap products for sale.

loans.use: to buy more scrap products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Marietes

texts.en:
Ma. Marietes is 36 years old and is a married woman with two children, ages 8 and 6. She has been a farmer for 10 years. Ma. Marietes tills her land in Trinidad, Bohol, growing rice crops to sell. She earns 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month doing this farming. Ma. Marietes is able to help provide for her family with her income.

Ma. Marietes has requested this loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to earn more and be able to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a provisions seller, located in Elmina. She has had some formal education, as she is a middle-school-leaver. She is married and has three children. Her husband is teacher. She has been selling provisions for some years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees.

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of eggs, soft drinks, groceries, biscuits, Milo, milk, sweets, and other groceries. This will enable her to meet rising customer demand. Mary hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further, and to ensure that all her children receive quality education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of groceries to sell at her store, including eggs, biscuits, milk and others

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 20 years old. She is married with two children. She is a motorcycle operator and she sells clothes as well (businesses she has operated for two years).

Janet has requested a loan which she will use to purchase a motorbike for transportation services within her area. With the anticipated profits, she will be able to open a boutique and sell cosmetics as well. Her hope and dream for the future is to educate her children to university.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for transportation services within her area

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Mariée, Ayawa est une femme âgée de 29 ans résidant à Baguida. Ayawa vit avec ses deux enfants et son mari. Ayawa est une revendeuse de détergents et de savons qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Ayawa demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat de sacs de détergents et des cartons de savons en vue de mieux revendre et de gagner des bénéfices afin de pouvoir aider son mari à bien prendre en charge leurs enfants dans leur éducation scolaire puis à certaines dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Acheter 08 sacs de détergents et 03 cartons de savons.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
M. Rebecca is a young woman full of hope for the future. She is an active member of Life in Africa and is employed in the Invisible Children Bracelet project. In addition she also participates in many of the other activities offered by LiA and her positive attitude affects all those she comes in contact with.

She also is very responsible and has a good and generous heart. She supports her brother financially as well as two Aids orphans. These children are currently staying with relatives and even with the money she sends, they live under very poor conditions. She really wants to be able to give them a better life and longs to earn enough to provide school fees so these children can be educated.

She has a sister living in Kampala who is not able to go to school herself. Together they plan to open a second hand clothes business. Rebecca has worked in this type of business before and knows that she can make a good income once she gets it going. Her sister will help by working this business while Rebecca continues on at LiA. The business will be located at Kisasi trading center but they also plan to ocassionally shift to other locations to increase their business. She is so determined in this plan that she has already saved 150,000 towards the start up. She is seeking a loan in the amount 500,000 to add to this. She will be able to repay this loan in 6 months.

Below is her break down.

Rent 4 months 200,000/

2 Shocks @ 150,000/ 300,000/

Transport 10,000/

Hungers 20 @ 2000 40,000/

K.C.C licence 20000/

Total 650,000/

WE Team to benefit: Advertising and Marketing

loans.use: Buying second hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: A mother of six Nancy lives in a house close to what many would call a shack. Four of her six children are in school. Because of her family’s poor standard of living Nancy wanted more four her children, family and herself but with a limited education background she didn’t know how to put her skills into good use. Nancy never made it to secondary level education. She first heard of SPBD in 2000 but thought it was not for her until she heard about the number of families whose lives have developed since being a part of the programme in 2003. In 2004 she joined using her baking and cooking skills to start a cake business with her sister Toeaso helping in the sales at one of the two local markets. With a new loan she hopes to purchase a new oven and additional ingredients for her cake business.

loans.use: To purchase a new oven and additional ingredients (flour, sugar, eggs, milk, yeast) for her cake business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large marking centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Madam T. is a resident of Nkurankan and manufactures beads. She is also a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is however seeking a Kiva loan of $900.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: Bead manufacturer

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: P. Mavluda is a married, has three children and three grandchildren.  Her husband works as a security guard in a private company. She worked as a laboratory assistant in a boiler plant before. She has had her own business selling underclothes and dresses for 3 years. She started her business with 100 USD. Now she has a 2000 USD in investment. She would like to extend her business, so requests additional support in the amount of 875 USD. Nobody helps her with her business.

loans.use: To purchase new goods.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
For the past ten years, Valentina has operated a kiosk selling seasonal clothing in the markets of Pavlograd, Ukraine. A hardworking mother of two, Valentina has successfully grown her business to establish a stable income for her family.

With rich market experience in the sphere of sales and an enterprising spirit, Valentina recently expanded her business endeavors to offer transportation services. This new endeavor has helped Valentina to establish a wide range of contacts and further expand her business.

Currently, Valentina is seeking a loan of $1200 to construct a new vending kiosk. With the increased profits from owning her own kiosk, she hopes to grow her business even more. Eventually Valentina hopes to purchase a new vehicle for transporting goods from wholesale retailers to her vending facilities, further increasing her profits.

loans.use: Purchase vending kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more produce for resell.

loans.name: Nakivoni

texts.en: Nakivoni is a 45-year-old mother of three and a resident of the Lumo area in Dar es Salaam. She has been doing various businesses for the past ten years. She now runs a restaurant at the Ubungo bus terminal in Dar es Salaam. She is in need of $400 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant

loans.name: Maimina's Group

texts.en:
Maimina N. has a food store and wants a loan to build a cabana to increase her sales space. She also wants to add tomatoes and onions to her product selection.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To build a cabana for her store

loans.name: Georgina Himelda

texts.es:
Georgina belongs to Banco Comunal Las Aves Fenix (Las Aves Fenix Community Bank), located in Jr. Eduardo del Águila 796, Calleria district in Ucayali department. She is 35 years old and has 2 young children. She is married and her husband is an accounting assistant. With the first loan of S/. 300 Georgina obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in a sewing workshop at her house.

Georgina has the workshop now and also sells sodas, ice and lollipops. She gets up at 6:00 a.m. to do her daily chores at home and sew her clients' clothes until late at night.

With the S/. 1,000 loan, which she will pay back within 5 months, Georgina will buy fabrics of different colors and quality, different size rubber bands, silk lace and 4 cases of sodas.

Georgina is happy because her business is doing well and she is able to contribute to her household's expenses, educate her children and feel more independent, thanks to Manuela Ramos' support.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer

La señora Georgina pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Aves Fenix, ubicado en Jr. Eduardo del Águila 796, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años y es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad, es casada y su esposo es auxiliar contable. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en un taller de costura en su casa. En la actualidad cuenta con un taller de costura y también vende gaseosas, hielos, y chupetes. Se levanta a las 6 a.m. para realizar las actividades diarias en su hogar y al mismo tiempo se dedica a coser las prendas de sus clientes hasta altas horas de la noche. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, ella comprará telas de todos los colores y calidades, elásticos de diferentes tamaños, blondas y 4 cajas de gaseosas. Georgina está feliz porque le esta yendo bien en el negocio, además puede aportar en su hogar, educar a sus hijos y también se siente mas independiente gracias al apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Compra de materiales (telas, elásticos, etc) y gaseosas

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat manufactures fences made from metallic wire. In the rural area in which he lives, such fences are commonly used to enclose various structures, such yards and pens. Shuhrat started his business as a journeyman and has been working independently for one year. His business is becoming more and more stable and is providing a better income for his family.

He will use this loan to purchase building materials, like wire, to manufacture fences.

Shuhrat is 23 years old and married. He supports his wife, parents, and a younger sister. He thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to pay his loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase materials to manufacture fences

loans.name: Leoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Leoun P., age 28, lives with her husband and one small child in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She sells rice, food and orange juice in front of the Takeo Bayon Temple. Normally she earns around $10 a day. Her husband supplements the household as a construction chief building houses. He makes about $7 a day.

Mrs. P. is requesting a loan to purchase additional ingredients for the foods she sells and to purchase a motorbike for transportation.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make foods for sale and to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Yoselin Virginia

texts.es:
Mrs. Yoselin is a single mother and has worked for around four years with credit from our institution; it's worth stressing that she has used it in a very responsible and serious way, since to date she now has her own baking ovens that she uses to prepare sweet rolls and loaves of bread, which is her main business. She also works preparing food for various events like parties, wedding, graduation events, etc. She lives in her grandmother's house, who, being family, does not charge her rent. This woman is very responsible, and is one of our best customers, since she has never presented any problem from the time of her first loan. This shows her seriousness and commitment to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Yoselin es una madre soltera y ya trabaja alrededor de cuatro años con su crédito en nuestra institucion, vale recalcar que el mismo lo ha utilizado de manera muy responsable y seria, ya que a la Fecha posee sus propias maquinas horneadoras en las cuales prepara sus masitas y panes, que son su actividad principal Ademas trabaja preparando comida para distintos eventos como fiestas, matrimonios, fiestas de graduacion, etc. La casa en la que vive es de su abuela quien por ser su familiar no le cobra alquileres. La señora es muy responsable y es una de nuestras mejores clientes, ya que hasta la fecha y desde su primer crédito no ha presentado problema alguno, lo que demuestra su seriedad y compromiso consigo misma

loans.use: Invest in ingredients for her business and tools of her trade

loans.name: Phary

texts.en:
Miss Phary U., 27, is single and lives with her parents on an Island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has two older brothers.

Miss Phary has been a silk weaver for fifteen years, a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. She is now requesting a loan of $200 to purchase additional silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Oeun A. has a business selling a variety of groceries in the village since 2004. She has one of the biggest stalls which is why she has many customers. She can make $5 of profit per day. Her husband Ket Thul works collecting resin (rubber tree) and sell it to the rubber plant near his house. On average, he earns around $5/day. This couple has two children, one who is a student and another is too young to attend school.

To meet her customer’s demands and to add more inventory to sell in large amounts she would like a loan from Kiva to purchase groceries in bulk. Bulk purchases will save her some money. Any remaining monies will be used to purchase wood to repair her house, especially the leaking roof which is very difficult in the rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk and repair the house.

loans.name: Francisca Lorena

texts.es:
This woman lives in her own house, is divorced, and is mother of three children who are attendng a public school. their home is made of cement blocks.

Her work is carried out alongside her mother who helps her with the tailoring shop. Her clients are from the area abut she also takes it on the road to sell her merchandise in Honduras. Her transactions are in cash and credit (which she collects on a weekly or bi-weekly basis). She travels two days a week. Although she is separated from her husband, he provides economic support for her children.

Her credit request is for the acquisition of raw materials related to her tailoring shop. In her credit history she has had 8 loans with the Leon 2000 Foundation, all of which have been repaid on time.

Her dream is to see her children trained as professionals, and to expand her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora vive en casa propia, es divorciada, madre de tres hijos, estudian en colegio publico, su casa de habitación de bloque y zin, Su actividad la lleva cabo en conjunto con su señora Mamá, quien la ayuda en el taller de costura, sus clientes son personas del sector, tambien sale a vender parte de su mercadería a honduras, de contado y credito que recupera a los quince dias o semanales, vieja dos veces en la semana, aunque esté separada el padre de sus hijos le ayuda economicamente en su manutención. Sus creditos han sido para la adquisición de materia prima relacionados con su taller de costura, lleva 8 creditos con fundación leon 2000, ha pagado en tiempo y forma. Sus sueños, es ver preparados profesionalmente a sus hijos, y ampliar su taller.

loans.use: Tailoring shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase 1 unit, each, of rize, flour, sugar, 1 drum of cooking oil, 10 pounds of baking soda, 10 sacks of coal, 1 unit of salt, and 1 dozen packages of instant coffee.

loans.name: Rusilda

texts.es:
La señora Rusilda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Paykanas”, ubicado en Jr. Antonio Maya de Brito Nº 553, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años y es madre de 2 hijos que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo conduce su motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la venta de pollos. Tiene 2 años en Manuela Ramos. 

En la actualidad cuenta con un lavadero y un motokar, además se dedica a la venta de ceras y aceite de motos y motokar, y por las mañanas, con la ayuda de su hija Liliana, vende caldo, jugos y hamburguesas. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,300, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 4 baldes de aceites, ceras, y frutas, con la cual le brindan la oportunidad de ampliar el negocio.
   
Gracias a Manuela Ramos ha mejorado su negocio y la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
La señora Rusilda belongs to the community bank "Las Paykanas", located in Jr. Antonio Maya de Brito Nº 553, district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 37 years old and is the mother of 2 children who still depend on her. She is married and her husband drives a "motokar" (three-wheeled motorized form of transport). With her first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of S/.300, she decided to invest in the sale of chickens. She has been with Manuela Ramos for 2 years.

Currently she has a car wash and a motokar, also, she sells wax and oil for motorcycles and motokars, and, in the mornings, with the help of her daughter, Liliana, she sells soups, juices, and hamburgers.

With this loan of S/.1,300 ($450), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy four buckets of oils, waxes, and fruits, which will offer her the opportunity to increase her business.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos she has improved her business and the economic stability of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy buckets of oil, waxes, and fruit.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Mr. Sophal P., 40, is a primary school teacher. He always leaves home to teach class at the primary school while his wife, Mrs. Yorn Shay, 37, works as a farmer. She has been farming since 1989. Sophal and his wife live with five children in the family home, all of whom are students. The children spend their free time helping their parents with the family business. This is the traditional farm season in which Cambodia's citizens grow rice. However, Sophal lacks the capital for operating the farm. Sophal requests a loan of 600,000 Riel (US$150) to purchase fertilizer for his wife to use growing the rice crop. The loan will help to increase rice yield higher than in previous years. The family lives in Ptasrong Commune, Pursat Province. (Mr. Sophal's wife is pictured because Sophal was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the rice crop

loans.name: Rosita

texts.es: Rosita tiene 28 años, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos, y una relación hermosa con su pareja. Desde su nacimiento a vivido en el mundo de la agricultura, es la única actividad que conoce, y por supuesto es una eficiente ama de casa, madruga todos los dias levantándose a las 5.00am para que se de tiempo de cocinar y después conjuntamente con su esposo se van a la chacra, su actividad le agrada mucho, es  por ello que no tiene ninguna dificultad, tiene anhelos de juntar dinero y comprarse más chacras para que pueda aumentar sus sembríos, ya no solo en cítricos, ni mamones de plátanos, sino también sembrar café en grandes cantidades. Es nueva cliente MFP. Con el dinero va comprar plantitas de plátano, por lo menos un millar, espera que el dinero prestado, ayude a hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en:
Rosita is a 28-year-old married mother of four who has a wonderful relationship with her partner. She was born into the agriculture world; it's the only work she's ever known. She is an efficient homemaker, getting up early every day at 5am to make time for cooking and later, with her husband, going to the small farm (chacra). Rosita enjoys her work very much, which is why it's not difficult for her. She wishes to save money to buy more chacras to augment her lands, and not just grow citrus or bananas, but also grow greater quantities of coffee. She is a new MFP client. With the money she will buy at least a thousand banana starter plants; she hopes this loan will help her bring her dream to life.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase banana plants

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Roselinda, commonly known as Rosing, is married to Alfred. They live in their simple house in Barangay Lullutan Ilagan, Isabela since their three children have their own families already.

Roselinda owns 2 "bangkas" (manually operated small boats to transport people) but one is not functioning. Since their community is located beside a river, people need to ride motorized small boats, which made Roselinda’s business in-demand to their community. It would be of great help if could have the needed capital to repair the damaged boat. When repaired, the boat is expected to double their daily income. She requested the amount of P7,000.

Roselinda is being helped by her husband who usually wakes up as early as 6 o clock in the morning to catch the daily commuters who are going to the town of Ilagan, the capital of Isabela province. It shows that they have a strong partnership, which is necessary to sustain their business, the only source of their daily income. Rosing would also like to save a part of their income for their future.

loans.use: Repair damaged boat

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene 39 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus 4 hijos. Desde muy joven estuvo inmersa en el ámbito de las ventas, pero formalmente viene trabajando hace 10 años en ello, tiempo en que pudo abrir una tienda y un pequeño restaurante, en los cuales ocupa todo el día, junto a sus hijas, quienes al salir de sus estudios cooperan con su madre. Gracias a la buena ubicación que tiene su tienda y su negocio puede obtener buenas ganancias, las cuales le ayudarán a ambientar y ampliar su negocio para hacerlo muy rentable y sostenible  en el tiempo. Sin embargo el trabajo es arduo, toma bastante tiempo para la preparación de los platos que ofrece  en el menú diario, para lo cual desde muy temprano se dedica a  prepararlos. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, y desea seguir  trabajando de las misma forma como hasta hoy, basada en la responsabilidad. Con el dinero que solicita comprara mercadería para su tienda y víveres para su restaurante, el cual es su prioridad.
texts.en:
Marlene is 39 years old, and a single mother who lives with her four children. She has been around sales since she was very young, but formally went into the business 10 years old at a time when she was able to open a store and a small restaurant, which she and her children today run together since they have finished with school. Thanks to her fine location, the business can make a good profit, which will help her to fix up and expand the business to make it even more profitable and sustainable in the future. However, the work is hard, as it takes a lot of time to prepare the meals that she offers on the daily menu. She has to get up very early to prepare them. This is Marlene’s third loan with MFP, and being responsible, she would like to do with it what she has done in the past. With the money she has requested, Marlene will purchase merchandize for her store and provisions for the restaurant, which is her priority.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of provisions for meal preparation

loans.name: Mukhtor

texts.en:
Mukhtor U. is 34 years old. He has been married for about 10 years. His wife is a teacher in the local school. Currently Mukhtor does not work within his profession, but he tries to feed his family by being a merchant. Mukhtor has been running his business for about 2 years. He rents a retail store where he sells different kinds of housewares. His business is the main source of income for the family.

Mukhtor is trying to have a wide range of goods with good quality to meet the requirements of his customers and to satisfy the needs of customers with different levels of income. Today, Mukhtor requests 800 USD for a term of 6 months. This is the first time that Mukhtor has asked for a loan through IMON International and Kiva. It will be used to buy more housewares in order to increase the range of his goods. Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro-entrepreneur, and his experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for re-sale

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa O. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through primary (elementary) school. Theresa sells used clothing at the Pedu near Abura, which she has done for the last nine years. Her husband is a plumber. Theresa uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses while her husband takes care of the family’s remaining financial needs. Theresa will use her loan to increase her stock of used clothing to meet the increase in demand by her customers. Theresa plans to reinvest her profits back into the business.

loans.use: To increase her stock of used clothing

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymom B., 40, and her husband, Mr. Saroeun Chann, 44, married in 1985 and have four children: three sons and one daughter, who is a silk weaver. Two sons attend school, and the other one stays at home. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sreymom has been a silk weaver for twenty-five years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Saroeun Chann has been a security guard in a company in Phnom Penh for eight years. One of her sons is in university so she is asking for her first loan of $200 to pay tuition fees for her son.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her son who is in university

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro tiene 28 años, convive con su pareja Yoliset, con la que tiene una pequeña hija de 8 años llamada Kimberly, viven en la casa de la madre de Pedro. Él se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi desde hace 5 años, trabajando de 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, en una jornada en la que tiene que lidiar con el duro tránsito de la ciudad, siendo una labor nada fácil, ya que al finalizar el día resulta muy agotado con el fuerte calor del verano. A Pedro siempre le ha gustado conducir, oficio que aprendió desde muy joven y el cual le brinda independencia, ya que él decide a qué horas trabajar y también los momentos para compartir con su familia, además le resulta muy rentable, debido a que realiza muchos servicios al día y al ser su carro propio, todas las ganacias son para él y su familia. Como se lo ha demostrado la experiencia, se saca buenos ingresos en el trasporte de pasajeros, es así que está pensando invertir en la compra de un motocarro, el cual le permita obtener mayores ingresos y brindar una oportunidad laboral para algún joven trabajador como él. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, siendo siempre muy puntual en los pagos, y agrádándole mucho el trabajo en su banco comunal, él es el presidente y realiza esta labor con gran responsabilidad. Con el dinero solicitado quiere refaccionar su carro, además, dar las cuotas iniciales para comprar su motocarro y registrarlo para empezar a trabajar con él.
texts.en:
Pedro is 28 years old and lives with his partner Yoliset, with whom he has a young daughter of 8 years old called Kimberly. They live in Pedro's mother's house. For 5 years he has been a taxi driver, working from 7am to 8pm. During the day he has to deal with the heavy traffic of the city. It is not an easy job, as at the end of the day he is exhausted from the strong summer heat. Pedro has always liked driving, a trade that he learned when he was very young and that gives him a lot of independence because he can choose when he works and when he spends time with his family. In addition it has been very profitable: he has many passengers every day and he uses his own car, so all of the earnings go to him and his family.

As experience has shown him, driving a taxi earns good money, and this is how he intends to finance his investment in a three-wheeler van (like a tuk-tuk or auto rickshaw), which will allow him to earn more money and provide employment to another young worker like him. This is his third loan with MFP, and he has always been punctual with his payments. He very much enjoys working with his communal bank, for which he is the president and and carries out his work with great responsibility. With the money he requests, he wants to refurbish his car, and in addition, pay the initial installments on his three-wheeler van and register it to start using it.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbish his taxi and invest in a three-wheeler van/Refaccionar su auto y aumentar el monto para comprar un motocarro

loans.name: Erlene

texts.en:
Arlene N. is a rice farmer. She is 48 years old and has nine children. She started her farm business using a 1-hectare lot that she inherited from her parents. She wants to buy more field to increase her business. Currently, Arlene is working as a barangay (village) health worker. When she is not busy in her work, she helps her husband, Solomon N., with taking care of the crops.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from Kiva's partner CEVI. She will use the loan to buy herbicide and fertilizers for her crops. The loan will help her achieve better yield. In that way, she believes, she could better support the needs of her children.

CEVI is reaching out to more people, especially the poor, to help start and have their own businesses. CEVI provides their clients with credit, training and insurance-coverage services to help their small businesses to grow.

loans.use: To purchase herbicide and fertilizer

loans.name: Edoh Koffi

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme réside dans le quartier de Kagomé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé,  il est  un jeune célibataire qui travaille dur pour subvenir à ses besoins, il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce  de produits d’alimentation générale, il exerce son commerce dans une boutique. Voulant agrandir son stock il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 cartons de spaghetti, 3 cartons de savons « BF », 7 cartons de lait « Peak », 5 Bidons d’huile rouge, des cartes de recharges et divers.
texts.en:
This young man lives in the Kagomé district, an outlying neighborhood of the city of Lomé. He is single and works hard to support himself. He earns a living selling groceries in a shop. Wishing to expand his stock, he is asking WAGES for his first loan to buy 10 cases of spaghetti, 3 cases of "BF" soap, 7 cases of « Peak » milk, 5 jerry cans of red (palm) oil, rechargeable phone cards, and various other items.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad R. makes a living primarily from manufacturing and selling products like sawali (woven bamboo mats used to construct walls) to local businesses and community members. She is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 48 years old, married and has six school-aged children. Trinidad has been in this business for over 23 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Trinidad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Trinidad is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase bamboo for manufacturing sawali. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children for this coming school year.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo to manufacture sawali

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Dora Isabel

texts.es: La señora Dora cuaresma , tiene la edad de 46 años , habita en el barrio Cebadilla , junto a su esposo , el cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene  cinco hijos , dos ya son casados e independiente ; pero le apoyan y tres que están a su cargo de 17,15,12 años actualmente estudiantes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Dora desde hace 21 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , las plagas que afectan a los cultivos ya que carecen de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios . El plan futuro hacia sus cultivos es poder darle un mejor mantenimiento, para poder vender a un buen precio. Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo.
texts.en:
Dora is 46 years old, and lives in the Cebadilla neighborhood with her husband, who works to help with the expenses. They have five children. Two are married and independent, but they support them, and three (ages 17, 15, and 12 - all students) are still under their parents' care.

Dora's plan for her family is to improve their quality of life. For 21 years, Dora has worked in agriculture. The biggest difficulty is the lack of funding and the plagues that affect the crops as she lacks the necessary fertilizers and supplies.

Her plan for the future is to be able to better manage her crops so that she may sell them at a good price. With the funding obtained through this loan, she will buy fertilizers and supplies to apply to her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and supplies for her crops

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie T. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 44 years old. Elsie is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Elsie operates a fishing business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Elsie joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Elsie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Luisa Lilliam

texts.es:
Desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana en el M. Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Luisa Lilliam G. se dedica a laborar arduamente en su negocio de venta de frutas y de verduras vendiendo principalmente la pitahaya el cual es muy vendida por lo que requiere tener mucho almacenamiento para ofrecerlas a sus clientes.

La razón exclusiva por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel una vez mas es porque necesita de un crédito para la compra de las pitahayas y al adquirirlas poder venderlas sin ningún problema en su localidad en el M. Mayoreo.
texts.en:
Luisa Lilliam G. works arduously in her business of selling fruits and vegetables. She works in the Mayoreo market, and she starts very early in the morning. She primarily sells pitahaya (national fruit also known as dragon fruit). A lot of pitahaya is sold, so she needs to have a lot of storage space to offer it to her customers. The reason she has come to Ceprodel once more is because she needs a loan to buy the pitahayas and be able to sell them without problem from her place in the Mayoreo market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pitahayas (national fruit also known as dragon fruit)

loans.name: Iniciadores De Ameca Group

texts.es:
La señora  Lidia C. pertenece al grupo INICIADORES DE AMECA  en la comunidad de Santiago en el municipio de Ameca Ameca,Estado de México  que se encuentra a pies de los volcanes.
La señora Lidia es viuda  vive a orillas del volcán Popocatepetl, ella tiene una pequeño criadero de pollitos; el clima del poblado es frío lo que ocasiona que tenga pequeñas perdidas  por que no todos los pollitos sobreviven, ella no cuenta con los suficientes recursos economicos para poder equipar el criadero de pollitos, razón por la cual se une con otros compañeros que tambien tienen las mismas necesidades, por lo que se unes y forman un grupo, para poder solicitar un credito atravez de fundación realidad A. C. con el crédito comprara una  cámara de gas y mantener un clima calido logrando una mayor producción ya que de esta actividad depende ella y su nieto, su nieto viaja al Estado de Hidalgo para hacer la venta de dichos pollitos. Ellos sueñan con tener una mayor producción de pollitos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. 
El grupo Iniciadores de Ameca esta conformado por 4 integrantes:
Maria Graciana, la cual tiene una tienda de abarrotes, Marlen R., Da mantenimiento a equipo de computo y el Señor Gervacio B. que cuenta con un puesto de antojitos y comida corrida. 
Solicitan un crédito grupal de $20,000 pesos.
texts.en:
Lidia C. belongs to the Iniciadores De Ameca group in the community of Santiago, municipality of Ameca, Mexico, at the feet of volcanoes. Lidia is a widow who lives at the bank of the Popocatepetl volcano. She has a small chick farm, and because the village's climate is cool she occasionally loses a few of them since not all the chicks are able to survive. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so she can purchase a gas coup and maintain a warm climate, which will give her a better production in the business she and her grandson depend on. Her grandson travels to the state of Hidalgo to sell the chicks. They dream of having better production from their chicks so they are able to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a gas coup

location.town: Santiago, Municipio de Ameca Ameca, Estado de Mexi

loans.name: Ghanem

texts.en: Ghanem is a hardworking man that strives every day to provide for his entire family, which consists of his wife and nine children. He manages a grocery store where he sells many staples, such as bread, juice, sweets, and other preserved foods. In order to purchase additional foodstuffs and increase his inventory, Ghanem is requesting a loan of $2000 USD. This micro-entrepreneur is qualified to receive this loan considering the profitability of his business, his determination, and his experience. Ghanem is counting on your help. Your support will really help him.

loans.use: Purchase additional foodstuffs and increase his inventory

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Mrs. Dina N., age 26, and her husband, Mr. Vanny Um, age 28, were married in 2000 and have three sons and one daughter. Two of their children are in school and other two are still young. The family lives on an island off the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Dina has been a silk weaver for three years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been driving a horse cart for ten years. 

Dina doesn’t have enough capital to purchase silk materials for her weaving business. So, she is requesting a loan of $200 to make the purchases.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Ekua Janet

texts.en:
Ekua Janet A. sells used clothing at Elmina near the new market. She has received senior high school education. She is married and has four children and her husband is a trader.

Janet Ekua has been selling used clothing since 2001. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and apartment rent. Her loan will be used to buy more used clothing to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es: Zoila Rosa C. Jirón tiene 50 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica al destace de cerdo, por lo que además realiza la elaboración de nacatamales. Ella dio inicio a esta actividad porque logro conseguir con mucho esfuerzo una cierta cantidad de dinero para la compra de dos cerditos y posteriormente los destazo y obtuvo algo de ganancias, por lo que le gusto mucho trabajar en este tipo de negocio ya que por medio de esto logro proporcionarle la manutención necesaria. Ahora está solicitando este financiamiento para comprar hojas, masa, cerdos, leña, arroz, tocino, chiltoma, yerba buena, papa, cebolla entre otros. En futuro le gustaría tener un lugar propio para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Zoila Rosa C. J. is 50 years old and she runs a grocery store. For the past 11 years she has been a pork butcher, and she also makes steamed corn cakes called nacatamales.
