In the beginning she started out after she managed with a great deal of effort to save enough money to buy two piglets. Later she butchered them and earned a small profit. But she really enjoyed this type of work as well as the business, and eventually she managed to establish it. She is currently requesting aloan to purchase banana leaves, corn dough, pork livestock, firewood, rice, bacon, hot peppers, mint leaves, potatoes, onions and other ingredients. In the future she would like to have her own place to sell her products.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is twenty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to one daughter who is in school. She lives with her daughter and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Margaret works to help her husband financially to provide for the family. She is a hairdresser by profession. She has her shop by the roadside in her community and currently has one apprentice. She wants a loan to buy materials like artificial hair, pomade, etc.

Margaret has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy more working materials to improve her services.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 29-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon with her husband and one child.

Mary has been selling accessories for nine years. She sells perfumes, beauty products, make up, hair accessories and lots more. She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and to buy a display shelf for her shop. This is her second loan and she has always repaid on time.

Mary is special in her work because of her location. Her clients are her friends and neighbors and people from her region. She decided on doing her business because of her previous work experience in sales but she had difficulty finding the proper place to open her shop. In the future, she plans on improving her shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and to buy a display shelf for her shop

loans.name: Arvin

texts.en:
Arvin D. is from the village of Poblacion, Catarman Camiguin Province. He is 31 years old. Arvin is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Arvin makes and sells food.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from peddling specialty food products like "chicharon," a dish made from fried pork rinds, in the local community. Arvin has been engaged in his business for more than 8 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Arvin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business. Arvin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000  PHP  from HSPFI.  Arvin is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan that Arvin has taken out from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to improve and expand his business.. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and serves the low-income households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more food goods

loans.name: Cruz Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Cruz Del Socorro  tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos y el hijo menor esta a su cargo. Ella tiene la actividad económica de venta de productos lácteos ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 21 años, ella empezó vendiendo leña y frijoles a sus vecinos. Sin embargo con el tiempo logro establecer su actividad. Ya que ella ha mejorado poco a poco su actividad. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima como queso, cuajada, mantequilla y crema. Por lo que es una mujer muy trabajadora y que es famosa por la venta de sus productos. Ella sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cruz Del Socorro, 54, is married and has 4 children, the youngest of whom is still dependent on her. She sells dairy products from her home. She began her business 21 years ago selling beans and firewood to her neighbors. In time, she became established as she gradually improved her activity . She will use the funds to buy raw materials like: cheese, curd, butter and cream. She is a hard-working woman who is famous for the sale of her products. She dreams with making some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials like cheese, curd, butter and cream.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Yuri Elena

texts.es: La señora Yuri tiene negocio de ventas de pinturas varias, ella va a utilizar el crédito para invertirlo en el mismo y así poder incrementar sus ventas y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes esto con el fin de tener una mayor ganancia, el negocio lo empezó el papa con capital propio y desde hace ya mas de tres años doña Yuri esta al frente de la administración del mismo ella es soltera y estudia  además ayuda a su familia en el sustento de la misma  también a su abuelita que vive con ellos, desde tempranas horas abren el negocio en donde se mantienen en constante movimiento ya que también les hacen pedidos de materiales los cuales ellos se encargan de llevarlos a los talleres con los que trabajan.
texts.en:
Yuri’s business is selling different paints. She will use the loan to invest in her business. That way she will be able to increase her sales and give her customers better service. In the end, she will have greater earnings. Her father started the business with his own money over three years ago. Yuri is in charge of the administration of the business. She is single, and she goes to school. She also helps support her family, which includes her grandmother who lives with them. They open the business very early, and they are in constant motion. They also take orders for materials that they deliver to the shops they work with.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith (33) y Rolando (28), son dos responsables padres que trabajan arduamente a favor D. sus dos hijos: PameL. (5) y Matías (5). Todos ellos viven en L. casa que le cedieron los padres D. Judith.

DesD. algunos años atrás, Rolando viene brindando el servicio D. taxi y elL. para apoyar con los gastos del hogar vio L. oportunidad D. trabajar desD. su casa con L. venta D. cosméticos. DesD. entonces ambos trabajan por salir adelante, cada uno en su negocio, pero con un solo fin, brindarles a sus pequeños una buena calidad D. vida.
A elL. le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le permite pasar tiempo con sus hijos, ayudándolos en su tareas, (sus pequeños ya asisten al nido) y también trabajar mientras realiza las labores del hogar. 
Para el futuro Judith ve a su familia con una mejor vivienda y mejores oportunidades, es por ello que se toma su trabajo muy en serio. 

Este es su onceavo préstamo con MFP y le gusta mucho ser parte D. su grupo, pues todas sus compañeras también son muy puntuales con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad D. mercadería en productos comestibles para equipar mejor su tienda y sí ganar más clientes.
texts.en:
Judith (33) and Rolando (28) are two responsible parents who work arduously for their two children: PameL. (5) and Matías (5). They all live in the house given to them by Judith's parents. For some years, Rolando has been providing taxi services. To help with the household expenses, Judith saw the opportunity to work from her home selling cosmetics. Since then, both have been working to get ahead, each with their own business but with the same goal to proviD. their children a good quality of life. Judith likes her work a lot since it allows her to spend time with her children, to help them with their homework (they both attend school) and to work while she does housework. In her future, Judith sees her family with a better home and better opportunities. This is why she takes her work seriously. This is Judith's eleventh loan with MFP and she enjoys being a part of this group because all of her partners are also very punctual with their payments. With the money she is requesting Judith will buy more groceries to better stock her store and win more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to stock store.

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn P. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 26 years old. Ronelyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Ronelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Ronelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ronelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ronelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita Q. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling copra, or dried coconut, in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Nenita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her eighth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 38 years old, married to Teresia Njeri, and they have three school-going children.  He has been a farmer for the last ten years.

Peter was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to buy pesticides for his field with this loan.

He hopes to buy a bigger farm which will increase his farm production, making him able to supply in bulk to others at the market.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

loans.name: Auntie

texts.en: Auntie T. is a fish monger in Akotokyire. She goes to the nearby seashore to buy fish from the fishermen to smoke and then to sell. Auntie has been educated up to the senior high level. She is married to an office clerk and has five dependants. She provides a helping hand to her husband for the general welfare of their home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to process (smoke) for sale. She hopes to use the new income from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to process (smoke) for sale

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo sells planks at retail prices. He is a hard working man and he hopes to expand in his business. He is 40 years old, married with 3 children. His wife is a teacher and she also supports their home.  He is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 130,000 to purchase more planks to sell. He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen S., 67, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She and her husband produce hammocks for an income of about $1 each per day. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a generator to start a new business of recharging batteries. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy a generator

loans.name: Groupe 1 De Nissondiya

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe 1 de l’association Nissondiya de Daoulabougou sont des femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Daoulabougou dans la commune rurale de Konodimini dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des relations de parenté et de mariage dans ce même village. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs productions en culture d’arachide (telle Mama C.) et de mil, elles ont décidé d’intégrer Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ier  cycle de prêt de campagne.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 2 tonnes d’engrais, 800kg de semences d’arachide et recruter de la main d’œuvre masculine pour effectuer le labour. 
Elles se ravitaillent en intrants agricoles à  Konodimini auprès des grossistes.
Tandis qu’elles espèrent avoir 30 tonnes d’arachide et 6 tonnes de mil, Mama C. la présidente du groupe espère obtenir 5 tonnes d’arachide dans son exploitation. 
Une partie de la production est auto consommée et le reste est destiné à la vente pour payer la scolarité des enfants et prendre en charge certains besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the 1st group of the Association Nissondiya of Daoulabougou are married women, mostly in polygamous families. On average, they are 42 years old with 3 children. They live in the village of Daoulabougou, in the rural commune Konodimini, in the Ségou region (Mali’s 4th Administrative Region.) They became acquainted with one another through marriage and because they are all from the same village. Like Mama C., the president of the group, the women decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to augment the productivity of their peanut and millet farms. This is their first loan cycle. They plan to use the proceeds to purchase 2 tons of fertilizer and 800 kilograms of seeds, and to hire men to do the manual labor.They purchase their soil amendments from wholesalers in Konodimini. Altogether, they expect to raise 30 tons of peanuts and 6 tons of millet. Mama Coulibably, group president, expects her farm to produce 5 tons of peanuts. Part of the production will be for their families’ consumption, and the rest will be sold to pay for children’s schooling and to help with household expenses.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pay hired laborers

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.en: Beatriz M. M., 33, lives in Barranquilla with her husband and 5 children who range in age from 2 to 18. She runs a business renting washing machines as well as selling various small items of merchandise. She started out with this business in 1999 during a time when her husband was without consistent employment and the family needed to increase its earnings. Beatriz bought two washing machines on credit and, building off the success of this venture, was gradually able to both pay off her loans and acquire more washing machines, three at a time until she reached her current total of 13. This loan represents her second from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization she has been working with for the last four years and which she believes has improved her living conditions and her income. Beatriz dreams of eventually having a small shop which is why she started her side business selling merchandise in her home, which has given her additional and consistent income. She has requested this loan from Kiva  to buy three more washing machines, and other items such as cosmetics and women's clothes ordered by her clients, as well as to fix her bathroom floor. Shirley's biggest challenge is the competition which grows each day, but she always stays positive and does her best to help her clients and give them the best service possible.

loans.use: To buy three washing machines and cosmetics and clothing ordered by her clients as well as to fix her bathroom floor

loans.name: Monishon's Group

texts.en: Unity is the premise of success and welfare. When all members of a family are united, this family will always be able to easily overcome temporary difficulties. Monishon Y., the leader of this group, has such a family. Monishon is forty years old and has raised three children. Her husband works as a security guard in a hospital. As to Monishon, she is engaged in selling milk and milk products. She can always rely on her family, be it her husband or her daughters. In the past, they used to just farm their piece of land. However, later, they were able to save sufficient funds to purchase cattle. Since then, they have also been breeding cattle, which has allowed them to buy new furniture for their house. Monishon’s daughters often sell milk from her business and they do their best to help their mother out. Monishon realizes that there is much work ahead. She plans to marry her daughter, provide a college education for her other two daughters and also make an extensive repair of their house. Now, Monishon’s monthly income is around 70 USD, and this is not sufficient to save money. She needs a loan to purchase sheep or goats to raise. That way she will be able to increase her income. Monishon’s partners: Motaborhon M., 41, is married and has a son. Her husband is a builder. Motaborhon is engaged in selling milk and milk products. Besides that, she works as a nurse. She needs a loan to purchase sheep to raise. Rohathan T., 36, has three daughters and breeds sheep. All her daughters are school students and, in their free time, actively help their parents to look after the cattle. Rohathan has applied for this loan to purchase some sheep to increase the total population of their livestock. Hafisahon U., 27, is engaged in breeding sheep but her regular job is in a hospital where she works as a nurse. She is married and, for now, does not have children. She hopes to obtain this loan and purchase sheep for breeding. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase sheep or goats to raise

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifanía nació y vive en la ciudad D. Ollantaytambo. El distrito D. Ollantaytambo, se encuentra en la Provincia D. Urubamba, departamento del Cusco, localizándose a 91 km. D. la ciudad del Cusco a través D. la vía Asfaltada. Ollantaytambo es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos incas. Construida en la base D. la antigua ciudad inca. 

Epifanía que se dedica tradicionalmente a la agricultura, ve hoy en el turismo una oportunidad para mejorar su calidad D. vida, ella tiene un puesto D. venta en el mercado principal D. venta D. artesanía “Mañaraqui, donD. venD. chullos, guantes, sombreros, bolsos, carteras, ponchos y también venD. bebidas refrescantes como gaseosas y agua mineral. Hace 30 años que empezó este negocio y con un poco D. capital pero ahora, ella tiene un stand  y pertenece a la asociación  D. artesanos D. Ollantaytambo. La pueden encontrar en su puesto que está equipado con una variedad D. artesanía, ella sale a vender tres veces  a la semana desD. las 8 D. la mañana hasta muy tarD. o hasta que todos los turistas se vayan del mercado.  Epifanía desprenD. una imagen D. una mujer trabajadora y responsable. Un flujo D. turistas vistan el mercado y el negocio se anima bastante durante la hora en que llegan los turistas a visitar la hermosas ruinas Incas. Ella venD. sus productos a un precio cómodo y accesible para los clientes y sobre todo D. buena calidad, esto la distingue D. sus demás compañeras D. trabajo. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Epifanía espera recibir $ 300 dólares USD. Por el momento, desea incrementar el capital del negocio y va comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo, chullos, bolsas, guantes, ponchos y muchos productos más y así esta manera poder abastecer su puesto D. venta porque en estos meses es donD. llegan muchos turistas a visitar las ruinas Incas y a comprar artesanía.   Epifanía pertenece al banco comunal “La Amistad D. Ollantaytambo”, un término que hace honor a la amistad que tienen todas las socias del banco comunal.
texts.en:
Epifanía lives in the city of Ollantaytambo, where she was born. The Ollantaytambo district is in the province of Urubamba, department of Cuzco, located 91 km. from Cuzco on the highway. Ollantaytambo is a charming city that dates back to the time of the Incas, built on the base of the ancient Inca city. Epifanía had traditionally worked in farming, but today sees tourism as the opportunity to improve her standard of living. She has a sales booth in the Mañaraqui crafts market, where she sells “chullos” (Peruvian hat with earflaps maD. from vicuña, alpaca, llama or sheep's wool), gloves, hats, bags, purses, ponchos, and she also sells soft drinks and mineral water. She started this business 30 years ago with a little capital, but she now has a stand and belongs to the Ollantaytambo crafts association. She can be found in her stand, which is stocked with a variety of crafts. She goes out to sell three times a week, from 8 in the morning until very late, or until all tourists have left the market. Epifanía appears to be a hard-working, reliable woman. Crowds of tourists visit the market, and business is quite lively when they come to see the beautiful Inca ruins. She sells her goods at prices that are appropriate and reasonable for her customers, and especially good quality, which is what distinguishes her from her colleagues at work. Epifanía hopes to get $300 USD for her next loan. For now, she wants to increase her working capital and will buy more merchandise, such as chullos, bags, gloves, ponchos, and many other products. This way, she can stock her booth, for this is the time when many tourists visit the Inca ruins and buy crafts. Epifanía belongs to the Ollantaytambo Friendship communal bank, the name given in honor of the friendship enjoyed by all its members.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise, such as Peruvian-style caps, bags, gloves, ponchos, and other products.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane M., from the village of Balzain West, Tuguegarao City, is 46 years old. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns & operates a general retail store.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste to the local community. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her store's product offering. This loan will be Mary Jane's 1st loan from ASKI. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Rima Group

texts.fr:
Aline C. est une commerçante âgée de 30 ans qui habite  à Rugombo dans la Province de Cibitoke située à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de produits alimentaires comme le grain de maïs et le haricot au Marché de Cibitoke.C’est un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 6 mois mais faisait le commerce de bière de banane avant de commencer ce métier. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 4e année des études primaires. Son époux, Ladislas Ndabanogeye est un cultivateur. Elle arrive au 3e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 2 garçons âgés de 6ans et 2ans. L’aîné fait la maternelle.
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter la quantité de produits alimentaires à vendre dans l’espoir d’avoir un grand bénéfice. Elle espère avoir son propre capital dans l’avenir qui lui permettra de faire un grand business et réaliser ses projets comme la construction de sa propre maison, assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et autres.
 
 Elle  est une des membres du groupe  communautaire « RIMA».
texts.en:
Aline C., a member of the Rima community loan group, is a 30-year-old merchant who lives in Rugombo in the Cibitoke province, located in western Burundi. She runs a business selling food products such as maize and beans at the Cibitoke Market. She has run this business for 6 months, but used to sell banana beer before starting her current business. She attended school through the 4th year of her primary education. Her husband, Ladislas Ndabanogeye, is a farmer. She has reached her third group loan cycle with Turame. She is mother of two boys, aged 6 and 2. The older of the two is in kindergarten. She is seeking this loan from Kiva to increase the quantity of food products she can sell, with the hope of generating a larger profit. She hopes to have her own capital base in the future, which will allow her to run a large business and realize her projects, which include building her own house and ensuring her children's education, among others.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of food products for sale, with the hope of generating a larger profit

loans.name: Marlo Leonel

texts.es:
el sr. Marlo Leonel C. se dedica al comercio, tiene un negocio que opera bajo el nombre de BODEGUITA BELLA, tiene seis años de tener su negocio el cual esta ubicado en la calle principal de la colonia Predios del Recreo.
Su negocio cuenta con una variedad de productos desde carnes, lácteos, agua y recargas telefónicas.
Marlo atiende todos los días de la semana, el se encarga de ir al mercado a comprar sus productos y su esposa le ayuda con la atención de sus clientes cuando el no esta.
Así mismo recibe otros ingresos ya que se dedica a la producción de plátanos y a la cría de cerdos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su bodeguita, ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son muchas y desea tener contenta su clientela.
las ganancias las necesita para sacar adelante a su familia que es lo mas importante que tiene en la vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Marlo Leonel C. is a merchant. He has had a store called BODEGUITA BELLA for six years located on Predios del Recreo neighborhood’s main street. His store is stocked with a variety of products from meats to dairy products, water and telephone time cards. Marlo is open for business every day of the week. He goes to the market to buy his products and his wife helps him tend to customers when he’s away. He also earns extra income as a banana grower and raising pigs. He will use the loan to buy stock merchandise for the store because his customer demands are many and he wants to keep them happy. He needs the profits to support his family which is the most important thing he has in his life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toothpaste, toilet paper, eggs, margarine, lard, cooking oil, pills, plastic bags, sweets, balls, batteries, candles, matches, powdered drink mix, rice, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Danninova

texts.en:
Danninova I. is a 61-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store.  She lives in Proper Mahawak, Brgy. Mahawak, Medellin, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Danninova is now borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Danninova aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina M. is from the village of Lumbayoa, Tampilisan, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 28 years old. Gina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she harvests and sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $210 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Gina is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 38-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married and his wife is a peasant farmer. They have eight children and so look after a family of ten people. Patrick operates a butcher shop and has been in the business for the last 20 years. He adds that in his business, capital is ever an issue depending on demand for beef. Patrick intends to use the loan proceeds to buy goats to sell as meat at his butcher shop.

loans.use: Buying goats to sell as meat

loans.name: Work Together Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very please to present to you the members of the “Work Together” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000.00 each to invest in their respective businesses. 

Fatmata B. is the leader of this group. Fatmata is a twenty-seven-year-old woman who was born in Makeni. She is married and has two children who attend primary school. Fatmata sells food and has been a businesswoman for thirteen years. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying bags of gari, a fast food made from cassava roots, to add to her business.

loans.use: Buys bags of gari to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials.

loans.name: Eugene

texts.fr: Eugene R. est marié, et il a 5 enfants entre 10 ans et 13 ans.  Il est un membre de l’armee Patriotique Rwandais. Quatre de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter des pierres, ciments, des portes, des fenêtres et du sable pour renouveler sa maison.  Il voudrait avoir une vie plus aisée, développer son pays et arriver à avoir une usine du lait.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait nourrir bien les enfants et leur mère, et aussi l’éducation pour ses enfants.
texts.en: Eugene R. is married and has five children, from 10 to 13 years of age. He is a member of Rwandan Patriotic Army. Four of his children go to school. He would like to use his loan to purchase stones, cement, doors, windows and sand in order to repair his house. He would like to improve his quality of life, to cultivate his land and eventually to have a milk factory. As to his family, he would like to provide well for the children and their mother, and for the children’s education as well.

loans.use: Purchasing stones, cement, doors, windows and sand

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is single. He lives in Kamenka. Sergey grows early spring tomatoes. He owns eight greenhouses and a separate one for seedlings. 

Sergey plants and grows 8,500 tall-grown tomatoes every year. He has been in agriculture for 10 years. Currently, Sergey has already invested 150,000 Grivnyas in this business. His annual expenses on seeds and polyethylene film amount to 40,000 Grivnyas.  

Sergey is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to construct two more greenhouses on recently-purchased land. He is hoping to plant more tomatoes in additional greenhouses. Profit generated will be invested in further improvement of conditions in his greenhouses. Sergey is planning to install heating units in all of his greenhouses in the next year.

loans.use: To construct two greenhouses.

loans.name: Nuanua

texts.en:
Nuanua M. is a 63-year-old woman living in the town of Saasaai.  She is married and has 8 adult children.  To make a living, Nuanua owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business is planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Nuanua has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 150 WST a month from these activities.

In 2010, Nuanua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services in order to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nuanua is requesting a loan of 1000 WST, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.  The loan will be Nuanua's first from SPBD.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Abdullateef

texts.en:
Abdullateef is a young man from Tulkarem town. He is an engineer. Abdullateef is working with his dad in the farm they have, where they grow fruits and seasonal vegetables. Abdullateef took a loan from FATEN to purchase and install a greenhouse in the farm, and to be able to grow more vegetables in different seasons.

Abdullateef, who appears in the picture above, wants to improve the farm and increase the production. He and his father are taking care of the family household expenses.

loans.use: Purchasing a greenhouse to increase production

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita A. is from the village of San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 60 years old, married and has 10 adult-aged children. Conchita owns and operates a business providing general services to local community members. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Conchita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Conchita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Liloy-San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
Felma S. is from the village of Wadya, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 36 years old. Felma is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Felma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & beverages in the local community. Felma has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Felma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Felma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Pamela Corales' Group

texts.en:
Pamela C. is from the village of Union, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is the leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Pamela is 33 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Pamela owns and operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Pamela has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Pamela joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Pamela is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jefrey

texts.en:
Jefrey M. is 23 years old and single. He is from the village of Quiling within Roxas municipality, a part of Isabela province on the Luzon islands. Jefrey sells agricultural materials and equipment such as crop fertilizers and manure to local farmers. Jefrey is just starting this business.

In 2011, Jefrey joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Jefrey is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This will be Jefrey’s first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his offerings of agricultural products

loans.name: Lina Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos la señora Lina, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y fruto de  esta relación tiene tres hijos, uno es mayor de edad y los otros  de 16 y 9 años, todos estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo trabaja en otro país.
 
Tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, en ella también vende artículos de bazar, ropa, ciertos remedios y productos de papelería. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00, su mamá y sus hijos le ayudan cuando ellos pueden y tiene tiempo. Los productos los recibe de distribuidores que le llevan hasta su local. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio ya siete años y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo quiere invertir en comprar más productos como: arroz, azúcar, enlatados, detergentes, carnes, pescado, remedios y otros.  Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 10 años y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy cumplidas.

Sus sueños son seguir mejorando dia a dia.
texts.en:
The Esperanza y Progreso [Hope and Progress] community bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton. The place is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisanal crafts, recognized nationally and internationally. This is where the famous 'paja toquilla' [Panama hats] are from.  

In this place we met Lina, 40 years old. She is married and has three children. One in an adult and the others are 16 and 9. All of them go to college, highschool and school. Her husband works in another country. 
 
She has a grocery store in her house. She also sells other products there, such as clothes, certain remedies and paper products. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. Her mother and her children help her when they can and have time. She receives products from distributors who deliver them to her locale. She tells us that she has had the business for seven years already and it is going very well for her.  

She will invest this loan in buying more products such as: rice, sugar, canned goods, detergents, meat, fish, remedies, etc. She has been in the community bank for 10 years because the other members are very responsible.

Her dreams are to keep going day to day.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods, detergents, meat, fish, remedies, etc.

loans.name: Radia

texts.en:
Radia Y. is a 35-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have three children, two of whom currently attend school. Her husband is a farmer.

To earn a living, she sells fruits and vegetables. She is seeking a loan to increase her stock of fruits and vegetables. Her future goal is to be able to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is a young woman from Jenin. Nabeela is a mother of one daughter and two sons. Nabeela's husband is a Paletsinian National Authority employee and receives a decent salary.

Nabeela, who is photographed above, and her husband purchase necessary pieces of furniture slowly as they can't furnish the whole house at once. Nabeela took out a loan from FATEN to purchase furniture for their sons' room.

loans.use: to purchase house furniture.

loans.name: Ingris Joana

texts.es:
Ingris es la propietaria del negocio "Restaurante Delicias del Rancho" en el barrio el Porvenir de la ciudad de Barranquilla. A ingris su espíritu libre e independiente la llevó a crear su propio negocio hace dos años,  después de renunciar al trabajo que desempeñaba como  empleada doméstica, cuando con un hermano tomó la decisión de iniciar su aventura de emprendimiento. El negocio se ha especializado en la venta de comidas corrientes  y su clientela está conformada por trabajadores del sector  y empleados distantes a su vivienda a quienes   envía su comida mediante el servicio de domicilio y les ofrece un amble servicio.
El restaurante funciona los lunes los sábados y cuenta con una rokola, equipo de sonido al cual se le introduce $200 COP para escuchar una canción y su respectivo  video. Su meta más adelante es mejorar las instalaciones locativas del negocio e incrementar sus   ventas; aunque su mayor desafío es la fuerte competencia  logra controlarla ofreciendo precios competitivos.
Su credikiva es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el planea comprar víveres en volúmenes para obtener descuentos y poder ofrecer precios acomodados a las posibilidades de su clientela. Mientras trabaja para poder cumplir sus metas, Ingris  en su negocio está generando una  utilidad que en la actualidad es no menor del 20% y que muy seguramente aumentará por su capacidad de trabajo y la disciplina  que aplica a todo lo que hace.
texts.en:
Ingris is the owner of "Restaurante Delicias del Rancho" in El Porvenir neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla.  Ingris' free and independent spirit led her to set up her own business two years ago.  She left her previous work as a maid when she and one of her brothers made the decision to start their own entrepreneurial venture.  Her business is selling fast food and her customers are local workers and employees who are located further away from her home who she sends food to through her home-delivery service, offering them a friendly service.

Her restaurant is open Mondays and Saturdays.  She has a jukebox sound system in which people insert 200 pesos to listen to a song and watch its respective video.  Her future goal is to improve her business premises and increase her sales.  Her biggest challenge is the strong competition.  She manages to survive the competition by selling her food at competitive prices.

This Kiva loan is Ingris' first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to use it to buy food products in bulk so that she can obtain discounts and offer her meals to her customers at affordable prices.  While she is working to achieve her goals, Ingris is currently making profits of no less than 20% in her business.  She will almost certainly increase these profits because of her capacity for work and the discipline that she applies to everything she does.

loans.use: to buy food products in bulk to obtain discounts

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is the married parent of three children who works hard to support her family. She has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines and also earns additional income from rice farming. Felicidad has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and her previous six loans from NWTF. 

Felicidad is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell. In the future, she hopes that her hard work will help attain her dream of saving enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Salohidin

texts.en:
Salohidin is a hardworking man. He is married and the father of one daughter. He sells grocery products in his store. He started his business with the small sum of 1000 Tajikistan somonis (TJS) three years ago. Today his working capital is 8500 TJS. His store is located in the central market of his village called Zimtud. Salohidin would like to get a loan of 5100 TJS in order to purchase new goods for the needs of his village's people. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International 

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History 

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a new assortments of foods

loans.name: Ana Jensy

texts.es: Ana Jensy, tiene la edad de 25 años, soltera  y vive sola actualmente. Ella pretende con el dinero realizar la compra de mercadería para su pulpería y tener un mayor surtido de productos. Ella cuenta con el local a su poder y quiere brindarles a sus compradores un mejor surtido de productos para aumentar la clientela y generar ganancias para su futuro. Ella quiere generar ganancias ahora que no tienen responsabilidades y poder guardar sus ganancias para en su futuro tener una estabilidad económica y un bienestar familiar estable. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ana Jensy is 25 years old, single, and currently lives alone. She plans to use the loan money to purchase merchandise for her pulpería [small grocery store] and to have a greater variety of products. She has the space at her disposal and would like to offer her customers a greater selection of products in order to increase her clientele and create income for her future. Ana would like to generate income now, when she does not have any responsibilities, so that she can save her earnings to have more economic stability and well-being for her family in the future. This is the first loan she has received through FUDECOSUR. She has not had previous loans through state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy stock for her small grocery store

loans.name: Gleseria

texts.en:
Gleseria is a married mother of seven school-aged children. She is 49 years old and lives in Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is a farmer. The main source of income for her agricultural business comes from the planting and harvesting of corn. She has been engaged in this business for over three years, and earns PHP 15,000 quarterly. 

Gleseria has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer.  She has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, she hopes to start another business and build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Mohamed B.

texts.en:
Mohamed, age 37, established his liquor sales business in 2006. He began his endeavor because he had to drop out of school after the death of his father, who had been responsible for his school fees. Mohamed had to take to business to support his mother and his other brothers and sisters. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

Mohamed and his wife have three children, ages six, 10, and 12. He has two additional dependents who live with him because he decided to support them while they attend school. 

Mohamed would like to request a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. He has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy ten cartons of bumba gin (Le 150,000), 20 cartons of chocolate pega (Le 168,000), and 15 cartons of bitter cola pega (Le 168,000). He expects that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to open another shop and hire a salesperson to help him sell his wares at the new shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy ten cartons of bumba gin, 20 cartons of chocolate pega, and 15 cartons of bitter cola pega

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Dolores has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods & beverages to sell.

Dolores is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Dolores hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods & beverages to sell

loans.name: Flor Viviana

texts.es: La Sra. Flor es casada, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad; ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, tiene su tienda en su casa, ya lleva en el negocio más de un año, eligió este negocio ya que su esposo es mecánico y donde él llegan bastantes transportistas, lo que hace más atractivo su negocio. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abarrotes de primera necesidad (azúcar, arroz, leche entre otros); su principal desafío que enfrenta Flor es el tiempo ya que tiene que compartirlo con el cuidado de su menor hijo y la atención en el negocio; su sueño es tener una gran tienda y ser una de las abastecedoras de la zona. La Sra. Flor está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Flor is married and has a 3-year old son.  She sells basic food items out of her house, and has done so for the past year.  She chose this business since her husband is a mechanic and many drivers come to the house to get work done, making the business viable.  This loan will be used to buy staples such as sugar, rice, milk and other items.  Flor says that her biggest challenge is dividing her time between her son and the business, and dreams of having a larger store one day and becoming one the biggest suppliers in her neighborhood.  She is very grateful for the credit given to her.

loans.use: to buy inventory for store

loans.name: Nelly Del Carmen

texts.es: Este cliente se desempeña como secretaria en un organismo no gubernamental, es casada sin hijos y solicita crédito para algunas mejoras del hogar, la casa donde habita es propia el esposo labora como conductor independiente para la obtención de otros ingresos del hogar.
texts.en: This client works as a secretary for a non-governmental organization (NGO).  She is married and has no children.  The loan she is requesting will be used to make a few improvements to her home.  She owns the house in which she lives.  Her husband works as an independent driver in order to generate additional household income.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
Shahin, 32, is married and has two children. He works in the agricultural industry. Five years ago he decided to cultivate the land he owned. He did so to generate more income so he could support his family. Shahin grows wheat, corn, fruits and vegetables, which he carefully tends so that he can produce a full, healthy harvest. He will use the loan money to buy seed and organic fertilizer that will enable him to improve his production yield. This will be his third loan and he has a good credit history.
Shahin enjoys doing this job, and that's why he will continue to use loans so he can improve his farm and become a better farmer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 25 years old, married and has one child who is not yet old enough to attend school. She earns a living by selling rice, sugar and oil on a busy street near where she lives in South Sudan. She has been in this line of work for four years and is applying for a loan from BRAC South Sudan so that she can expand her business. Her goal is to buy a plot of land and build a house for her family to live in.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ndania

texts.en:
Ndania is 52 years old, married to Aaron, and together they have three children ages 25, 17 and 15 years old. Ndania sells poultry and also eggs. She has been in the business for the past 6 years. She gets a monthly income of 3,500 KES from her business.

This is her third loan term from KADET. She paid her previous loans successfully. Ndania will use the loan amount to buy more chicks and also buy eggs for resale. She will buy more poultry with extra profits she will get. Her dream is to sell eggs on a large scale.

loans.use: purchase chicks and eggs

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es:
Flor es comerciante y costurera, tiene 70 años y vive con su familia en la maravillosa provincia de Limón, la cual marca una gran diversidad cultural: con una población predominantemente negra y con importantes rasgos de la cultura indígena costarricense, la afro caribeña, blancos y chinos, cada grupo le aporta a la zona su estilo propio. Esta provincia tiene hermosas lugares con arenas blancas, playas y palmeras y exuberantes parques nacionales que protegen bosques húmedos tropicales y arrecifes de coral, así como centenares de especies de flora y de fauna en vías de extinción. El parque nacional Tortuguero, contiene la muestra más grande de bosque húmedo tropical protegido y aquí usted podrá recorrer sus canales y ríos, observar la flora y la fauna, apreciar el desove de las tortugas marinas y tener la oportunidad de observar a más de 300 especies de aves dentro de las que se encuentra la lapa verde, el pavón y los tucanes. En esta zona se llevan a cabo importantes investigaciones científicas y se ha convertido en un punto especial para el turismo científico y ecológico.

Desde hace unos meses que Flor trabaja como secretaria en esta Empresa, es por eso que pide que se le brinde algún tipo de ayuda con su equipo tecnológico, para asi hacer más eficiente el trabajo.

Es por esto que Flor está solicitando un crédito por el monto de 400,000.00 (cuatrocientos mil colones), para obtener un equipo de computo completo para la Empresa y asi poder hacer los informes y llevar la contabilidad de dicha organización.

Flor es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Batán, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Ella nos informo que el pertenecer a la esta Empresa, le ha facilitado comprar telas ya que como mencione anteriormente se dedica a la costura. Y también le ha ayudado a arreglar algunas partes de su hogar. Es su quinto préstamo y este crédito le dará mayor calidad a su trabajo en esta ECC.
texts.en:
Flor is a business-woman and a seamstress.  She is 70 years old, and lives with her family in the wonderful province of Limón, which has great cultural diversity.  It's population is predominantly black, and the culture includes important features brought by the indigenous Costa Ricans, Afro-Carrribeans, whites, and Chinese.  Each group brought their own contribution to the area.  

This province is beautiful with white sand, beaches and palm trees, and exuberant national parks that protect the tropical rainforests and coral reefs, and hundreds of species of flora and fauna that are en route to extinction.  The Tortuguero national park contains the largest area of protected tropical rainforest.  You can explore its waterways and rivers to observe the flora and fauna, see the egg-laying of the sea-turtles, and have the opportunity to spot more than 300 species of birds including green macaws, peacocks, and toucans.  Important scientific research takes place in this region, and it has become a unique location for scientific and ecological tourism.

For several months, Flor has been working as a secretary for her communal bank.  This is why she is asking to be provided with some kind of  technological support, so that she can work more efficiently.  This is the reason that Flor is requesting a loan for 400,000 (four hundred thousand) colones, so that she can get a complete computer set-up for the communal bank, and so be able to create reports and keep the books for this organization.

Flor is a member of the Batán communal bank, which is one of EDESA's 110 member organizations in Costa Rica.  She tells us that by belonging to this communal bank, she has been able to purchase fabric, given that she works in sewing as previously mentioned.  It has also helped her to repair several parts of her home.

This is her fifth loan, and this loan will enhance the quality of her work for this communal bank.

loans.use: to provide computer equipment for the communal bank.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La señora Paula cuenta con 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, tienen 3 hijos, Antonio, mariana y enrique, de los cuales solo 2 estudian, están cursando segundo año de primaria y tercer año de preescolar, ya que el mayor esta casado, se dedica a la matanza de marrano y venta de carne, desde hace mas de 7 años.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante, y así ofrecerles una muy buena calidad de vida, también tener una mejor solvencia económica, para apoyarlos con sus estudios, ya que no contaba con alguien que la apoyara, el crédito que recibió lo invirtió en la compra de más marranos.
La meta que tiene doña Paula es la de hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, ya que lo que en verdad quiere es poner una carnicería, para tener más variedad y así mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le ayudara para apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios profesionales.
“Le doy las gracias a Fundación realidad y los donadores de kiva, por confiar en mí y brindarme todo su apoyo”.
texts.en:
Señora Paula is 38 years old and a single mother of 3 children, Antonio, Mariana, and Enrique.  Only two are in school.  One is in the second grade and the other is in preschool.  Her other child is older and already married.  She has been butchering pigs and selling the meat for a living for more than 7 years.  She says that she started this activity because she was looking for a way to provide for her children and this offered them a good quality of life.  She is also financially capable of supporting their studies since she doesn't depend on anyone to support her. 

With the loan she will buy more pigs.  Doña Paula's goal is to grow her business more since what she really wants is to open a butcher shop so she can have more variety and increase her income.  This will help her to support her children's professional studies.  "I am grateful to Fundación Realidad and the Kiva lenders for putting their trust in me and giving me all their support."

loans.use: purchase more pigs.

loans.name: Reina Adelina

texts.es:
Reina Adelina, tiene 31 años de edad, casada desde hace 16 años, tiene 3 hijos uno de 2, 5 y 12 años de edad, vive en San Juan, Lempira. Su esposo es motorista.

Hace más de 7 años que vende ropa como blusas, pantalones y lociones. Donde vive es una aldea rural y no hay tiendas de ropa, esto la motivo a empezar a vender ropa y sus ventas han sido buenas. Luego solicito un préstamo y aumentó su inventario, ahora vende sandalias y lociones también. Reina es muy trabajadora, adicionalmente tiene siembra de café, donde obtiene otros ingresos.
El préstamo solicitado es para surtir más de ropa y lociones, porque viene la época navideña.
Su sueño es graduar a sus hijos y arreglar su vivienda, con las ganancias que obtenga.
texts.en:
Reina Adelina, age 31, has been married for 16 years.  She has three children; ages 2, 5, and 12.  She lives in San Juan, Lempira.  Her husband is a driver.

She has been selling clothes like blouses and pants (and lotions) for over seven years.  She lives in a rural area where there are no clothing stores.  This motivated her to start selling clothes, and her sales have been very good.

She later requested a loan and increased her inventory.  She now also sells sandals and lotions.  Reina is a very hard-worker.  She also has coffee crops, where she gets other income.

The requested loan is to stock more clothes and lotions because the Christmas season is coming.

Her dream is for her children to graduate and to fix up her house with the income that she will get.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise like blouses, pants, and lotions.

loans.name: Juana Marta

texts.es: Juana, de 66 años, es comerciante dueña de una pulpería, viuda, tiene hijos son  mayores de edad. Inicio su negocio hace 17 años cuando murió de su esposo pues el era el único que sostenía a la familia pero ella siguió con el negocio y junto con sus hijos salieron adelante levantaron el negocio y han sobrevivido de el , esta mas surtido que antes. Ella realizo el préstamo para surtir su pulpería con productos tales como granos básicos, pan , aceite, azúcar, snacks dulces , productos de limpieza, cosméticos y adornos. Ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y quiere aprovechar las buenas ventas que se dan en la época. Uno de sus planes es comprar 2 vitrinas que le hacen falta y un exhibidor para mostrar sus productos.
texts.en: Juana, age 66, owns a small store. She is a widow and has adult children. She started her business 17 years ago when her husband died, since he had been the sole provider for the family. She has kept the business going. She and her children have succeeded with the business and they have more stock now than ever. She is taking out this loan to stock her store with products such as basic grains, bread, oil, sugar, sweets, cleaning products, cosmetics, and decorations. Christmas is coming up, and she wants to take advantage of the good sales that are typical of this season. One of her plans is to buy two display cases and another showcase for her products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bread, oil, sugar, sweets, cleaning products, cosmetics, and decorations.

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena is a married woman with eight children. She lives in the town of Trinidad with her family.

Efrena sells gasoline to members of her community. She has had her business for quite some time now. Efrena works hard to support her family. She is asking for a loan to buy more gasoline to sell. She hopes to open a sari-sari store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Ubora Wa Kahawa Jama Group

texts.en:
Adolf is a 47-year-old father of six children, three of them attending secondary school. The other three children are earning their primary education. He is good in growing coffee, maize, and beans and has been doing it for over 8 years. He faces farming problems, namely crop diseases and lack of fertilizers.

Adolf is looking for working capital to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his growing crops. Also, he believes accessing working capital will lead to an expanded scale of production from 10 to 15 acres, the purchase of a grains grinding machine, and the purchase of a transport facility in five years to come.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria tiene 65 años de edad, es casada con cinco hijos.

Ella es una mujer luchadora, se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa. Sus padres fueron quienes le enseñaron a trabajar para ganarse la vida. Gracias a ellos aprendió a trabajar en la agricultura junto con su esposo y de ahí obtienen su fuente de ingresos.

Ella debe viajar durante veinticinco minutos en vehiculo, para llegar al lugar donde compra los insumos agrícolas como el maíz, abono, herbicidas, etc. La señora Gloria solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar tres sacos de abono, un saco de formula y una bolsa de semilla, para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.

Con el préstamo ella suplirá su necesidad de cosechar el maíz, para obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia. Ella espera sembrar más cantidad de maíz y comprar animales como cerdos y vacas para engordarlos y venderlos después generando otro ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria is 65, married with five children.

She is a hardworking woman, she is a housewife.  Her parents taught her to work to earn a living.  Thanks to them she learned to work in agriculture with her husband and they earn their income from it.

She needs to make a 25 minute drive to get to the place where she buys the agri-products such as corn, fertilizer, herbicide, etc.  Gloria requests a loan from Fundacion Campo to buy three sacks of fertilizer and a bag of seed to plant 14,000 square meters of corn.

With the loan she will cover her need to grow corn to obtain the necessary income to get ahead with her family.  She hopes to grow more corn and buy livestock such as pigs, cows to grow them and sell them and generate another source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizer and a bag of seed to grow 14,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has two children. Juliet is a clothes distributor – a business she has run for three years. She received capital from her husband. Juliet learned of Kiva partner Milango from her friends and joined to access credit for her business.
Juliet is applying for a loan of 33,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase clothes and children's shoes for resale. She would like to open a stall from where she can display her clothes. Her main challenge is some customers not paying on time. Juliet will save the extra income she makes for future use.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and children's shoes.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga, a 32-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a mechanic. Nga earns a living running a general store that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.
Nga has requested a loan to purchase more products, such as soaps, toilet paper and soft drinks to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes that her business will run smoothly and she will be able to earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more products, such as soaps, toilet paper and soft drinks.

loans.name: Vitche 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe VITCHE 1 est formé de six personnes qui résident dans la même zone. La représentante de ce groupe,  nommée Jeanne, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Jeanne est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un certain Sylvestre. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés, et trois sont à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Jeanne n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix ans que Jeanne exerce comme activité, la vente de chaussures dans un marché du Bénin ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Jeanne désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Jeanne sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe VITCHE 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des chaussures.

loans.name: Ramon Esmir

texts.es: EL SEÑOR RAMOS ES UN SEÑOR MUY RESPONSABLE  TIENE LA EDAD DE 29 AÑOS ACTUALMENTE, ESTUDIABA SU SECUNDARIA CASI TERMINANDO SU BACHILLERATO A LA EDAD DE 23 AÑOS CUANDO LE BRINDARON SU PRIMER OPORTUNIDAD DE TRABAJO COMO TRABAJADOR CONTRATADO  EN EL AREA DE LIMPIEZA Y EL BUSCO  CON MUCHO ESFUERZO Y DEDICACIÓN LA MANERA DE PASAR HACER PERMANENTE, LABORA DESDE LAS TRES DE LA MAÑANA A SEIS DE LA MAÑANA  EN EL BARRIDO DE CALLE EN LAS HORAS DE LA MADRUGADA, IENE DOS HIJOS AMBOS ESTUDIAN  Y EL SEÑOR SE ESFUERZA PARA SACARLOS ADELANTE, SOLICITA UN FINANCIAMIENTO  PARA CAMBIAR  EL TECHO DE SU VIVIENDA  YA QUE ESTA EN MAL ESTADO.
texts.en: Ramon is a very responsible man. Currently, he is 29 years old. He was studying high school and was almost done with his studies, when at 23 years of age he had the opportunity to have his first job as a contracted worker in the business of cleaning, which he made permanent with great effort and devotion. He works from 3 to 6 in the morning sweeping the streets at dawn hours. He has two children who are studying, for whom he works hard to move forward. She is requesting a loan to change the roof of his house because it is very damaged.

loans.use: to buy building materials, zinc, wood and nails to change the very damaged roof of his house.

loans.name: Christophe

texts.en:
Christophe is 33 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 7 years. 1of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 8 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en: Khurshed was born in 1967 year. He is married and has 2 children. Khurshed is a higher educated person and he works in a state organization. Khurshed has more than 20 year experiences. He is one of the best workers. Khurshed has a good reputation between his colleagues. He is asking for a loan because during some year he suffers from toothache.
