texts.es: Norma, de 34 años, vive en compañía de su esposo Héctor y sus tres pequeños hijos, juntos habitan su casa que es  propia y esta  ubicada en una localidad de la selva central peruana.La comunidad del 2 de Mayo, es una zona alejada, donde las personas se dedican a la agricultura, en ese lugar hace  algunos años Norma instaló una tienda de comestibles, y vende productos de primera necesidad como dulces, frutas, entre otros y le va muy bien . Paralelamente a su negocio, también se dedica a la agricultura, y siembra en sus 3 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, que alquiló por  un periodo de 5 años. En los terrenos siembra  variedad de frutas como plátanos, paltas  y café. Después de un arduo día de trabajo se siente cansada, pero igual trabaja con mucha dedicación pues su meta es progresar y ampliar su tienda, convirtiéndola en la más surtida de su localidad.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmas”, y es el séptimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, donde es una ardua colaboradora y en todas las reuniones comparte  entre sus integrantes.En uno de los terrenos agrícolas que alquila, comenzó a sembrar una variedad de productos naturales, y ahora tiene la oportunidad de comprarlo. Ya  junto una suma considerable y tiene pensado invertir  el dinero del préstamo en completar para terminar de comprarlo, pues desea seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Norma is 34 years old and lives with her husband, Hector, and their three young children. Together they own their own house located in the central jungle of Peru.  
 
The 2 de Mayo community is a rural area, where residents work in agriculture. Norma opened a grocery store there and she sales staple goods such as fruit and candies, among other things. Her business has done well. In addition to running her business, Norma also works in agriculture. She farms roughly seven acres of land, which she leased for a period of five years. She grows a variety of fruit such as bananas, avocado and coffe beans. After the difficult work days she feels exhausted. However, she continues to work with great dedication in order to meet her goal of expanding her store and making it the most well-supplied store in the area. 

She is a member of the Comunal bank, "Las Palmas," and this will be the seventh loan she has received from MFP. She has been a dedicated supporter of MFP and in each of the meetings she contributes to the other members. On one of the properties she rents she has planted a wide variety crops, and she now has the opportunity to buy the land. She has gathered a considerable sum of money and plans to invest the money from the loan to cover the remaining cost of purchasing the land.  In this way she will continue to progress.

loans.use: To pay off the remaining cost of agricultural land.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina R. is from the village of Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 42 years old. Crispina is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Crispina owns & operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling ready to wear clothing & shoe products from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Crispina has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Crispina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Crispina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Crispina is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like t-shirts & blouses. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Crispina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts & blouses.

location.town: Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Chheun's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people located in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Chheun U., born in 1951, is the group leader selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Pall Phatt, are farmers who own a 2.5-hectare plot of land where they grow rice and corn. To sustain the farm, Mrs. Chheun U. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, gasoline and pesticides to grow rice and corn. This couple has a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, gasoline and pesticides

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie S. is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Tessie is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Tessie owns & operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and raising pigs for sale. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Tessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Tessie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn M. is from the village of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Marilyn owns a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean fish. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Marilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cerilina

texts.en:
Cerilina A. is from the village of Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 44 years old, married and has four children. She owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling a variety of goods and products in the local community. Cerilina has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 13,000 PHP per month from these activities. 
Cerilina joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cerilina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy goods and other products.

loans.name: Bertha Urbelinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARÍA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bertha Urbelinda ; la socia tiene 63 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía como carteras, porta pasaportes, chalecos entre otros siendo la misma socia que elabora estos diseños para poder venderlos de forma ambulatoria e independiente a sus familiares, amistades y vecinos, ella trabaja en su mismo domicilio también algunos clientes la buscan en su propio domicilio, la socia es una persona bien alegre y entusiasta.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para su negocio como cierres, botones, hilos entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the MARÍA ELENA MOYANO communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, part of Cusco Province and the department of Cusco.

The member’s name is Sra. Bertha Urbelinda, age 63. She is married and has 3 children. Bertha divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling handicrafts such as wallets, passport cases, and vests, among other things. She makes these items in order to be able to sell them independently and on an itinerant basis to relatives, friends, and neighbors. She works in her house, and some of her customers seek her out there. She is a very happy and enthusiastic person.

The member is applying for the loan in order to purchase materials for her business like zippers, buttons, and thread, among other things. She is happy about the loan and promises to make all the payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business such as zippers, buttons, and thread, among other things.

loans.name: Ainura Kyisaeva's Group

texts.en:
Ainura K. is 47 and married with two sons and two daughters. Her daughters study at school and her sons are farmers. Ainura is the leader of this group.

Fourteen years ago Ainura’s sister suggested she breed livestock to make additional money. Since that time she has been doing so. She started with an initial investment of 2,000 KGS, and now she earns 3,000 KGS per month. This profit made it possible for her to improve her living conditions and purchase a DVD player and a TV.

With money received from her loan Ainura would like to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future she wants to build a house for her sons.

About Mol Bulak Finance

This loan is being presented by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of its “3-Ps” concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow larger) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Josephiine

texts.en:
Josephine is 29 years old and is married, with three children between the ages of 3 and 10 years old. She sells foods like vegetables, rice, tomato sauce, soap, etc.  Josephine has two year's experience. 

Josephine has requested a loan from KIVA lenders in order to purchase more food items like sugar, vegetables, rice, and tomato sauce.  With profits, Josephine will reinvest in her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuff, like vegetables, tomato sauce, rice, and so on.

loans.name: Dollyveetss

texts.es:
La Sra. Dollyveetss pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Gaviotas II” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 44 años y tiene 03 hijos, solo están a su cargo 02 de ellos.
Cunado sus padres fallecen le dejan como herencia la casa en la que vivían, ella rápidamente puso a funcionar allí su negocio. Ella ofrece en alquiler cuartos indipendientes, en la actualidad tiene 10 inquilinos.  Su capital para adecuar la casa como hospedaje fue de S/300.00 nuevos soles.
Entre sus clientes podemos encontrar a estudiantes y personas que  están de visita en la ciudad de Tarapoto.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará sábanas, utensilios de limpieza y materiales de limpieza que puedan ayudar a dar un buen mantenimiento a su negocio. 

Dollyveetss es una mujer muy hábil en los negocios y su sueño es construir un segundo piso para poder ofrecer muchas más habitaciones y está muy segura que lo va a lograr gracias al apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Dollyveetss belongs to the Las Gaviotas (The Seagulls) II Communal Bank, in the district of Tarapoto, province and department of San Martín.  She is 44 years old and unmarried.  She has 3 children but only 2 are in her care.

When her parents died, she inherited the house in which they lived.  She quickly put her business into operation there.  She offers self-contained rooms for rent and currently has 10 tenants.  The capital required to adapt her home as a guest house was S/. 300.00 nuevos soles.

Among her customers, we find students and people who are visiting Tarapoto.  She will use the loan of S/. 1,500.00 to purchase sheets, cleaning supplies, and cleaning products to help keep her guest house well-maintained.  

Dollyveetss is a very clever business woman and her dream is to build a second floor in order to be able to offer many more rooms for rent.  She is quite sure that she is going to achieve this goal thanks to the support of El Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, cleaning supplies, and other items.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is married with four sons. Two of them work while the others are studying. Her eldest son sells water pipes which are used as a sanitary material while the 2nd one makes iron rods. 

Nasreen who is very skillful is involved in making artificial jewelry. She sells this jewelry to jewelry and cosmetics shops. Nasreen is also a very good housewife and performs her routine tasks very well. Her husband is a retired civil servant.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her eldest son’s business. With the loan, he will buy water pipes which will allow him to fill larger orders on time and earn more profit.

Her son started this business 2 years ago and Nasreen hopes that an investment will bring her family more income and improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy water pipes for plumbing supply business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has practiced farming in the town of Olkalou for the last 15 years. She is 38 years old, married to James, and together they have four school-going children. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 14,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) well and in good time. She plans to plant potatoes on her farm. She will use the loan to buy the seeds and fertilizer for planting. 

In the future, Maria hopes to become a leading farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Angelica Eustaquia

texts.es:
Angélica es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia y departamento Puno, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos (5 independientes).  Estudió hasta 5to de primaria.
Junto a su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta de animales domésticos como vacuno y ovinos, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres ciclos.  Su primer préstamo invirtió en su negocio de venta de animales.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará cuatro ovinos para su respectivo engorde por 15 días  a un mes, para luego venderlo a buen precio.  Nos cuenta que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Su sueño es tener una vaca lechera la cual le permita generar otras ganancias.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y el compartir con las socias.
texts.en:
Angélica is a member of the "Santa Rosa de San José" community bank which is located in Mañazo district, in Puno province and department.  She is 57 years old, married, and has six children (five of whom live independently).  She studied up to the fifth year of elementary school.

Together with her husband, Angélica buys and sells animals such as cattle and sheep.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three loan cycles.  She invested her first loan in her animal sales business.

Angélica will use this new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy four sheep which she will fatten for two weeks to one month and then sell at a good procie.  She tells us that her husband is a farmer.

Angélica's dream is to own a dairy cow which would allow her to make other profits.  What she enjoys about her community bank are the meetings and sharing with her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy four sheep to fatten

loans.name: Llyza

texts.en: Llyza has a retail shop that sells coconuts, bananas and lutya (a squash-like vegetable). She is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Llyza has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional bananas and coconuts to sell. Llyza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Llyza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 53 years old and lives in Dapitan City. She is married with five children. 

To earn a living, Merlyn has a business selling fish. She earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. Merlyn has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase more fish to sell.

Merlyn has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 59 years old and married. She has two adult children, one of whom is working abroad. At her age, Emelita still needs to work hard, and manages her hog raising business as a source of income. Her husband is a farmer, and at the same time he runs another business of repairing different damages to cars.

Emelita wants to borrow additional capital to maintain and continue operating her business. She plans to use the loan to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. She will do her best to improve any business she may have someday, in order to be a successful borrower and entrepreneur at the same time.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: La señora Yolanda  es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora, es madre soltera  tiene 1 hijo pequeño, actualmente se encuentra viviendo en alquiler en el mercado de la zona al Sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la cliente tiene como actividad principal la venta de verduras en un mercado céntrico de la ciudad,  hace 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad, el destino del crédito lo invertirá en el reintegro aumentar para la compra de una caseta en el mercado donde ella vende, indica que este crédito le ayudara a anular el pago de alquiler del puesto  y con ello podrá realizar su actividad con mas disponibilidad y obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en: Yolanda is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is single mother of one young son. At present, she lives in a rental by the market on the south side of the city of Cochabamba. Her main activity is selling vegetables in the central market in town. She has done this activity for 6 years. The loan will be used to buy a stall in the market where she sells. She indicates that this loan will make it so she can stop paying rent for her stall and thus be more available and make more income.

loans.use: to buy a market stall.

loans.name: Edgar Santiago

texts.es: Edgar Santiago tiene 27 años, por lo que su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse el pan de cada día de la manera más humilde, por lo que está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y comprar productos como calzado, sabanas, toallas, perfumes cremas y colonias pues actualmente tiene una gran cantidad de encargos de sus clientes. Sueña con mejorar cada día su vivienda.
texts.en: Edgar Santiago is 27 and sells general merchandise. He has run his business for 6 years and enjoys supporting himself through honest work.  He now seeks a loan to purchase a stock of materials for resale, such as shoes, sheets, towels, perfumes, skin creams and cologne.  His clients ask for many special orders.  He hopes to improve his housing conditions.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sheets, towels, perfumes, skin creams and cologne

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 56 year-old married man and a father of four children between 28 and 17 years old.  Ali runs a retail shop in Mariakani. He has been in this business for the last four years.

 Ali has been a KADET client, and this marks his third loan to finance his business. With this loan Ali plans to add more stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, rice, maize meal, salt and tea leaves into his shop. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand his business.
His dream is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: add more stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, rice, maize meal, salt and tea leaves

loans.name: Mukan

texts.ru: Мукан – 51 – летний фермер, женат, имеет 2 детей. С распадом Союза, Мукан начал свой бизнес в животноводстве и успешно ведет его на протяжении уже 20 лет. Доходы от бизнес – деятельности позволили ему построить сарай для животных и помочь сыновьям обрести собственные семьи. На сегодняшний день хозяйство Мукана, начитывающее 1 корову, 1 бычка, 1 лошадь, 10 овец, 10 ягнят и 5 коз,  дает прибыль в сумме около 17,000 сом (KGS)в месяц.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мукан обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 106,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы он планирует вложить в закупку стройматериалов для ремонта дома.
texts.en: Mukan is a 51 year old farmer, married and has two children. After the fall of the Soviet Union Mukan started a livestock business and has been running it successfully for more then 20 years. Profits from his business allowed him to build a better barn for his animals and help his sons start their own households. Currently Mukan owns a cow, a calf, a horse, 10 sheep, 10 lambs and 5 goats, and his business yields a monthly profit of 17,000 som (KGS). To further enlarge his herd, Mukan has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 106,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional heads of cattle. Profits from his expanded business Mukan is planning to use for repairs of his house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Matahari Terbit Iv Group

texts.en: Endang has two businesses: one selling snacks and one washing laundry. She is 33 years old and married with three children. She has had her businesses for two years now. Already the income from her businesses has enabled her to buy a refrigerator for her family. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia and she will use it to improve her snack business. She hopes that in the future she will have enough savings from her businesses to buy a washing machine. Her hope for her family is that she will have enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make a greater variety of snacks to sell

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: La Sra. Nely se dedica a la comercialización de verduras y la producción de leche para su posterior comercialización se dedica a esta actividad desde hace diez años , solicita el crédito para la compra de material de construcción  y también para una mescladora de cemento para la refacción de su vivienda ya que se acerca la época de lluvias y desea hacer arreglar el techo de su vivienda, su esposo realizara la refacción ya  que es albañil, vive en domicilio propio, tiene cinco niños quienes además colaboran con los quehaceres de la casa y la atención de el ganado, no cuenta con muchos bienes ya que recientemente sufrieron el robo de su domicilio y les dejaron sin nada, la Sra. Nely es una persona trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
For the past 10 years, Sra. Nely has been selling vegetables and producing milk for eventual resale. She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials and also a cement mixer so that she can repair her home. The rainy season is approaching, so she wants to make repairs to the roof of her house. Her husband will be doing the repair work since he is a mason.

Nely lives in her own home. She has five children who help her with the household chores and tending to the cows. Not much good has happened to them recently since they were victims of a robbery in their home and were left with nothing.

Sra. Nely is a hardworking person who is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy materials for home repairs.

loans.name: Rosio

texts.es: Rosio, de 35 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy amena. Separada de su esposo, pero vive en compañía de sus cuatro hijos, a los que quiere mucho en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Rosio, consiste en la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, para ello monto una tienda en su propia casa, y cuenta con los principales productos, de esta manera los vecinos ya no tiene que realizar largos tramos hasta el mercado para poder adquirir dichos productos.  Tiene cuatro años dedicándose a esta actividad y hasta el monento siempre ha contado con la ayuda de sus hijos. Ella considera que gracias a su negocio, puede tener un ingreso económico con el que pueda  solventar los gastos de su hogar, pues sola debe velar y asegurar dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Tiene muchos planes, entre ella crecer su negocio. Este sería el crédito dos con la institución MFP, se siente muy bien con su grupo comunal, ya que los que considera como personas responsables y solidarias. Con el préstamo solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, comprará cervezas por cajas, gaseosas, y golosinas para implementar su bodega.
texts.en:
Rosio, 35, is an enterprising, very pleasant woman.  She’s separated from her husband but lives in her own house with her four children who she loves very much.  Rosio’s activity consists in selling basic staple grocery items.  To do so she set up a store at home stocked with the main products and this way her neighbors don’t have to make the long trip to the market to buy said products.  

She’s been in business four years and to date has had help from her children.  She considers that thanks to her business she is able to have income to cover household expenses since she has to care for and insure a better quality of life for her children by herself.  She has many plans and one of them is to make her business grow.

This would be her second MFP loan.  She feels very comfortable with her communal group because she considers them to be responsible, mutually supportive people.  She will use the requested 800 new sol loan to buy beer by the case, soft-drinks and snacks to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy a case of beer, soft-drinks and snacks to stock her store.

loans.name: Norma Guarachi

texts.es: La Sra. Norma tiene como actividad la elaboración D. pan, empanadas, alfajores, las cuales comercializa  ya sea en su mismo domicilio como entrega a  pedido en colegios indica que  tiene experiencia D. 3 años en esta actividad la actividad que nombramos lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio que se encuentra en el sudoeste D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba una zona periurbana en la Urbanización Mineros San Juan;  su esposo es contratista la señora indica  que con su actividad genera ingresos para su familia para su manutención; el dinero que se le otorga es para la compra D. harina, azúcar, manteca y otros insumos necesarios para continuar desarrollando su actividad.
texts.en:
Norma's business is making baked goods, bread, empanadas and alfajores, which she sells in her own home and delivers her orders to schools. She has three years of experience in this traD.. She runs her business in her own home found in the south east of Cochabamba city, in a peri-urban area in the Mineros San Juan neighborhood.

Her husband is a contractor and she says that her work creates an income for the maintenance of her family.

The money she is requesting will be used to buy flour, sugar, butter and other necessary ingredients to continue the development of her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter and other ingredients.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 46 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children.   Angelita sells fish for a living, and has been doing this for 20 years.

Angelita has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos to purchase more fish to sell.  She has been a member of Kiva field partner PMPC for seven years. In the future, Angelita hopes to see her children finish their studies, and she wants to be able to expand her business by opening up several fish stalls.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es:
Luis Arturo tiene 43 años de edad es casado tiene 5 hijos , vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 22, 18, 17, 14 y 12 años de edad en  Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.
Luis se dedica a la agricultura vive con la familia, además tiene sembríos. Las compras y las ventas de los productos para la agricultura los compra en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales (ganado y chanchos). Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá cambiar la situación económica de la familia.
El  sueño es poder cambiar de ciudad  donde haya más trabajo. Los desafíos que se le ha presentado son en la familia por falta de ingresos.
En los momentos libres le gusta descansar pasar  el tiempo libre con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis Arturo is 43 years old, married, and has five children. He lives with his wife and children (ages 22, 18, 17, 14, and 12) in Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

Luis is a member of the Communal Bank “Pangua” which is located in the community of Pangua Chaupiyacu and part of Guanujo parish in the canton of Guaranda. This community is 15 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The members of the Pangua Communal Bank work mostly in agriculture and livestock breeding, but they also engage in other business activities, such as retail and construction, in order to earn most of their income.

Luis is a farmer who lives with his family and also has crops. He buys his supplies and sells his agricultural products in Guaranda. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy animals, such as cattle and pigs. With the help of this loan, he will be able to change his family’s financial situation. His dream is to move to a city where there is more work. The challenges he faces include dealing with his family’s lack of income.

When he has moments that are free, Luis likes to relax and spend time with his children.

loans.use: to buy cattle and pigs.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлюба молодая женщина 33 лет, семейная, с тремя детьми, муж Ахмадчон в данное время на заработках за пределами города, воспитывает детей одна. Занимается всеми делами: нянчит детей в свободное время, делает национальные пирожки и продаёт в школе. А дома, получив наш первый кредит купила бычков и откармливает их. Это для нее как запас на непредвиденные расходы семьи, так как продав бычков, всегда может совершить какие то расходы. Семейное условия клиента не очень-то хорошие, поэтому занимается несколькими делами. Но работает пунктуально и  расчетливо ведет свой бюджет. Уже в очередной раз берет кредит на покупку скота и очень рада, что сотрудничает с нами и той финансовой поддержке, когда это ей было необходимо.
texts.en: Matluba is a young, 33 year-old woman, married and has three children.  Her husband, Ahmadchon, currently works outside the city limits, and Matluba raises the children by herself.  She is involved in all types of work, such as taking care of the children, making national pies in her free time and selling them at a school.  And at home, having obtained our first loan, she purchased calves and fattens them up.  This business for her is like extra savings for unforeseen family expenses because she can always spend something, once she sells calves.  The client's family conditions are not very good, and this is why she is involved in several businesses.  Nevertheless, Matluba works punctually and diligently runs her budget.  She is obtaining her next loan to purchase livestock and is very happy that she is partnering with us to have this financial support, when she needs it.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is 27 years old. She is married with two children who are aged 1 and 3. They are still too young to attend school. She owns a bar which she has been running for the past 5 years. With the loan, she will buy more crates of beer for sale. She expects to use the profits to renovate her house and for savings. In the future, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer for sale

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en: In Vanadzor city of Lori region lives Nelli and she is 57 years old. Nelli lives here now alone, since her single daughter, who is very clever young girl and she graduated Yerevan State Linguistic University, now she continues her education at the Germany.  Nelli is proud of her and she is sure that her daughter will surely have a lot of success thanks to her cleverness and intelligence. While Nelli in Vanadzor city’s wholesale market at the rented stall is engaged in clothes trading business. At her stall she sells women and children clothes. She has very nice and wide assortment of nice clothes of different sizes and for all the seasons. She has a lot of regular customers who visit her stall already many years. Nelli mentions that she does her best to keep her business since she must financially support her daughter who lives and studies in Europe. Now this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Nelli asks for the purchase of winter season clothes for her business development, she needs to refresh her last winter clothes assortment as well, making it more attractive for her customers.

loans.use: for the purchase of winter season clothes for her business development, she needs to refresh her last winter clothes assortment as well

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is married and has 5 children. She is a high school teacher and an active member of the Anglican Church and an official of the church council. She is the treasurer of Plains view self help group. Her 5 children are all in school and her husband is employed.

To supplement her employment income, Pamela started poultry and dairy farming in her rural home in Gatundu. She has 350 chicken (layers) and 2 dairy cows. She has employed one person at the farm but always ensures she is there when she is free and over the weekends. She sells 11 crates of eggs per day at USD 25 and 25 litres of milk at USD 5 per day. Her total income from farming every month is USD 900. Gatundu is a fast growing area and Pamela would want to increase the number of her chicken to be able to serve this readily available market better. She already has orders that she is not able to meet.

loans.use:
Pamela wants to buy more chicken such that she 
increases the supply of eggs currently in short supply in Thika Town.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya lives in the Mbagala area on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam. He is married with two children. He owns a vegetable and fruits stall where he sells different fruits and vegetables. He fetches some of the fresh produce like tomatoes, spinach, oranges, bananas and pineapples from nearby villages. His stall is located near his residence. This location helps him attract many customers because the items must otherwise be obtained in the market which is located a bit far away. Yahaya needs to expand his business to meet a rising demand from his clients. He is planning to have cages for hygiene products and attractive displays. He is also planning to have a bicycle to help him fetch some local produce from nearby areas. To fulfill these requirements he is in need of USD 550 to subsidize his capital.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Choub

texts.en: Choub T. is 53 years old and lives with her three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  T.’s husband recently passed away, making their economic situation even more difficult.  T. sells porridge and rice from her house, which is located near a local market.  Her children (one of whom is pictured here because T. was unavailable) no longer attend school, because they must help to supplement the family’s income.  Between the three of them, her children can earn up to $15 in revenue per day.  T. hopes to use this loan to open a hair dressing shop, where she will also sell beauty supplies.

loans.use: To open a hair dressing/beauty shop

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en:
Nazila is a 57 year old mother of 4 children,. She lives in the Salyan region, Yenikand village. 
She has raised poultry for 30 years. 
Nazila needs a loan of $725 to buy 100 hens,and 50 Indian guinea hens for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy 100 hens, 50 Indian guinea hens

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
I live in Lahore and work as a cleaner in a large house. My husband works as a gardener for the Pakistan navy in another city. He hardly visits home and sends money only intermittently. I live with my four children in a two-room rented house. My three younger children are able to attend school because of my eldest son, who helps to pay for their school expenses. He has been working in a bicycle repair shop for a couple of years. He now wants to open his own shop so that he can increase his income. I am requesting this loan to help my son set up his own business.

Parveen S., Pakistan

loans.use: To set up a bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet N. is a Muganda by tribe and a business lady. She joined Life in Africa Foundation in 2006 where she worked on the Invisible Children bracelet project. She has already recieved a Kiva loan of 800,000/= to start a retail business selling shoes. Her repayment record is good.

To increase her income Annet would like to expand her business by selling soft drinks. She has room at her stall in town to put a fridge and since cold drinks are in demand, this business will do well.

To make this expansion Annet is seeking a loan in the amount of 250,000/= (US$ 150) to finance the purchase of a second-hand medium-sized fridge and some crates of soda. She feels sure she will be able repay this loan in three months. Here is her budget:

A second-hand fridge .........................................................200,000/=

Two crates of soda @ 10,000/-..........................................20,000/=

Three cartons of Safi drinks ...................................................15,000/=

Passion fruit .............................................................................8,000/=

Buying used plastic bottles for bottling passion fruit juce..............5,000/=

1 kg of sugar.....................................................................................2,000/=

Total....................................................................................................250,000/=

loans.use: Buying second-hand fridge and soft drinks

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa I. is a 34 year old woman. She is married to Jorge Espinoza who is 36 years old and works as a sales supervisor in a known company in the city. They have 2 children age 11 and 9, and they live in their own house.

Rosa owns a convenience store since 2001, she has her own commercial space and a truck with which she delivers her merchandise and provides freight services.

They started their own business from scratch, and thanks to their entrepreneurial spirit, they now own a flourishing small business. They have been clients of Fundacion Paraguaya for the past three years, who has helped them in the implementation of their projects.

With this new loan they will buy devices that they need to fit out a callshop next to their convenience store.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer

Rosa I., tiene 34 años, esta casada con Jorge Espinoza de 36 años el trabaja como supervisor de ventas en una reconocida empresa de la ciudad. La pareja tiene 2 hijos, de 11 y de 9 años respectivamente. Ellos viven todos juntos en una casa propia.

Rosa posee una despensa desde el 2.001, posee local propio y un camión de cargas con el que realiza reparto de mercaderías y hace fletes a terceros.

El negocio lo empezaron de cero, gracias al espíritu emprendedor de la pareja, actualmente son dueños de una mini empresa floreciente. Son clientes de la Fundación Paraguaya hace 3 años y les hemos acompañado en la consecución de sus proyectos.

Con este nuevo préstamo comprarán algunos aparatos que les faltan para habilitar una cabina telefónica al lado de su despensa.

loans.use: To buy devices for callshop

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah K. is requesting a loan to buying more inventory for her general merchandise shop, such as a refrigerator. With this, Sarah hopes to boost and enlarge her business.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Eulogia Marbelì

texts.es:
Eulogia Marbeli R. Velasquez is a business woman in the main market in Chichigalpa, is married and has the responsibility to support two children in high school. Her business has been selling clothing since last year. She tells us that she had to start her business because her husband emigrated to the United States and while she waited for him to establish himself she needed to start the business. Today her husband helps her but is is not enough because the work that he has does not pay much for what he does.

Miss Eulogia has been working with CEPRODEL since last year and she feels very satisfied with the credit that has been granted to her and always at the right time, helping to fill the needs of her business and finally to keep her customers happy on a daily basis. She has a history of 3 loans to her name. Her greatest need now is to purchase clothing for resale in her neighbourhood.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Eulogia Marbeli R. V. es comerciante del mercado municipal de Chichigalpa, casada y con la responsabilidad de dos hijos en secundaria. Su negocio ha sido la venta de ropa desde hace un año. Nos cuenta que tuvo que poner este negocio porque su esposo emigró a los Estados Unidos de Norteamérica y ella para esperar que él se estabilizara en ese país tuvo que poner este negocio, hoy en día su esposo le ayuda pero no lo suficiente porque el trabajo que el tiene no gana mucho por lo que esta iniciando en el negocio.

Doña Eulogia trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 1 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 3 créditos. Su necesidad mayor en este momento es la compra de la ropa para luego comercializarla en el sector de su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is 46 year old grocery store owner. Hassan works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. This is the fourth time that Hassan has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. This time he needs to purchase merchandise for his business. Hassan is a good provider for his family.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence I. is 38 years old, married and has 2 children. She sells general provisions
 and drinks in her community and has been in business since year 2000. Florence learned the business from her father. She now needs a loan of US $875 to buy more inventory and satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Fatuma's Majindecha Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 28 years old and is married with 2 children, aged 7 and 1. She and her husband also take care of two other children, aged 16 and 9. Fatuma is a sells clothes, a business which she started in 2007. She earns a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She is looking for this loan to buy more clothes to help jumpstart her business. She will share this loan with her group member Linda, who also sells clothes. She thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena is a member of the Wiracocha Communal Bank.

Maria Elena is single and 28 years old. She works as a midwife at the hospital in Huanta. She also sells surgical clothing in hospitals and medical centers. In addition, she has a mototaxi that she rents out.

Maria Elena needs a loan of 1500 soles, money that she would invest in a new enterprise selling quilts/duvets that she would purchase in the city of Lima.

Maria Elena’s dreams include having a clinic, a restaurant and of providing all the best for her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha.

Maria Elena es soltera y tiene 28 años, de profesión Obstetriz trabaja en el hospital de Huanta , Maria Elena vende ropa quirúrgica en los hospitales y centros médicos, actividad que realiza eventualmente, además Maria Elena tiene una mototaxi que alquila.

Maria Elena necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en un nuevo negocio de venta de edredones que serán adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima.

Los sueños de Maria Elena son tener una clínica, un restaurante y brindarle todo lo mejor a su mamá.

loans.use: Maria Elena needs a loan of 1500 soles, money that would be invested into a new business selling quilts/duvets that would be purchased in the city of Lima.

loans.name: Sista S.

texts.en:
Hello from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Sista W..  She is married and has four children between the ages of  1 and 10. In 2007, Sista established her crops business. Sista requires a loan in order to buy more stock of rice in bulk. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more stock of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase of raw materials to produce cakes, sweeties and natural juices.

loans.name: La Vida Group

texts.en:
Clara and her story are typical of the "Trabajando Para el Futuro" Bank of Hope; she belongs to a group of 10 men and women who work hard to improve their lives through the help of their small loans. Each of these men and women has taken out a similar loan to that of Clara's.

Clara V. has lived slowly, accomplishing two dreams: finishing a house and building a boutique. She sells clothes for her clients and is always searching for more customers.

Clara has five children aged 28, 27, 24, 21, and 18. She has lived her life fighting to get them where they are living at present. She has lived with her children in a small town in San Pedro de Macoris, also referred to as Macoris of the Sea, in the Dominican Republic.

"VIDA" is the group she is part of with seven other women and two men. They all are looking for loans in order to better their futures. They probably will be able to since each day there are people like you who want to help. On behalf of all of the group members, and our team here at "Esperanza", thank you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more used and new clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mr. Nget T. is a villager in Prey Run Village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer who cultivates twice a year. During the rainy season, he cultivates rice, while he grows vegetables in the dry season. 

Now, it is the rainy season, so he wants to cultivate rice; unfortunately, he does not have animals to plow so he needs to hire a laborer with oxen to plow. Thus, Mr. Nget T. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose, and he would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to support his field . 

His wife, Mrs. Mao Eom, helps him in the plantation. Mr. Nget T. has two children who are both construction workers. They can earn $3 a day each. His wife and son are shown with Mr. Nget T..

loans.use: To hire a laborer with oxen to plow the rice field and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap S., 44, and her husband, Mr. Sambath Kong, 48, live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Two of their sons are construction workers. One of their other sons is helping his mother spin thread, and the youngest studies in the local school. The two daughters are silk weavers; one of them is married and lives in the family home.

Sopheap has been a silk weaver for twenty-eight years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Sambath is a wooden house builder and a rice farmer.   

Sopheap is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase silk materials for her and her daughters' weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana B. R. vive en la localidad de Santa Rita, ubicada a 3 km. de la Población de El Torno, en Santa Cruz, Bolivia, cuenta con domicilio propio de 3 cuartos, vive con su esposoy sus 5 hijos
La señora se dedica venta de comida y también cuenta con un acuerdo con una importante empresa, desde el año 2002, para poder cubrir con la alimentación diaria de los trabajadores de dicha empresa.
Se vio la necesidad de aumentar su capital de trabajo, ya que se esta incrementando el numero de clientes en la zona, por que en el lugar se esta estableciendo una nueva empresa, y tienen una buena referencia de la señora.
Este motivo la llevo a solicitar un financiamiento a nuestra institución, la Sra. ha demostrado satisfacción por la agilidad y atención personalizada de nuestra parte. Y además espera que el microcrédito le ayude a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ms Juana B. R. lives in the locality of Santa Rita, 3 km from El Torno, in Santa Cruz, Bolivia. She lives with her husband and five children in her own 3-room house. Ms B. R. sells food and has had an agreement in place since 2002 with a large company to supply the workers of the business with their daily meals. She has seen the need to increase her working capital as she is serving more and more clients, given that a new business is opening in the same area and that she has good references. This situation has prompted her to request a loan from our institution: we are satisfied that Ms B. R. has demonstrated her adaptability and personalized service. As well, she hopes that this loan will help her improve her lot in life.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro G. C. no pudo estar en la foto por la razón que el es chofer de carga pesada y siempre esta fuera de la ciudad su esposa la señora Laura Mallel Ruiz Medina que es ama de casa se dejo tomar fotografía con sus dos hijos. El señor Ramiro G. C. ya había tenido un préstamo aquí el cual pago muy bien es por eso que nosotros pensamos darle otro. En este nuevo crédito Ramiro pide un préstamo para mejorar su casa. Los arreglos que el desea hacer, como podrán ver en la imagen es enjarrarla y darle un pintadita al color que su esposa le guste. La cantidad que el nos solicita es de $10,000 pesos
texts.en:
Ramiro G. C. was not able to be in the photo because he is a truck driver and is always out of town. His wife, Mrs. Laura Mallel Ruiz Medina is in the photo with their two children. Mr. Ramiro G. C. has already had a loan which he paid back fully. Because of this, we are confident about giving him another loan. With this next loan, Ramiro has asked for a loan to work on his house. He wants to make a few improvements, such as plastering the house and painting it his wife's favorite color his wife (see house in background of picture). He is asking for a loan of $10,000 pesos.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint and cement

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen Sanchez D. N. is fifty-two years old.  She lives with her three children in the city of Pucallpa, Peru.  Carmen’s business a small internet café situated off of her neighborhood’s plaza.  Carmen is a member of the Las Brisas communal bank and has worked with her group for two years and four months.  Carmen’s life have changed drastically since she joined her bank and started attending the group meetings.  She used to never socialize with others and lived a very solitary lifestyle.  When she joined the bank she was able to meet regularly with other bank members and become friends.  Carmen now loves the companionship she receives from the other Las Brisas entrepreneurs.

Carmen uses her loans to build up her internet café.  She now has several computers which she maintains and rents at hourly rates.  Carmen is requesting a loan of 2,000 Nuevo Soles to purchase six mice, six keyboards and six headests.
texts.en:
Carmen Sanchez D. N. tiene 52 años D. edad. Ella vive con sus tres hijos en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, Peru. Su negocio es un pequeño café internet situado en la plaza D. su barrio. Ella es miembro del banco comunitario Las Brisas, y ha trabajado con su grupo por espacio D. 2 años y 4 meses. La vida D. Carmen ha cambiado drásticamente desD. que se unió al banco y comenzó a asistir a las reuniones D. grupo. En el pasado ella nunca hacía vida social y vivía una vida bastante solitaria. DesD. que se unió al banco sin embargo, ella ha podido conocer gente y reunirse regularmente con otros miembros del banco, con quienes ha forjado amistades. Carmen actualmente disfruta mucho D. la compañía D. los otros empresarios D. Las Brisas. Ella utiliza los préstamos que obtiene para seguir construyendo su café internet. Ahora ella posee varios computadores, los cuales los mantiene y arrienda por hora. Actualmente Carmen necesita un préstamo D. 2,000 Nuevos Soles para comprar 6 mice, 6 teclados y 6 audífonos.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase equipment for her internet stations

loans.name: Ehtibor

texts.en:
Ehtibor K. is 43 years old. She is married with 4 children. Nine years ago, Ehtibor began selling shoes in the market, since her husband’s income was not enough to cover her children’s expenses. That was how she got a taste for the business and was convinced that it left her sufficient revenue. Currently, she works in this business full-time, and thanks to her enthusiasm, she has made a name for herself in the market. However, her clients request more and more things each day, which is why Ehtibor is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni, which she is willing to repay in a 7-month term. With this money, Ehtibor will be able to purchase more goods and therefore give her business a boost. With your help, Ehtibor will be able to help her children prosper so that they may one day go to college.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new shoes to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Masaya el negocio de la señora Manuela S. es llamado Eventos S. donde se propietaria, la señora Manuela se dedica al alquiler de sillas para toda ocasión tales como eventos sociales, festivos, entre otros.

El negocio consiste en que a ella le solicitan una determinada cantidad de sillas para la ocasión y ella les brinda el servicio de alquiler para satisfacer dicha necesidad del cliente. Es importante destcar que hoy en día la razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de nuevas sillas y la compra de mesas para expandir sus productos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
In Masaya city Mrs. Manuela S. owns a business called “Eventos S.” (S. Events). Manuela rents chairs for all occasions such as social events, parties, etc. In this business people ask her for a certain number of chairs for an event and she provides a service by renting chairs to meet the customer’s need. It is important to note that today the reason she has approached Ceprodel is to obtain a loan that will enable her to buy new chairs and talbes to expand her products and meet her customers’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Urcisina

texts.en:
Urcisina C. is a sari-sari (variety) store owner. She is 37 years old and has 2 children. She started her business in 1993. Her business is doing well. She plans to make it bigger to support the needs of her family. Aside from the store, she also has a rice field. Urcisina uses her harvest to feed and clothe her family. She and her husband work together to meet their needs.

She is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy coconut wine and bananas for her store. Her loan will definitely help her to attract more customers. " With my loan, I could compete well in the market," she said.

CEVI helps people start up and run their own business. They provide credit, training, and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase coconut wine and bananas for re-sale

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
Sixto trabaja en el área rural de La Paz es pequeño agricultor  produce papa y chuño y productora de leche de vaca mismo que lo comercializa a la Empresa Delicia, es su fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su madre.

Viven en la comunidad Caluyo - Batallas de la provincia los Andes a dos horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad y mejorar su producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
 
El Tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago y la buena inversión de los créditos anteriores le permite acceder as otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Sixto works in the rural region of La Paz. He is a small farmer and raises potatoes and milk cows and produces chuño, a freeze-dried potato product. He sells his milk cows to Empresa Delicia. This is his source of income with which he supports his mother. They live in the community of Caluyo - Batallas in the province Los Andes, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. He will use the loan to buy a medium-quality milk cow and increase his milk production and income. The third loan with Impro, his good repayment history and his good loan investment allos Sixto to solicit another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene A. is 22 years old and married with three children. She is living with her family at Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City, Mindanao, Philippines.

Arlene has been in her buying and selling business for three years. She buys raw bananas and copra products from her neighbors. When she has enough stock, with the help of her husband, she'll transport the products to the city and sell them.

She is so grateful for the assistance extended by HSPFI in their area through its micro-finance program. Arlene wants to expand her business to earn more. She is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy more raw bananas and copra products to sell in the city.

Arlene sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more raw bananas and copra products to sell in the city

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
El señor Martín M.  vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Alpacoma, área periférica de la ciudad de El Alto, con su esposa y sus tres hijos.
El señor Martín es oficial de policías, con cuyos ingresos sostiene a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de gradas, ya que su deterioro la hace peligrosa para sus hijos menores, además de la habilitación de una habitación-tienda en su domicilio, para que su esposa pueda abrir una tienda de abarrotes y tenga ingresos y mejore los ingresos de la familia.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Martín M. lives with his wife and three children in his own house in the Alpacoma neighborhood, in the vicinity of the city of El Alto. Martín is a police official and with that income he supports his family. The loan he is requesting is to fix the stairs in his house, since they have deteriorated which makes them dangerous for his young children. He also wants to remodel a room in his house so that his wife can open a grocery store and her earnings would increase the family's income. This is the second time that they have requested a loan. The results of their socio-economic analysis are favorable and they have been approved for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a native of Batong Labang, now called Barangay Bintacan of Ilagan, Isabela. She is 21 years old and single. She is employed in a repair shop in their village but her salary from this work is minimal - so she has engaged herself in an electronic loading (of mobile phone call credits) business for additional income. From this business, she is able to generate an income amounting to PHP 2,400 a month and she considers it a great source of income that really helps her family and in providing school allowance for her younger siblings.  

She hopes that her business continues to grow. According to her, it is better to give than to receive, because it makes her happier to see her family satisfied in their life with her help. And she believes that with every good thing you do, it always comes back to you.

loans.use: To gain business capital

loans.name: Julia Magaly

texts.es:
La señora Julia Magaly Briceño M.  tiene 39 años, vive en la calle San Lucas Nº 702 del distrito de la Esperanza parte Baja, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, tiene 2 hijas que depende económicamente de ella.
Julia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes hace 15 días, inicio su negocio vendiendo ropa por un lapso de 2 años, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió en la compra de polos, casacas, pantalones.
El crédito de 1500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, golosinas, gaseosas para implementar su bodega.
Julia tiene como sueño tener su minimarket  para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Señora Julia Magaly Briceño M. is 39 and lives in the Esperanza district in the province of Trujillo in the deparment of La Libertad, Perú. She studied through secondary school and has 2 daughters who depend on her economically. Julia has sold groceries for 2 weeks. She started her business of selling clothing 2 years ago and has her business in her home. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which she received from the communal bank, "Nueva Esperanza II", she will purchase products like rice, sugar, noodles, candy, and soft drinks to supply her store. Julia has a dream of having a mini-market to grow her microbusiness.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products like rice, sugar, noodles, candy, and soft drinks to supply her grocery store

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora R. raises pigs for sale. She is 27 years old, married and has one school-age child. She is from the town of Plaridel. Flora has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Flora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock to raise and sell. Flora is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina tiene 33 años, es una madre muy amorosa y cariñosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Mariano de 45 años y a sus 2 hijos Yesenia de 14 y Rolando de 3 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los ahorros que había guardado Marcelina durante 10 años, por fin tienen sus frutos, puesto que con ellos pudo comprar el bus que tanto ansiaba, el cual ahora a brinda el servicio de transporte de pasajeros Juliaca – Moho (Distrito de Puno). Gracias a esto, sus ganancias han mejorado, ya que anteriormente su única fuente de ingresos era su restaurante, el cual sigue adelante progresando poco a poco. Lo que más le gusta a Marcelina de su nuevo trabajo como cobradora del bus, es que le permite viajar constantemente y disfrutar del paisaje, lleva recién 6 meses en esta actividad y lo más difícil es tener que madrugar para cumplir con los horarios de salida. Sabe que es duro, pero que a la larga le dará muy buenos resultados, espera que en el futuro pueda comprar otro bus y salir adelante más rápido. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con todas sus cuotas a tiempo, si no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en el cual es muy querida por la alegría que demuestra. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará un televisor nuevo para el bus, para que los pasajeros puedan distraerse durante el viaje.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 33 years old and a loving and caring mother. She lives in her own house with her 45-year-old husband Mariano and her two children, Yesenia (14) and Rolando (3), who are the inspiration for all their efforts. The savings Marcelina has accrued over the past 10 years have finally paid off, now that they can purchase the bus that they have always longed to buy, which now provides transportation service to passengers from Juliaca to Moho (in the Puno district). Thanks to this, their earnings have increased, since their only previous source of income was their restaurant, which has been growing little by little. What Marcelina enjoys most from her new job as a bus conductor is that it lets her travel constantly and enjoy the trip. She has spent 6 months at this job and the most difficult aspect for her is waking up early to follow the bus schedule. She knows this job is hard work, but will bring her good results in the long run. She hopes to buy another bus in the future and move forward even faster. This is Marcelina's second loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her payments on time so as not to cause problems for the other members of her loan group. She will use this loan to buy a new TV for her bus, so that passengers will be better able to relax during their trip.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a TV for her bus service

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice operates a printing business in the busy, densely-populated area of Nairobi. She has two little girls who are both in school.  Beatrice started this business in 2006, and has developed it to its current level. Her main focus is printing DVD cases. Due to rapid expansion, she has requested a loan of Ksh. 50,000 to satisfy the increased demand.

loans.use: To purchase more printing paper

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn L. is from the village of Lao Sta. Cruz. She is 31 years old. Analyn is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Analyn owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Analyn has been in business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Analyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Analyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business of harvesting and selling fish

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Mrs. Dina K., 27, and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Sann, 35, live along national road number one about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2001 and have two children: one son and one daughter. The eldest son is in primary school and the youngest one is still young. 

Dina has been selling roasted fish for 10 years. Her husband has been a construction constructor for almost 12 years. He has his own motorbike and hopes to supplement his existing business by driving Tuk Tuk taxi. Through this new business he will be able to generate extra income to support his family. Dina is applying for her first loan of $500 to purchase a trailer to attach with the motorbike for her husband to drive Tuk Tuk taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to attach with a motorbike for her husband to drive Tuk Tuk taxi.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua started her fish business fifteen years-ago in a community market where she lives. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty fish and for that reason she is well-liked by many. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana.

Akosua is a 50 year-old divorcee and mother of four children, all currently in school. She uses her business proceeds to support her children: buying them food, and paying school and medical bills. She requires a loan to buy more stock of assorted fish, so as to increase sales to support her children's education and grow her business. She hopes to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy stock of smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Geidy

texts.es: Geidy es una mujer activa y emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 25 años y madre de un niño, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y prendas de vestir, su esposo le apoya en lo que se propone, él trabaja en un hospital. Es socia del Banco Comunal “La Positiva”, desde hace tres años. El primer préstamo fue de 300 soles lo cual invirtió en perfumes  para vender, en la actualidad necesita un crédito de 3000 soles que será invertido para comprar todo tipo de productos de  belleza para luego ofrecer y venderlo. La meta de Geidy es llegar a tener un bazar y seguir creciendo en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Geidy is an active, enterprising woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 25 years old and is the mother of a child. She sells beauty products and clothing. Her husband supports her in her enterprises; he works in a hospital. She has been a member of the communal bank "La Positiva" for three years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she invested in perfumes to sell. Currently she needs a loan of 3,000 soles to buy all types of beauty products so that she can later offer them to the public and sell them. Geidy's goal is to eventually have a shop and to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy all types of beauty products

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert is 27 years old. He is married and has two children. Both of his children attend elementary school.
