Here is a member of the communal bank named "Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata". It is located in the community of Yuncaypata, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Ubaldina. She is 36 years old, married, and she has 7 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling vegetables. She is an agriculturist and she cultivates lettuce which is later sold to clients at the markets in Cusco. She also harvests herbs from the fields (medicinal herbs) and she also sells them to those same clients. She is a very happy person and she is responsible. She works together with her husband, a construction worker, for the support of the family.

She requests a loan to purchase fertilizers for her fields.

She is happy for her loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her fields

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has been doing dairy farming in Litein Town, South Rift, Kenya for eight years and sells her milk produce to the local market. She is married with three children aged between seven and one. She has two farmhands on her farm. 

Hellen has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to help her purchase a motorcycle and enable her to venture into the transport business. She adds that this will improve her income and make it more consistent even during the dry season when the dairy business is doing badly. The income she says is intended to pay for the education of her children and improve her farming businesses. 

Hellen believes her main challenge is the drought.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Edgar Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. Edgar,   se dedica al Servicio de Transporte, Hace Diez años. El señor empieza su jornada laboral desde muy tempranas horas seis de la mañana y concluye según como le fue en el día. Normalmente a las once de la noche, Tiene  51 años, Vive en la Zona del Plan 3000, Tiene Cinco  hijos dos que dependen de el y Los Otros trabajan y Estudian, Actualmente el necesita el crédito para comprar el motor para su vehículo y algunas reparaciones del vehículo como ser arreglos eléctricos y chapeado. Su Esposa vende comida en su propio domicilio, Son Personas responsables las cuales buscan día a día el bienestar y la superación para poder tener una vejez segura.
texts.en:
Edgar has worked for ten years providing transportation services.  He starts his working day at the early hour of 6:00am, and it ends depending on how well the day went, normally around 11:00pm.  He is 51 years old and lives in the Plan 3000 area.  He has five children, and two still depend on him.  The others work and go to school.  

He is asking for this loan to purchase an engine for his car and to do some car repairs, including electrical repairs and veneers.  His wife sells food in their home.  They are responsible people who seek well-being and improvement every day in order to have a secure old-age.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and purchase an engine.

loans.name: Bienvinido

texts.en:
Bienvinido, from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon, is 31 years old, married, and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Bienvinido owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, breads and green bananas in the local community. Engaged in his business for over a year, he earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 20111, Bienvinido joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting his first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and bananas, Bienvinido plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & bananas.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 60 years old. She has been raising broiler chickens for about 10 years, with an average income of about KES 9,000 per month. Her husband, Samuel, also contributes to the family income.
	
Anastacia is taking her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. She plans to use the loan to buy more broiler chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.  She hopes to have a big poultry farm and improve her standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy more broilers.

loans.name: Afrodita De Tolcayuca Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Afrodita de Tolcayuca" porque para las integrantes del grupo el nombre de “Afrodita” es muy representativo ya que es la diosa de la belleza. El grupo se ubica en el Estado de Hidalgo, en México. El grupo esta conformado por diez integrantes. La señora Xochitl es la presidenta del grupo. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, estudio la carrera técnica en Comercio. Xochitl se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene un negocio fijo en un lugar concurrido del municipio, su negocio es un bazar en la cual vende ropa y zapatos, ya tiene 14 años en su negocio. La señora Xochitl decidio dedicarse a la venta de ropa ya que le permiten obtener ingresos extras que le ayudan a solventar los gastos del hogar, así como apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios. La señora tiene dos hijos, uno de 15 y otro de 11 años respectivamente quienes estudian actualmente en la localidad. El prestamo que solicita es principalmente para la compra de un mostrador donde pueda ofrecer de una manera más visible sus artículos y esto poder ayudarle a incrementar sus ventas. Xochitl es conocita como una mujer que lucha por tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia además de que es una mujer emprendedora, responsable y con gran carisma para sus clientes, vecinos y familiares. La foto fue tomada en el negocio de la señora Xochilt. Con las ganancias que obtenga seguira invirtiendo en mercancia y para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called Afrodita de Tolcayuca because the name Aphrodite represents the Goddess of beauty.  The group is located in the state of Hidalgo in Mexico.  The group is comprised of ten members.

Xochitl is the president of the group.  She is 35 years old, and she studied for a technical career in business.  Xochitl sells clothes, and she has a fixed business in a very busy place in the municipality.  Her business is a bazaar where she sells clothes and shoes.  She has had the business for 14 years.

Xochitl decided to sell clothes because it allows her to get extra income.  This helps her pay the household expenses and helps with her children’s education.  She has two children, ages 15 and 10.  They are currently in the local school.

The loan she is requesting is mainly to buy a display case where she will be able to offer her goods in a more visible way.  This will help her increase her sales.

Xochitl is known as a woman who struggles to have a better quality of life for her family.  She is an enterprising and responsible woman with great charisma for her customers, neighbors, and family members.

The photo was taken at Xochilt’s business.  With the earnings that she gets she will continue investing in merchandise and paying for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a display case for clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Sixta Justina

texts.es:
Sixta es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia y departamento Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos (1 independiente).  Tiene educación secundaria completa.
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres ciclos, su primer monto solicitado fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de ganados ovinos y vacunos.  También se dedica a la confección de artesanía como chompas, chalinas y ponchos, esto lo hace en sus ratos libres.
Con éste nuevo  préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará seis animales, los compra en las comunidades del distrito y los vende en Mañazo y Puno.  En el negocio trabaja sola.  Nos dice que sus hijos estudian.
Su sueño es tener un negocio de venta de comidas el cual le permitirá tener mayores ganancias.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es el compañerismo, compartir con las socias y las charlas respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Sixta is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de San José” which is located in the District of Mañazo, Province and Department of Puno. She is 39 years old, widowed, and has four children (one of whom is independent). Sixta completed her high school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for three loan cycles. The first loan she requested was in the amount of 500 PEN. The money was invested in her business of buying and selling sheep and cattle. In addition, she produces handicrafts such as sweaters, scarves, and ponchos during her free time.

With this new loan of 1000 PEN, she will buy six animals. Sixta will buy the animals in the communities within the district and sell them in Mañazo and Puno. She works alone in her business. Her children are in school.

Her dream is to have a business selling food so that she can earn more income. What she likes about the Communal Bank are the camaraderie, sharing with the other members, and the seminars that relate to business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Tanous

texts.en: Tanous is a 57-year-old married man from Lebanon, living with his wife and two young children who are still attending school. Despite his older age, he has been working as a taxi driver for the past 20 years. He operates a student van service in his town as well as in his neighboring villages. He also transports private clients upon their requests. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his van such as updating the paint, repairing the engine, etc. In the future, he is planning to purchase a new van and hire a part-time employee to work on it.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his van

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 21-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. Zeinab started her own business selling clothes in order to help her husband raise their children and cover most of their expenses. Zeinab is a woman with a good reputation; she is liked and supported by most of her customers.

Zeinab is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to prepare herself for the Eid Al Fitr holy celebration, often abbreviated to Eid, a three day Muslim holiday that marks the end of Ramadan, the Islamic holy month of fasting. Many people work hard to buy new clothes and shoes so their children can celebrate Eid in new clothes.

Zeinab also sells toys to increase her income and to attract children to various toys and gadgets. She hopes to improve her business and to provide her children with the best and healthy living.

loans.use: To increase her clothing and shoes inventory

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has operated her retail business for the last six months.  She normally sells her goods outside her house.She is twenty-four years old, single, and the mother of one school-going child.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to pay rent and move into a more permanent place from where to sell.

In future, she hopes to grow her retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: To pay rent and move to a more permanent place.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS DE BELLA MARIA ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Sergio tiene 27 años de edad,  el socio es casado; el socio tiene 2 hijos, el socio trabaja taxista interprovincial, el socio tiene su unidad vehicular y traslada pasajeros desde el poblado de Urcos hasta Ocongate, el socio en esta ocasión requiere el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehículo, el socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehículo en el cambio de aceite y otros para ponerlo operativo para que siga transitando bien.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “The Triumphant Beautiful Mary” Bank that is located in the Ocongate District in the Quispicanchis Province in the Department of Cusco.
The member, named Sergio, is 27 years old. He is married with two children. He works as a taxi driver who drives between provinces. He has one vehicle and he transports passengers from the city of Urcos to Ocongate. This member would like this loan in order to maintain his vehicle. He would spend the money on oil changes and other necessities needed to keep his car operating and able to run well.
This member is thankful for the support of this loan and promises to pay his payments on time.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle by paying for oil changes and other necessities needed to keep his vehicle in working order so he can continue transporting his customers.

loans.name: Salomón

texts.es: Este cliente es un pequeño agricultor que se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como maíz, frijol y trigo, está solicitando para la compra de insumos tales como urea, completo insecticida y pago de mano de obra, es casado y de oficio agrónomo y los créditos los solicita al vencimiento para pagar una vez que la cosecha se haya levantado y comercializada.
texts.en:
This client is a small farmer who grows basic staples such as corn, beans, and wheat. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy supplies such as urea, insecticides, as well as pay for labor. He is married and has been in the agricultural trade.

The loans he has requested have been repaid as soon as his crops are harvested and sold.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy weaves and hair braids

loans.name: Rafiki Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavugho, leader du groupe d’affaire «Rafiki», est  entrepreneur, âgée de 40  ans, mariée, mère de plusieurs  enfants et petits fils et filles. Son mari est un chômeur. Elle est  vendeuse de d’habits dames (pagnes). Elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre il ya 7 ans. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  6 cycles avec  crédit de Hekima. Son premier capital fut  reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  15 pièces de pagnes à marchander  et réaliser d’autres micros projets de la famille.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et scolariser ses enfants.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: Client Kavugho, the leader of the business group “Rafiki,” is an entrepreneur.  She is 40 years old, married and the mother of several children and grandchildren.  Her husband is unemployed.  She sells women’s clothing (pagnes, which are brightly colored lengths of cloth).  She has been involved in this money-making work for 7 years.  She has been through 6 loan cycles with Hekima.  The first money she had came from her husband.  This new loan will allow her to buy 15 pagnes to sell and to carry out some other plans for the family.   She would also like to see her children grow up more comfortably and to be educated.  This client thanks Hekima for its work to benefit poor women who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to pay for 15 pagnes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 58 years old, married to Charles. She sells poultry and has been in the business for the past eight years. She gets a monthly income of KES 3,500.

This is her third loan from KADET. She repaid her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to buy poultry. She will buy dairy cattle with the anticipated profits. Her dream is to own a dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Todo Lo Puede En Cristo - Huancayo Group

texts.es: María Elena  D. 43 años D. edad casada, con un hija D. 14 años D. edad se caracteriza por ser muy alegre y ocurrente, ella es presidenta D. la Alcancía comunal “ TODO LO PUED. EN CRISTO”, elegida por ser carismática y tratable, ella tiene su bodeguita en su casa, el cual reparte a pedido D. sus clientes por su zona, ella usara el préstamo para la compra D. mercadería para su bodega y así satisfacer mejor los pedidos D. sus clientes, ella sueña con hacer crecer su negocio D. la bodega. Está ubicada en la segunda fila lado derecha con chompa negra y al lado D. ella esta su hija menor D. edad.
texts.en:
43-year old María Elena is married and has a 14-year old daughter. She is a lively and clever woman, and also the president of the Todo lo PueD. en Cristo Community Bank. She was chosen because she is charismatic and easy to get on with.

María Elena runs a small store out of her house and also delivers items to customers who live in her neighbourhood. She plans to use the loan money to buy more merchandise for her store so that she can better fulfill the requests of her customers. Her dream is to have a bigger business one day.

in the photo María Elena is second on the right wearing a black sweater. Her daughter is next to her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Aguacatitla Group

texts.es:
Grupo Aguacatitla (que significa lugar de los aguacates)
Doña Lucia es natal de un pueblito cuyo nombre significa piedras acomodadas, su lengua materna es el náhuatl, la señora comúnmente se dedica a las labores del hogar y también lleva a su niña al kínder, pero también atiende un negocio de tienda de abarrotes que inicio desde hace 4 años, ella piensa invertir más pues de esa forma ayudaría a su esposo en los gasto de la familia.
La señora Lucia es líder del grupo Aguacatitla cuyos integrantes son:
María Victoria-juegos de video
Marcolina-perfumeria
Rosa-venta de ropa
El grupo Aguacatitla está felizmente agradecido con KIVA y FRAC por el crédito que les fue otorgado, el cual se está invirtiendo en negocios de comercio, el grupo está totalmente seguro que sus inversiones serán prósperas.
texts.en:
Grupo Aguacatitla (Group of the place of the avocados) Doña Lucia was born in a small village whose name means “adapted stones”. Her mother tongue is náhuatl (an indigenous language). Doña Lucia usually dedicates herself to housework. She also takes her daughter to kindergarten and takes care of her business, a grocery shop that she began 4 years ago. She plans to invest more in the business since in this way she would help her husband with family expenses.

Señora Lucia is the leader of Grupo Aquacatitla whose other members are: María Victoria-video games Marcolina-perfume shop Rosa-clothing sales

Grupo Aguacatitla is very thankful to Kiva and FRAC for the loan, which will be invested in commercial businesses. The group is certain that their investments will prosper.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, cookies, toilet paper, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca de 41 años, es una mujer casada. Ella y Jesús, su esposo vieron nacer a 2 hijos, que actualmente tienen 21 y 7 años. Esta familia vive en armonía bajo un techo propio, en el distrito de Huasahuasi. Francisca y Jesús se dedican hace muchos atrás a la agricultura. En los terrenos agrícolas de su propiedad siembran papa, arvejas y olluco; productos que al cosecharlos derivan al mercado mayorista para su venta al por mayor. “Me conviene vender de esa manera, por que me evito que mis cosechan se pudran o malogren, así también gano dinero al instante”, explica. A la vez, en los pastizales y campo abierto que cuenta su comunidad alimentan a sus animales, como son: carneros y chanchos. A éstos cría y engorda. Después de 4 o 5 meses los vende, ganando por ganado alrededor de 100 soles. En los meses de diciembre y enero, los ofrece a mayor precio, por ser fechas de fiestas navideñas y año nuevo. Francisca, se ve más adelante como una productora mayorista que expenderá verduras, hortalizas y tubérculos al por mayor, no sólo en la ciudad de Tarma, sino que piensa viajar a otras ciudades. Sabe que el precio fuera de la ciudad le será más conveniente. Con su apoyo podrá acceder a su préstamo número 13 de MFP, por eso se muestra firme en su decisión de pagar las cuotas en los días establecidos. Además comenta que compartir intereses y metas, es lo que más le agrada de su banco comunal. “Estoy preparando una siembra de papas para mayo, para eso compraré bolsas de abono y fertilizantes”, manifiesta. Sacando sus cálculos, Francisca invertirá 1200 soles aproximadamente.
texts.en:
Francisca, 41, is a married woman. She and Jesús, her husband, had two children who are currently 21 and 7 years old.   This family lives in harmony in their own house in the Huasahuasi district.  Francisca and Jesús have been farmers for many years.  They grow potatoes, peas and ‘olluco’ [an Andean tuber] on farmland they own and when harvested they are sold at the local wholesale market.  “It’s advantageous for me to sell that way because I avoid my crops rotting or deteriorating and this way I earn money instantly,” she explains.  They also feed their animals, calves and pigs, on the community’s open fields and pasture lands.  She raises these animals to fatten them up and sell after about four or five months; she sells them head by head for about 100 soles.  During December and January she sells them at higher prices because of Christmas and New Year.

Francisca sees herself in the future as a wholesaler selling vegetables, leafy vegetables and tubers at wholesale not only in the city of Tarma but she also plans to go to other cities.  She knows that prices outside the city will be more convenient.

With your support she’ll be able to access MFP loan #13 so she is firm in her determination to make her installment payments according to the established payment plan.  She also comments that sharing interests and goals is what she likes best about her communal bank.  “I’m preparing for the May potato planting so will buy sacks of manure and fertilizer,” she states.  According to her calculations, Francisca will invest 1200 soles approximately.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bulls for slaughtering

loans.name: Miguel Christian

texts.es:
Miguel sigue participando en el banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Miguel sigue estudiando la carrera profesional de Turismo en una de las universidades particular de la ciudad del Cusco y está cursando el séptimo semestre. Actualmente, Miguel está trabajando en una de las veterinarias de la ciudad del Cusco. 
En esta oportunidad Miguel requiere el préstamo para pagar su matricula de la universidad.     

Miguel se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Miguel continues to participate in the communal back "Chaska" of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco.  Miguel continues studying the professional tourism career in one of the universities in the city of Cusco and is in his seventh semester.  Currently, Miguel is working in one of the veterinary clinics in the city of Cusco.  At this opportunity, Miguel needs the loan to pay for his university tuition.  

Miguel finds himself grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium and thus, promises to complete his payments according to the timeline.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a very hard working woman who has been practicing mixed farming for over five years. She also has a hotel, which she manages as a secondary business. She is 29 years old and married. She and her husband have two children. 

She is applying for her second loan. She plans to use part of the loan to buy farm inputs like maize seeds and fertilizers and the other part to purchase more food stuffs for her hotel business. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children’s school fees. 

She hopes to develop her business and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel is a married woman with 2 children. She and her husband run a fishing business in Trinidad, Bohol. Michel's husband operates their fishing boat to catch fish. Michel sells his catch at the market. Michel does her best to improve their income and sustain their family.

Michel has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials. Michel hopes to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: Aurelia, de 37 años, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos. Juntos habitan en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Aurelia, trabaja como agricultor desde los 16 años, y actualmente cultiva cacao. Nos comenta que cuando se separó de su esposo ella se quedó con los bienes de la familia, además de encargarse ella sola por el bienestar de sus hijos. Generalmente trabaja con la ayuda de peones, quienes le facilitan en el cultivo y cosecha, así solo le quedaría expenderlo a los acopiadores de cacao, siendo ellos los que trasladan sus productos desde el campo hacia su centro de acopio. Aurelia en un futuro piensa en construir una vivienda con material noble, y para ello está ahorrando. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por lo se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Ella esta agradecida con los integrantes de su banco comunal por permitir acceder al grupo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su campo agrícola, por lo que contratará peones.
texts.en:
Thirty-seven-year-old Aurelia is a single mother who has four children.  They live together in the populated center of Canayre in the Llochegua District.  Aurelia has worked as a farmer for 16 years and she currently grows cacao.  She tells us that when she left her husband she got the family's assets and she was also left to take care of her children on her own.  She usually works with the help of laborers who help with the planting and harvesting; that way all she has to do is pay the cacao collectors, who are the ones who transport her products from the fields to the collection center.  

In the future, Aurelia is thinking about building a home out of fine materials and she saving up to do this.  This will be her second loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time.  She is thankful to the members of her communal bank for letting her join.  She will invest the 1,000 nuevos soles in maintaining her fields by hiring laborers.

loans.use: to hire laborers

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a 37 year old married man.  He has a daughter who is 5 years old.  He describes himself to be an honest and God fearing man. 

He operates a retail store where he sells beauty and pesonal care products such as hairbands, cutex, razor blades etc.  He has been involved in this business for 6 years.  His business is located in a conducive environment.  He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more beauty products. 

Timothy's business goal is to expand his general store within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products such as hair bands, braids, cutex, etc

loans.name: Ana Griselda

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 22 años de edad, está soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos, se dedica a la venta de platillos típicos, tiene más de 5 años dedicándose al negocio, lo aprendió de su madre, la manera de vender es ambulante, desde las 3:00pm hasta las 7:00pm.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de yuca, papas, salsa, queso, aceite, que son los materiales  necesarios para la elaboración de los platillos típicos, este crédito le ayudara para invertir más en el negocio, su riesgo con la venta ambulante es la época de invierno, cuando por las tardes llueve y no les deja espacio para salir a vender.
Los sueños de Ana son mantener el negocio y crecer, ya que esto le permitirá mejorar los ingresos para sus padres.

loans.use: Compra de yuca, papas, salsa, queso, aceite.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 62 years old and lives in Canunan, Guipos, ZDS. She is widowed with 3 children.                       

To earn a living, Lorelie has a business selling snacks. She earns about 4 thousand pesos each month doing this type of work. Lorelie has requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.                   

Lorelie has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Lorelie would like to have more distribution of her snacks.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Mama Egue's Group

texts.fr:
Créer depuis le 20 Novembre 2013, il existe une bonne connexion entre les membres du groupe. Elles entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame  Mama (assise à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 35 ans mariée et mère de 05 garçons. Elle est vendeuse de beignets, d'huile raffiné et de condiments. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires. 

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 1 bidon de 20 litres d’huile à 15000f, 1 sac de 50 kg de farine  à 20000f , 01 sac de sucre de 50 kg à 25000f pour faire ses beignets et des légumes pour les revendre en détails.

 Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte renforcer ses épargnes et aider son mari dans la dépenses quotidienne et le paiement de la scolarités de ses enfants.
texts.en:
A good relationship exists between the members of this group created on November 20, 2013. They stand in solidarity and help one another. Their main business is retail.

Mrs. Mama (sitting all the way to the right) is the group’s highlighted borrower. She is 35 years old, married, and mother to five boys. She sells fried dough, oil, and condiments. She procures her supplies from weekly markets and then retails the products.

With this new loan, she plans to purchase one jug of oil (15,000 XOF), one bag of flour (20,000 XOF), 1 bag of sugar (20,000) and to give seed money (5,000 XOF). With profits, she increases her savings.

loans.use: to buy one jug of oil (15,000 XOF), one bag of flour (20,000 XOF), 1 bag of sugar (20,000) and to give seed money (5,000 XOF).

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen  is a hard working lady. She initiated her buisness selling  milk as it was diffucult to run household activities with the small income of her husband.  She is 31 years old married woman.  She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Yasmeen ’s job is to look after the buffalos and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Yasmeen  has requested for 45000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 56 years old married with 5 children, 2 are still depending on her even after finishing school due to unemployment. She has been in this business for 8 years and deals more with fast moving consumer goods e.g. rice, sugar, maize flour and cereals. Cereals have higher returns and their prices are not as volatile as the rest of the products.

loans.use: She would like to stock cereals because of having higher returns.

loans.name: Inglab

texts.en: Inglab has been engaged in this business for 6 years. He is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region, settled in Sumgait city. He has 2 children. He has his own mini shop. This 63-year-old man is the only breadwinner in family. Having borrowed the loan amount of $300 from Normicro he rented the grocery store. The second time he borrowed $500 and bought foodstuffs: sugar, tea, rice and etc. Now Inglab wants loan amount of $500 to increase the range of goods and to buy the new refrigerator.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods and to buy the new refrigerator

loans.name: Evgeniy

texts.en:
In Ukraine, many people prefer wearing sports shoes to any other kind of shoe. Evgeniy is one of those people. After trying out a couple of other business ventures, he found that he liked selling sports shoes the most. He credits his success to finding a good market opportunity and to timely financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine. His integrity and hard-working attitude have allowed him to establish his business and keep it stable.

After 7 years in business, Evgeniy was recently able to add on to his sales location. Today he is requesting $1000 to stock this additional retail space with new brands of shoes, which he will be able to purchase in bulk. Evgeniy and his wife Anjela are the proud parents of two sons, who they are currently helping through college. His desire is to increase his productivity and raise his net income so that he can continue to provide for his family.

В Україні багато людей віддають перевагу спортивному взуттю. Євген - один з таких людей. Спробувавши себе в різних сферах, він вирішив, що продаж спортивного взуття йому насправді до душі. Євген вважає, що досяг успіху, бо знайшов власну нішу на ринку та отримав вчасну підтримку від „Надії України”. Порядність та наполеглива праця допомогли йому досягти стабільності в роботі. Євген займається цим бізнесом вже 7 років. Зовсім нещодавно він зміг придбати нову торгову точку. Зараз він просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб оптом закупити товар для нового кіоску та поповнити асортимент взуття новими моделями. Євген з дружиною Анжелою виховують двох синів, які вчаться в університеті. Євген хоче підвищити продуктивність торгівлі та отримати чистий прибуток для того, щоб і надалі забезпечувати родину усім необхідним.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old and works with his brother in a laundry. He and his brother are responsible for taking care of a big family. This is his first loan from AL-Aman. He want sto paint the shop and repair the laundry machine. He wants to increase his income and open a new branch of his shop in another place.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Paint the shop and repair the laundry machine

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
Isidora is a weaver. She weaves blankets made out of "poyvi" which is a type of fabric/needlework traditional to Carapegua, the city where she lives. She is married and has 5 children who are all currently in college.

She started weaving about 17 years ago which she believes is a talent she inherited from her mother. Since she couldn't finish school, Isidra had to work at a very young age to survive. She later married Aurelio Britez who is a hard worker and he sells the "poyvi" blankets that she makes by travelling throughout the city.

Aurelio travels with his dad who knows the city like the palm of his hands. He taught Aurelio how to be a good salesman and a good business man too. They travelled as far as Asuncion (Paraguay's capital) once a week to sell blankets to the stores around the capital.

Both Isidra and Aurelio want to one day see all their kids graduate from college and to get a good job without having to suffer or to put up with difficult times in the streets like bad weather in order to feed their family.

Isidora is requesting a loan in order to purchase a vast amount of thread in different colors to meet her clients high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Isidra es tejedora de mantas de “poyvi” un tejido tradicional de la zona donde reside: Carapeguá, ella es casada y tiene 5 hijos todos cursando actualmente sus estudios secundarios. La actividad la inició hace 17 años por que es una habilidad heredada de su madre. Ya que no pudo terminar sus estudios, Isidra, tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven para generar ingreso y ganarse el pan de cada día, luego se casó con Aurelio Brítez, una persona muy emprendedora que se encarga de vender de forma ambulante las mantas de poyvi que teje Isidra. Aurelio viaja con su padre, un antiguo conocedor del rubro, quien le enseño la habilidad en las ventas de estos productos a crédito en los barrios residenciales de Asunción (capital del Paraguay). Es así que Aurelio viaja una vez por semana a la capital a vender las mantas y frazadas a tiendas de la capital. Ambos sueñan con ver a sus hijos terminar sus estudios y adquirir una profesión, sin tener que pasar el duro sacrificio de soportar en la calle frío, lluvia y calor para acercar el pan para la familia. Isidra solicita el crédito pues necesita comprar hilos de algodón de diferentes colores y en grandes cantidades, ya que han aumentado la demanda de mantas de diferentes colores hecha por sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase more thread in multiple colors

loans.name: Reina Martínez

texts.en:
Reina, 57, is married and is mother of a large family. In fact, the couple has eleven children.

Reina owns a clothing store. She started her business ten years ago. She buys garments in Santo Domingo, the capital, or Dajabón, located on the border with Haiti, where she finds variety and good prices.

The businesswoman is requesting a loan which will be used to purchase a large amount of clothes to be sold during the holiday season. Given this loan, Reina will be able to help her husband deal with their housing issues.

loans.use: To purchase garments to be sold during the holiday season and expand her business

loans.name: Tulia

texts.es:
Tulia belongs to the Banco Comunal Fray Martín of the A. H. Faustino Maldonado Mz E Lt 9, of the Calleria district in the Department (State) of Ucayali. She is 52 years old and is the mother of 5 children. She's separated from her husband and supports her children on her own. For this reason, Tulia, with her first loan provided by Manuela Ramos of 300.00 soles, decided to set up a small stand to sell chickens.

Tulia gets up at 3 in the morning to slaughter and cut up the chickens and sell them. Her children help her with the housework, giving that she finishes selling at 10 in the morning.

With the recent loan received from from Manuela Ramos which will be paid back in 4 months, she will be able to extend her reach to sell to more people, buy 2 cages in which to put the chickens, buy 100 chickens and a plastic container in which to store the giblets.

Tulia is very happy that she can count on this business. Thanks to her business, she can educate her children and pay for the needs of the home.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Tulia pertenece al Banco Comunal Fray Martín, del A. H. Faustino Maldonado Mz E Lt 9 del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años y es madre D. 5 hijos, está separada D. su esposo y sola tiene que trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Por esta razón es que Tulia, con el primer préstamo D. Manuela Ramos D. S/ 300.00 soles, deciD. poner un pequeño puesto D. venta D. pollos (aves para consuno). Tulia se levanta a las 3.00 D. la mañana para beneficiar a los pollos y venderlos, sus hijos le ayudan con las tareas D. la casa dado que termina D. vender a las 10.00 D. la mañana. Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos el cual será pagado en 4 meses, ampliará el local del negocio y comprará 2 jabas para poner los pollos, 100 pollos y un embace para conservar la menudencia. Tulia está muy contenta D. contar con este negocio, dado que gracias a ello pueD. educar a sus hijos así como costear las necesidades D. la casa.

loans.use: Purchase of chicken cages and chickens and be able to extend her reach to sell to more customers.
